While Mrs. Leonor occupies herself with this noble profession, her husband takes advantage of the employment he is offered, and between both of them the couple is able to cover their home expenses. This responsible and dedicated mother counts on your loan, which will allow her to purchase a greater quantity of pigs and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

Sus bajos recursos económicos no fueron obstáculo para que Doña Leonor concrete sus proyectos, ésta diligente madre es consciente que para alcanzar sus sueños tiene que esforzarse y perseverar en su negocio de compra y venta de porcinos, adquiere sus animalitos de los distritos de Taraco y Samán, luego de alimentarlos y engordarlos para que adquieran un adecuado peso y talla los vende a precios más elevados obteniendo un considerable porcentaje de ganancias.Mientras doña Leonor se dedica a esta noble labor su esposo Marcelino trata de aprovechar los diferentes trabajos eventuales que se le presenta y entre ambos cubren los gastos de su hogar, en esta oportunidad esta responsable y dedicada madre desea contar con vuestro apoyo, apoyo que le permitirá mejorar su capital de inversión

loans.use: Purchasing a greater quantity of pigs.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan is father of 5 children who are he adores. Due to separation from his wife three years ago, a situation that was difficult to overcome, Juan makes the effort, especially for his children who miss their mom. He cannot be with his children as much as he would like, but by working he tries to satisfy their needs. Juan started a call center business for the population, who are very appreciative of the service they receive from Juan, and he happily tends the calls of his neighbors.

Nevertheless, he plans to open a store where, among other things, he will install a speaker-phone to provide services to the rest of his neighbors. In order to do this, he requires a loan of $375 that he is asking of you, hoping to appeal to you good heart. He hopes that you are the person in whom Juan has so much hope.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Juan es padre de 5 hijos quienes son su adoración, debido a la separación con su esposa hace más de 3 años, situación que fue difícil de superar sobre todo por sus pequeños hijos a quienes extraña y por quienes se esfuerza, no puede estar con ellos tanto como quisiera, pero con su trabajo trata de satisfacer las necesidades de ellos. Juan inició un negocio al servicio de los pobladores, quienes se encuentran muy agradecidos por la atención que reciben de parte de Juan quien muy alegremente atiende las llamadas de sus vecinos. Pero sin embargo, tiene planes de abrir una tienda donde, a la par, instalar un locutorio y así ampliar su servicio a los demás vecinos. Pero para esto, requiere de un préstamo de 1000 soles que solicita a usted teniendo la esperanza de poder apelar a su buen corazón. Esperamos que usted sea la persona a quien Juan tanto espera.

loans.use: Capital to open a general store and to increase his telephone service.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong K., age 51, is a true entrepreneur and lives in Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia. In the morning, she sells rice in front of the garment factory and in the evening she sells various kinds of dessert. Between the two businesses, she can make up to US$ 15 in revenue a day. Her husband earns around US$ 7 in profit a day as well, working as a painter. This couple has three children, one of whom, the oldest daughter, helps her mother selling rice and desserts and the other two are students.

To earn more profit, Hong has requested a loan from Kiva via "Credit", Kiva's local partner, of US$ 1200 to purchase a generator, television, DVD player, speaker and other things to run a Karaoke business. Any remainder of the loan money is to be used to fix up the little restaurant. In the future, Hong wants to diversify her products to meet her customers' demand. (Hong is pictured with her oldest daughter by her little restaurant.)

loans.use: To purchase a generator, television, DVD player, speaker and other things to run a Karaoke business

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es:
Martha inicio el negocio porque necesitaba de un ingreso propio para poder ayudar a sus padres, ya que es soltera y ellos dependen de ella. Empezó hace 5 años vendiendo ropa a sus vecinos y amigos quienes la fueron recomendando hasta que logro hacerse de clientes, lo que le permitió mejorar sus ingresos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $ 400 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y así continuar con su negocio. :
texts.en:
Martha started the business because she needed to generate her own income to help her parents, given that she is single and they depend on her. She started five years ago selling clothing to her neighbors and friends. They started to recommend her business until she was able to build a customer base, which allowed her to improve her earnings.

She needs a loan of $400 USD, which she will repay over six months, to purchase merchandise and in this way be able to continue with her business.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Fikreta

texts.en: Fikreta M. was born in 1972, and she is married and has two children. Fikreta and her husband are owners of a store and they have worked there for a long time. They have their constant clients and the business is good. Fikreta and her husband are expanding it little by little. Fikreta was already a WWI client, and this is her second loan. She will use this loan to buy products for reselling in her store. She hoops that her store will run as better and that their children will have good businesses also in the future.

loans.use: To buy products for reselling

loans.name: Gpt Satou Toure Group

texts.fr:
LES MEMEBRES DE CE GROUPEMENT EVOLUE DANS LE COMMERCE DE TISSUS PENDANT TRES LONGTEMPS AU QUARTIER MEDINATOUL DE DIOURBEL.
AVEC LE PRET, ELLES COMPTENT RENFORCER LEUR ACTIVITE.
texts.en:
The members of this group have been working in cloth sales for a very long time in the Medinatoul district of Diourbel.

With this loan, they are expecting to bolster their businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolstering their working capital

loans.name: Ligia Argentina

texts.es:
La joven madre Ligia Argentina González H. tiene 26 años de edad es madre soltera y tiene dos hijas menores de edad, vive sola y desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de zapatos de variados estilos y marcas y de ropa de hombres, mujeres y niños.

Esta actividad le ha permitido poder mantener a sus dos pequeñas hijas ya que el padre de ambas se encuentra fuera del país y las abandono, por lo que este negocio es el único ingreso que tiene esta microempresaria. Según  la joven señora González la ventaja de este negocio es que para que este producto pierda su valor se requiere mucho tiempo y las ventas en épocas de fin de año son buenas por lo que le permite tener buenas ganancias.

Además que el producto que no pueda vender en fin de año lo puede vender para el inicio de las clases principalmente a niños y niñas. Esta solicitando el financiamiento para la compra de:

10 pares de zapatos de cuero de hombre a US$ 13 cada par, 10 pares de zapatos blancos de niña a US$ 8 cada par, 10 pares de sandalias de mujer a US$ 9 cada par, 10 pares de sandalias de niños a US$ 5 cada par, 10 pares de zapatos Roy de niños a US$ 12 cada par, 10 vestidos de niñas a US$ 5 cada vestido y 10 pantalones Blue jeans de hombres a US$ 8 cada pantalón.
texts.en:
Young mother Ligia Argentina González H. is 27 years old, is a single mother and has two young daughters. She lives alone and for three years has been dedicated to selling shoes of various styles and brands, as well as clothing for men, women and children. This job has allowed her to be able to take care of her two small daughters since their father left the country and abandoned them. This business is the only income that this small businesswoman has. According to young Ms. González, the advantage of this business is that for this product to lose its value it requires a lot of time and sales at the end of the year are good which allows her to have good earnings. In addition, products that she cannot sell at the end of the year, she can sell at the start of classes, mainly to children. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of: 10 pairs of leather men's shoes at US$ 13 per pair, 10 pairs of white girl's shoes at US$ 8 per pair, 10 pairs of women's sandals at US$ 9 per pair, 10 pairs of children's sandals at US$ 5 per pair, 10 pairs of Roy children's shoes at US$ 12 per pair, 10 girls dresses at US$ 5 per dress and 10 pairs of men's blue jeans at US$ 8 per pair.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 10 pairs of leather men's shoes, 10 pairs of white girl's shoes, 10 pairs of women's sandals, 10 pairs of children's sandals, 10 pairs of Roy children's shoes, 10 girls dresses and 10 pairs of men's blue jeans.

loans.name: Sok Khim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok Khim C. is a villager in Ta Sen village in Kampong Cham province. She is a rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock and re-sell later at a better price. She wants to expand because all farmers are collecting the rice revenue during rice harvesting season. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase more rice to keep in stock and re-sell later. She hopes to increase her income and provide a better life for her family with this new loan.

Her husband, Mr. Leng Ean, has a motorbike taxi and can make a small income to support the family. Mrs. Sok Khim C. is 56 years old and the mother of a child who is a fruit seller in the market. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to purchase more rice to keep in stock and re-sell later.

loans.name: Koudzo

texts.fr: Koudzo N. est un conducteur de taxi moto à Kpalimé, une ville situé à environ 120 kilomètres au nord-ouest de Lomé. Etant donné que moto est désuète, il aimerait avec ce crédit s’acheter une nouvelle moto afin de redonner de relancer son  activité. Ceci lui permettra de gagner plus pour rembourser son emprunt et aussi d’épargner plus.
texts.en:
Koudzo N. is a motorcycle taxi driver in Kpalimé, a city located approximately 120 kilometers northwest of Lomé. Since his motorcycle is old, he would like to use this loan to buy a new one, in order to bolster his business. This will enable him to make more money, to repay his loan and to save.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Mauro Ruben

texts.es:
Rubén es socio del Banco Comunal Juanito.
Rubén es soltero y tiene 31 años, Rubén tiene una tienda en un local alquilado ubicado en una calle concurrida en donde confecciona y vende cortinas, también brinda el servicio de instalación de rieles, la confección de las cortinas lo realiza Rubén junto a su pareja.
Rubén necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de secadores, forros, toallas.
Los sueños de Rubén son tener casa propias, implementar un taller grande de confección y tener local propio.
texts.en:
Rubén is a member of the Communal Bank of Juanito. He is single and 31 years old. He rents a shop located in a busy street where he designs and sells curtains. He also provides a service to install curtain rails. He completes the design of the curtains together with a partner. Rubén requires a loan of 1000 soles ($325), which will be invested in buying driers, linings and towels. Rubén's dreams are to own his own house, have a big design workshop and own his own premises.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy driers, linings and towels.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki has had her own small charcoal and firewood store in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for 1 year. She belongs to Tudumishe Umoja group (Group code 2054). She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 90. Every day she works at her business. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal and firewood for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Riziki is 24 years old, married, and has one child, age 2.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business

loans.name: Alicia Martina

texts.es:
La socia ALICIA; tiene 49 años de edad, ella es casada y aún  no tiene hijos.

La socia es economista de profesión y recientemente se caso, ella y su esposo pusieron un gimnasio, el cual ahora desean implementarlo un poco más, para esto ella necesita este préstamo para comprar máquinas de gimnasia.

La socia agradece el préstamo otorgado para la realización de su negocio, y valora y agradece el préstamo y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de la deuda y más adelante solicitar otro préstamo para implementar su gimnasio a medida que la gente vaya conociéndolo.
texts.en:
Alicia is 49 years old and is married but she has no children.

She is an economist by profession and she recently married. She and her husband set up a gym which they would like to continue expanding. For this to happen she requires a loan to purchase exercise machines.

She is grateful for the loan to imparted to her for the development of her buiness. She values it and is grateful for it and she promises to repay the loan. Later on she hopes to apply for another loan as her business grows.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase exercise equipment.

loans.name: Abdukayum

texts.ru: Абдукаюм Мамидов 1965 года рождения, женат имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. Абдукаюм выращивает с детства скот. Из скотов у него козы и овцы, они выдерживают зиму, чем коровы. Весной он сажает в своем огороде овощи и корневые продукты. Для продажи и для себя. В их селе почти все обеспечены , овощами, молоком и мясом. Потому что у всех есть и огород так и скот. Также он работает фермером в одном из колхозе. Кредит получает на покупку скота. О кредите узнал у соседей.
texts.en:
Abdukayum M. was born in 1965, he is married and has 5 children. He has a high school education. Abdukayum has been raising livestock since childhood. He has goats and sheep, they handle winters better than cows. In the summer he plants vegetables and root vegetables in his garden – for himself and for sale. In his village almost everyone has enough vegetables, milk and meat, because everyone has a garden and livestock. In addition, he works as a farmer at one of the collective farms. He is taking out a loan to purchase livestock. He found out about the loan from neighbors.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of livestock

loans.name: Wenna

texts.en: Wenna C. is forty-six years old, married, and lives at San Vicente Alto, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She has two children. Her husband is a security guard. In order to help her husband from home, she decided to raise pigs for an additional source of income. Wenna also ventures into poultry raising or anything just to earn a living. She became a micro-entrepreneur because of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, one of Kiva's field partners. This coop teaches women to have their own livelihood project to support their husband’s income. She has been granted loans several times. Now, she is applying for $325 to buy feed for her pigs and chickens. She also wants to purchase a franchise for using their motorcycle for hire. Everything is easy for her because she’s happy with what she’s doing and her husband is very supportive of her.

loans.use: To buy feed for pigs and chickens and a franchise for motorcycle

loans.name: Muon

texts.en:
Muon Y. was born in 1984 and is a resident of Siem Reap province. She has been married for a long time but has no children. She grows vegetables on farmland that she inherited from her grandparents. To help supply the family with more food, her husband works as a local construction worker.

Muon Y. will use the loan money to purchase a plot of land near her house in order to grow other types of crops. The loan will help the family to attain a better standard of living and provide them a new fixed asset.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of land

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin is 40 years old, married and has four children. She makes a living selling stationery and various provisions. Toyin is applying for this loan to buy more items to sell, and wishes to extend her thanks and appreciation to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 32 years old and a divorced mother with three kids. All the kids are currently in school. She says selling jewelry is very profitable and therefore has been selling jewelry in the local market for three years to support her family’s needs. With the loan, Lucy wants to buy an increased supply of jewelry to increase her inventory and sales for a good income. She believes this loan would help her save some money to start paying part of the children's school fees and utility bills. She is a member of the group called ‘God is the best’.

loans.use: To buy jewelry in bulk

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es: Don Humberto tiene 47 años de edad, reside en el barrio Hialeah en la capital de Managua, su esposa le tiene tres hijos de 10, 11 y 13  y están estudiando,  su esposa vende tortillas para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos, su trabaja es de fontanero y tiene veinticinco años de estar laborando, ha tenido poca oportunidad para cambia r de puesto. Su anhelo es poder trabajar por cuenta propia y tener todas las herramientas necesaria para hacer su trabajo, con esta solicitud quiere compra materiales de construcción, para construir un cuarto y tener privacidad. sus planes es  poder seguir mejorando su vivienda para ofrecer a su familia un techo digno. Da las gracias Afodenic por los beneficios alcanzados.
texts.en:
47-year old Don Humberto lives in the neighbourhood of Hialeah in the capital city Managua with his wife and their three children aged 10, 11, and 13. The children attend school, and his wife sells tortillas to help her husband with expenses. Humberto is a plumber, a job he has been doing for 25 years. He has had few opportunities to pursue a different line of work. His biggest wish is to have his own business with all the tools necessary to carry out his trade. With this loan he plans to buy construction materials to build a room onto his house to give the family added privacy. He is hoping in the future to continue improving the house so that his family will have a nice home. Humberto is grateful to Kiva partner Afodenic for the improvements that he has already made.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction material to add a room to his house

loans.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es: El señor Pedro José L. P. actualmente tiene 3 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad. Tiene  52 años, El señor P. L. posee un taller de carpintería el cual está ubicado en su casa de habitación. El realiza sus ventas principalmente por encargos. Don Pedro P. dio inicio a su negocio hace 30 años, el cual surgió como una necesidad para sustentar a su familia. El crédito será invertido en la compra de materias primas para su negocio, ya que actualmente posee una buena cantidad de pedidos. Su sueño siempre ha sido ampliar el negocio y comprar activos fijos en el futuro que le permitan desarrollar un trabajo de mayor calidad.
texts.en:
Sr. Pedro José L. P. has 3 older children, and is 52 years old. Sr. P. L. owns a carpentry workshop, which is located in his own home. He makes his sales primarily through jobs by request. Don Pedro P. initially began his business 30 years ago, which arose from the necessity to support his family.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of raw materials for his business, since he currently has a good amount of requests. His dream has always been to expand his business and buy fixed assets in the future to allow him to develop work of the highest quality.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda T. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 23-years old, married and has one school-aged child. Glenda owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling clothing products in the local community. Glenda is just starting this business.

In 2007, Glenda joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Glenda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Glenda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Glenda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase clothing

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah lives in Lagos State, Nigeria, and is 36 years old and married without children. She sells textbooks and notebooks from her home. Deborah is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more textbooks and notebooks to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more textbooks and notebooks to sell

loans.name: Glendys

texts.es:
Glendys es una mujer jovial y emprendedora de 23 años de edad, madre de una niña de 2 añitos, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, ella vende junto a su mamá y sus hermanas, paralelamente tiene unpequeño negocio de decoraciones de tortas.
Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es chofer de motocarro (propio) y también le ayuda a repartir sus productos. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Siete Estrellas" desde hace dos años.
El primer préstamo que recibió fue de 300 soles, en esa oportunidad invirtió en la compra de gaseosas.
Con este crédito de S/ 2,000 soles, invertirá una parte en productos de belleza y otra parte invertirá en compra de materiales para decorar tortas. La meta de Glendis es poder llegar atener un local propio para la venta de sus productos .
texts.en:
Glendys is a cheerful person, a businesswoman at 23 years old, and mother to a 2-year old girl. She works in catalog sales of beauty products. She sells together with her mother and sisters. She has a small business on the side, decorating cakes.

She has the help of her husband, who owns and operates a motorized rickshaw and also helps her distribute her products. They have been part of the communal bank, “Siete Estrellas,” for two years.

The first loan that they received was for 300 soles, and they used this opportunity to invest in the purchase of sodas.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beauty products and materials for decorating cakes

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is managing a hog raising business. She wants a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP5,000 for the maintenance of her livestock business.  She is 54 years old and already a widow. She solely provides for the family's needs at home through her income and managing their farm in their village.  

She is very determined to provide the needs of her family towards the improvement of her hog raising business. She hopes that lenders will provide her financial help so that someday, she will also give her niece a good future by continuously sending her to school.

loans.use: Additional capital for her hog raising business

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina E. is from the village of Owaon. She is 47 years old. Rizalina is married and has 3 school-age children. To make a living, Rizalina raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Rizalina has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and makes approximately 2,500 PHP per month.

In 2007, Rizalina joined PMPC in order to gain access to financial services that could help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rizalina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Rizalina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Rizalina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fifteen sheep and feed.

loans.name: Enkhtur

texts.en:
Enkhtur lives with his wife in a house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife is pregnant and stays at home while Enkhtur operates a taxi service. Enkhtur began driving a taxi in 2007 and paid 33,000 tugrugs (~23 USD) per day in rental fees for a car to drive. Since then, he has managed to save enough money to not only buy his own car in order to operate his business, but he also managed to build his own house. He would like to keep earning more profit so that he can improve his growing family’s living standards. Enkhtur is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase repair parts for his taxi. About XacBank: XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.
To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.
To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Koy

texts.en:
Koy S., 30, is a low-income person living in Siem Reap province. She raises many pigs in a stall next to her house, to earn her living. She learned the skill of raising pigs from her grandfather and has used her knowledge to earn money for years. Usually, she will sell all her pigs to a buyer four months after she begins raising them.

Koy S. is married with three young children, while her husband is a rice miller. To save money, Koy S. also collects the leftovers from rice milling to feed her pigs.

Because her pig business is very profitable, Koy S. is looking for capital to purchase many piglets to raise.

loans.use: To purchase many piglets to raise

loans.name: Las Cardenales Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Cardenales” esta representada por la señora Hilda y conformada por 11 miembros que a pesar de ser un grupo nuevo muestran bastante entusiasmo por la adquisición del crédito. Cada una de las socias tienen sus pequeños puestos de de venta de diferentes productos como dulces, comida, sabanas, cosméticos y a la elaboración y venta de pan. En cuanto a la competencia se puede decir que es bastante alta pero las socias luchan cada día para obtener el ingreso necesario para el sustento de sus hogares, es por esta razón que requieren del préstamo para poder adquirir mayor mercadería al por mayor para poder rebajar sus precios y generar una mejor ganancia y así poderle brindar a su s familias una mejor calidad de vida. En cuanto a la experiencia muchas de las socias trabajaron con grupos solidarios en instituciones parecidas a la fundación Agrocapital, pero las socias están muy contentas por la confianza y el apoyo económico brindado, ya que con ello sus negocios podrán crecer y darles a sus hijos un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hilda represents the “Las Cardenales” group which has 11 members. They seem quite enthusiastic about acquiring the loan even though it is a new group. Each member of the group has her own small stand to sell the different products such as sweets, food, sheets, cosmetics and baking and selling bread. One could say that there is quite a lot of competition but the group members fight daily to get the income they need to support their homes. This is why they need a loan, in order to acquire more goods at wholesale, in order to lower their prices and generate a better profit. This way they can offer their families a better quality of life. As for experience, many of the group members have worked with solidarity groups at institutions similar to the Agrocapital foundation. The group members are very happy for the confidence and the economic support offered them since, with this, their businesses will be able to grow and they can give their children a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi started her fish and gari (a couscous-like grain made from grated cassava) business five years ago in a community market where she lives. She prepares and serves her customers with very tasty fish in the market and for that reason she is popular with many. As she lives by the coastal area in the central region of Ghana she gets the fresh fish before she smokes them. Many people buy from her in the market place.

Esi is 40 years old, is married, and is the mother of four children. Two of her children are currently in school; she supports her children from the business proceeds. She depends on that for their food, school bills and sometimes their medical bills.

Esi requests the loan to buy an increased stock of assorted fish to make increased sales and income to support her children’s education and her business growth. She hopes to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy gari in bulk and more fish

loans.name: Honorato

texts.en: Honorato P., 51 years old, owns a small rice field. He has seven children; the eldest is 26 years old. The farm that he has tilled for so many years has been very helpful to him and his family, allowing him to buy basic necessities for the home. He would like to increase his harvest. A loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. will really help him achieve his goals. If he gets a loan, he will buy fertilizers and farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Los Sueños Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal el llamado “Los sueños” y se conforma de 19 socios, pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco. Ellos tienen diferentes negocios, principalmente de venta de ropa de vestir y de casa, confección de buzos, peluquería, kioscos, venta de ensaladas,  venta de comida según época del año (humitas, empanadas) y repostería.
Sandra es una de las socias de este banco comunal, en la foto se encuentra a la izquierda, en 3º fila, esta detrás de su hija (22 años) que viste polerón negro. Sandra viene de una familia comerciante, su hija y su madre también son socias de “Los sueños”. Sandra tiene un kiosco establecido en su casa, y el préstamo lo ocupará para comprar principalmente tarjetas de recarga para celulares, y cigarros. Su meta es incluir a su negocio la venta de colaciones y su gran sueño es tener una microempresa familiar, podría ser de colectivos y un almacén para su hermana, para de esta manera ayudarlos a surgir y obtener una mejor calidad de vida.
A Sandra le motiva mucho trabajar con Fondo Esperanza  ya que tiene muy bajos intereses.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile) y posee una serie de balnearios lacustres y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
The Los Suenos community bank has 19 members, all from the Chilean city of Temuco. The members own a range of businesses: selling clothing; making sweaters for sale; hair-dressing; kiosk sales; salad sales; sales of seasonal foods (humitas, empanadas); and confectionery sales.

Sandra is one of the members of the group. She is in the third row, on the left, in the photo, just behind her daughter (22 years old) who is wearing a black coat. Sandra comes from a family of merchants. Her daughter and her mother are also members of Los Suenos. Sandra has a kiosk in her house and she will use most of the loan to buy charge cards for cell phones and cigars. Her goal is to create a business selling "colaciones" (a local snack). Her dream is to establish a family micro-business, possibly a store with her sister, something that would help them get ahead and enjoy a better quality of life.

Sandra very much likes working with Fondo Esperanza because it provides loans at very low interest rates. Temuco is the capital of the region of Araucania. The city is located 670 kilometers south of Santiago (the capital of Chile) near a chain of beautiful lakes. The region boasts a unique environment of plants and animals. Another interesting fact is that 50% of the population of the region is Mapuche, the indigenous people of Chile.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  sept femmes du groupe Benkadi sont toutes mariées. Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles au quartier Noukoula de la ville de Konobougou, préfecture de Baouréli, quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce d’articles divers essentiellement l’achat vente de condiments alimentaires et  des céréales.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les 4 prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur  5 prêt solidaire.
Elles comptent utiliser ce nouveau prêt pour acheter, 8 tonnes de céréales (haricot mil, maïs, fonio, riz) et  quelques paquets  de condiments alimentaires. 
Elles s’approvisionnent essentiellement sur place auprès des producteurs et grossistes et effectuent leurs ventes à Noukoula et au marché de Konobougou, au comptant en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30.000FCFA qui servira à étoffer leur fonds de commerce et subvenir aux dépenses ayant trait à la nourriture, à la scolarité des enfants et à la santé.
texts.en:
All seven women from the Benkadi group are married. On average they are 40 years of age with four children, and live in traditional households in the Noukoula neighborhood of Konobougou, in the Baouréli prefecture of the 4th administrative region of Mali. These women got to know each other through family ties and are retailers of various goods, for the most part culinary condiments and cereals. Having fully repaid their four previous loans, the women from the Benkadi group are now requesting a fifth group loan. They will use it to buy eight tons of cereal (beans, millet, corn, fonio, rice) and a few packages of culinary condiments. They get their supplies mainly from local producers and wholesalers, and sell their products at the Konobougou market, for cash or on credit, to a customer base of both women and men. They hope to achieve average monthly earnings of 30,000 FCFA each, which will be used to increase their working capital and contribute to family expenses regarding food, children’s education and healthcare.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food products

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Ángela tiene 42 años, ella tiene más de 5 años de tener este negocio que es la compra y venta de ropa. Cuando empezó a vender fue porque su familia estaba pasando por una crisis económica muy difícil poco a poco logro invertir en lo suficiente para comprar ciertos productos pues tenía ciertos clientes ellos mismos lograron darle fama que se merece fue así que decidió seguir adelante pues todos los días se levanta muy temprano. Con este negocio pues es el único medio de vida que tenia. El financiamiento que actualmente está solicitando es para la compra de materia prima como pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos y trajes formales. Su deseo es proporcionarle  sus hijos una educación digna.
texts.en:
Ángela is 42 years old and has been managing her business of buying and selling clothes for five years. She started selling because her family was going through a very difficult financial crisis. Over time, she was able to invest enough money to buy certain products for specific customers who gave her the recognition she deserved. This motivated her to continue and wake up early every day. Her business is the only livelihood that she has.

The loan Ángela is currently seeking will be used to buy merchandise such as trousers, shirts, skirts, dresses, and formal attire. Her wish is to provide her children with a decent education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire more merchandise

loans.name: Bulilan's Group

texts.en:
Guadalupe B. is from the village of Canubay. She is 54 years old. Guadalupe is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Guadalupe is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Guadalupe owns & operates a "sari-sari" store, essentially a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community.

Guadalupe has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2006, Guadalupe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Guadalupe has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Guadalupe is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used as working capital and to purchase additional inventory. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Guadalupe from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support members of the borrower's immediate family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As working capital, and to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Srey Vorn's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Vorn S. is 25 years old.  She is the leader for a loan to a group of 6 members, who live in Chey Othdom village in Kandal province. The members will use the loans for different purposes. Mrs. Srey Vorn S. is a fish seller who earns a small income to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Char Y., owns some speakers that he rents to villagers to earn a small income. Mrs. Srey Vorn S. is seeking a loan to buy wood to fix up her house. This couple has two children; one is a student in the local school while the youngest one is 2 years old.

loans.use: To buy wood to improve a home

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.es: Doña María T. tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa típica para mujeres, lleva 8 años de vender ropa y en ello nos solicita un préstamo para poder aumentar su capital y poder cubrir su demanda, ella vive con sus tres hijos y su esposo  en el que se dedican en la misma actividad, su residencia es en el paraje Chuimenchú del Cantón Poxlajuj, Totonicapán. Y en ello poder ayudar a sus hijos para darles mejor educación y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
María T. has a small business selling traditional women's clothing. She has had this business for 8 years, and she is requesting a loan in order to increase her capital so that she can meet the demand of her customers. She lives with her 3 children and her husband, who is engaged in the same activity. She lives in Chuimenchú in the Poxlajuj canton in Totonicapán. With her business she can help her children by giving them a better education and quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Baljinnyam

texts.en:
Baljinnyam P., 25, lives with his wife and four-year-old daughter in Hovd province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger (a Mongolian nomadic tent) in a rented yard. His wife, Nyamtsetseg, is pregnant and currently staying at home.
During the day, Baljinnyam operates a transportation business in his town with a truck that he purchased in 2009. Before he purchased the truck, Baljinnyam cooperated with his brother and worked as a assistant driver for him, gaining valuable experience during that time. In the future, he plans to use his business profits to purchase his own plot of land with a yard. Baljinnyam is a very hardworking man who has been working hard to provide a better life for his wife, daughter and new baby. He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to pay off the truck that he purchased for his business.

loans.use: To pay off his truck

loans.name: Daly Flor Maria

texts.es:
Daly Flor María tiene 63 años y 4 hijos en las edades de 25 a 33 años en la urbanización la Playa, muy cerca al mar rodeada de muchos habitantes pescadores; Daly Flor se dedica principalmente a vender carnes frías o embutidos elaborados en carne de res pollo o cerdo y también  vende bebidas refrescantes.  Este es su sexto crédito y quiere hacer una compra en mayor volumen de carnes frías y  tener un stock  de cajas de bebidas refrescantes, que tienen mucha rotación durante los fines de semana y se les termina muy pronto, lo mismo  que a muchos negocio cercanos a los cuales puede vender y convertirlos en nuevos clientes, si ella tiene en existencia.   Su negocio inició hace 9 años, cuando empezó a vender carnes frías por encargo; como a través de este negocio conoció a muchas personas, empezó a  comercializar con ellas prendas de oro por un periodo de dos años, pero cuando el oro se encareció y  ya no le daba la rentabilidad esperada, retornó con mas fuerza a la venta de las carnes frías, desde ese momento se vinculó a un grupo solidario con la Fundación  manejando sus créditos puntualmente.
Daly Flor es una mujer valiosa, ha salido adelante con sus hijos y con su negocio, nunca se ha quedado sin hacer nada porque lo que ha invertido de los créditos a su negocio, le ha generado mayores ingresos para cubrir gastos y  apoyar a su familia.

Su sueño es cambiar el lugar donde se encuentra su residencia porque se ve afectada por las lluvias cuando es época de ellas, también tiene como meta tener un enfriador y poder almacenar mas carnes frías y tener existencia de inventario.
texts.en:
Daly Flor María is 63 years old and has four children between the ages of 25 and 33. She lives in the development of La Playa, which is near the sea where many residents go to fish. Daly Flor primarily sells cold cuts and sausages made of chicken and pork. She also sells soft drinks. This is her sixth loan and she wants to buy a large volume of processed meats and cases of soft drinks. She experiences high turnover on the weekends, so she goes through her inventory very quickly. Like many businesses near her, she needs to attract new customers to continue making sales. Daly Flor started her business nine years ago when she began selling processed meats by taking orders. Through her business, she got to know many people and began selling gold jewelry with them for a period of two years. When the price of gold went up and no longer generated profitable returns, she returned to selling processed meats with greater enthusiasm. From that moment, she joined a solidarity group with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and has managed to repay her loans promptly.

Daly Flor is an esteemed woman who has succeeded in raising her children and running her business. She has never lacked anything because she invested her loans in her business and generated good earnings to cover her expenses and support her family.

Her dream is to move to a different residence because she is affected by heavy rains during the wet season. Another goal she has is to acquire a cooler so that she can store more processed meats and increase her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase processed meats & cases of soft drinks

loans.name: Teresiah

texts.en:
Teresiah M. F. is 21 years old. She is single and does not have any children yet. Her business is located in Kamukunji, in a very busy market in Nairobi. She sells cookers, motor boxes, pans and other items to the local people. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenges she has are the high prices of raw materials and the fact that there are very many people in the area doing the same kind of business as hers, hence customers are spoiled for choice. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more scrap metal, cookers and cement to make the items she sells. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and provide customer service to fulfill her clients' needs. She describes herself as hardworking, focused and dedicated.

loans.use: Cookers, scrap metal and cement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: American rice, sugar, oil, chicken, toilet paper, charcoal and eggs.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua A. sells fresh okro, pepper and other foodstuffs at Elmina.  She is married and lives together with her four children. Ekua has acquired a senior high education. She contributes to the general welfare of her family. Her loan will be used to buy additional foodstuffs like okro, pepper and other vegetables her customers have been demanding for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a storage place for her vegetables.

loans.use: To buy additional foodstuffs like okro, pepper and other vegetables

loans.name: Delfa Narcisa

texts.es:
Delfa Narcisa C. M. tiene 45 anos. Es soltera y vive con su hijo en el cantón de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios. 

Delfa es una socia de la ventanilla rural Lucha Para Triunfar. Son 13 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. 

Delfa tiene una tienda. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el canton de Ventanas. Solicita el credito para inverter en su negocio. El apoyo de este prestamo la ayudaria en seguir adelante para su familia. Su sueno para los proxima 5 anos es tener una tienda mas grande. 

Le gusta jugar el futbol.
texts.en:
Delfa Narcisa C. M. is forty-five years old, single, and lives with her son in the canton of Ventanas, in the province of Los Rios. Delfa is a member of the rural bank "Lucha Para Triunfar" which has thirteen members, the majority of whom work in farming. Delfa has a store and she purchases and sells her products in Ventanas. She is taking out a loan to invest in her business. The support this loans provides will help her get her family ahead. Her five-year goal is to have a bigger store. Delfa also likes to play soccer.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Say

texts.en:
Mrs. Say K. is a 38-year-old widow who currently lives in the middle of Kompong Tom province, Cambodia. She works as an internal staff officer after started her job more than nine years ago. Say K. also spends time at home to do housework as well as taking care of three school-aged kids who are dependent on her income.

Due to her current income not being enough to support her family, Say K. hopes to invest in a pig raising business in order to generate more profit. As she doesn’t have capital, she decided to apply for a loan to be used to begin breeding pigs.

loans.use: To begin breeding pigs

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda, de 41 años, es una mujer emprendedora, vive junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa heredada en el cono sur de Lima. Trabaja como enfermera 4 veces por semana y desde el jueves a viernes de dedica a la  organización de eventos para presentaciones de nuevos artistas en música folklórica, en donde se encarga de la gestión y tramitación de permisos a las municipalidades, recibiendo buenas rentas de este trabajo. De estas ganancias lo invierte en la construcción de habitaciones en su inmueble, puesto que en un futuro desea alquilarlos. Se siente muy contenta por el trabajo que realiza, ya que su anhelo es vivir del alquiler, por ello sabe que debe trabajar e invertir bien, porque mas adelante cuando crezcan sus hijos tendrá otros gastos que priorizar. Es su dieciséis crédito con MFP, se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo como en sus anteriores créditos, en su grupo solidario es una socia muy respetada. Yolanda  tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado, para comprar cemento y pagar la mano de obra del albañil que revestirá su casa.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 41, is an enterprising woman. She lives with her husband and three children in her inherited house located in Lima’s southern sector. Four days a week she works as a nurse and from Thursday to Friday she organizes events to introduce new folk musicians. She is in charge of securing the required municipal permits and earns good profits from this work. She uses profits to build rooms onto her home because she plans to rent them out in the future. She is very happy with the work she does because her dream is to live off her rents so she’s aware that she has to work and invest well because later on when her children get older she’ll have to prioritize other expenses. This is her 16th loan with MFP and she pledges to repay all her installments in a timely fashion as she has always done to date. She is highly respected by her fellow group members. She plans to use the requested funds to buy cement and pay the bricklayer, who’ll do the home refurbishing, for his labor.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement and pay the bricklayer's labor costs.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina sells women’s clothing outfits from rented space in the local mall. Marina is married with two children. Her family is an average Ukrainian family living in the town of Novaya Kahovka. She launched her business 17 years ago in the volatile perestroika times to be able to provide for her family’s basic needs. Currently, Marina has 70,000 Grivnas in inventory. Monthly net profit amounts to 7,000 Grivnas. 

Marina is requesting a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to increase the assortment of merchandise in her mall outlet. She believes that the loan will help her meet her customers’ demands and increase selection of merchandise for the fall season. Marina realizes that at all stages in her business development, it is important for her to offer a wide variety of items in order to keep a good reputation and attract more customers. This loan will enable her to continue building a solid foundation for her business so that it will be successful for many years to come.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of merchandise

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita C. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 45 years old, married and has 11 school-aged children. To make a living, Amelita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily use products in the local community. She also serves different kinds of food. Amelita has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Amelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan that Amelita has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth B. is from the village of Baluarte, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 40 years old. Elizabeth is married and has three school-age children.  Elizabeth owns a specialized retail store in which her main source of income is generated primarily from buying and selling coconut oil in the local community. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Elizabeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Elizabeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to continue to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

location.town: Baluarte, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkan est constitué de quatre  femmes du village de Sienso Préfecture de San  Région de Ségou. Elles ont en moyenne 39  ans, sont mariées et mères d’au moins 9 enfants. Les membres du groupe Benkan font la vente  de condiments et diverses marchandises. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont intégré le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis quatre ans. Le groupe est à son sixième cycle de prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursés les cinq précédents. 
Minata D., la présidente du groupe, compte acheter, 3 cartons de cube maggi, 5 sacs de sel, du piment, du poivre, du Sounbala etc. 
Elle envisage réaliser un  bénéfice de 15.000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé en plus du remboursement du prêt, à assurer l’entretien de ses enfants, payer les trousseaux des filles et autres dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
The Benkan group is made up of four women from the village of Sienso, in the prefecture of San in the region of Ségou. They average 39 years of age, are married and have at least nine children. The members of the Benkan group sell condiments and various other goods.

In order to increase their business volume, the members joined Soro Yiriwaso's loan program four years ago. The group is on its sixth solidarity loan, having repaid the five previous loans in full.

Minata D., the president of the group, is planning to buy four cartons of "Maggi" stock cubes, five bags of salt, chilis, pepper, sounbala (a pounded and fermented West African spice) etc. She is expecting to make a monthly profit of 15,000FCFA, which will be used not only to repay her loan but also to take care of her children, pay for her daughters' trousseaux and to cover other family expenses.

loans.use: Purchase of condiments

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary N. K. is a 54-year-old lady from Mtopanga. She is married and supports her family. She has been working in the food business selling cooked food to her customers in the market like mixed vegetables, rice, stew and others for the past 21 years with great success.

She joined KADET the other day and has applied for her first loan which she wants to use to purchase more stocks for her business like rice, beans, and vegetables. She plans to use the anticipated profits to start another business.

She hopes to purchase more stock for the business and live happily.

loans.use: To purcchase more stock  for business

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia N. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Looc, Ginatilan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures: a bakery, a general store and a hog raising businesses. Her husband Danilo N., who is 59 years old, works as a baker to earn his living. They have 6 children who are between 18 to 35 years old. 4 of their children are married and 2 are currently going to school. Cynthia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Cynthia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. A previous loan of PHP 11000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 15th loan, she is borrowing PHP 12000, which she intends to use to pay for more additional working capital for the business so that she could continue to save up for future to support the expenses of the family. Cynthia N. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 	

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Renelda

texts.en:
Renelda T. is from the village of Bagong Silang, Iligan City. She is 40 years old,  married, and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Renelda owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling wood or lumber in a variety of sizes in the local community. Renelda has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Renelda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Renelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and acquire working capital. Renelda is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional lumbers to sell. This loan will be Renelda's third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional lumber to sell

location.town: Bagong Silang, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Bertha Genoveva

texts.es:
Bertha Genoveva C. B. tiene 56 años de edad vive en union libre  vive con el compañero  con sus hijos  en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 6 hijos

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TRES DE NOVIEMBRE, Esta compuesta por 28 socios y esta a 90 minutos de  la oficina se encuentra dentro de los límites del Cantón Chillanes. Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Bertha Genoveva se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Compra sus productos en Mata de cacao y sus ventas se realizan en el Comercial  Matilde Esther y vende los  productos en Bucay.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño seria  mejorar la calidad de vida.

Le gusta salir de paseo.
texts.en:
Bertha Genoveva C. B. is 56 years old.  She lives with her common-law husband and children in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.  She has 6 children.

The TRES DE NOVIEMBRE community bank has 28 members and is located 90 minutes from our office, in Chillanes canton.  The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing rice, bananas, corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  They have been in this line of work for many years.

Bertha Genoveva is a farmer who grows rice, bananas, corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  She buys her products in Mata de Cacao and makes her sales in the Matilde Esther shopping center and in Bucay.

Bertha Genoveva is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her rice, banana, cacao, orange and cassava crops.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to improve her quality of life.  She enjoys going out for walks.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Jovey

texts.en:
Jovey S. is from the village of Kabatangan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 38 years old. Jovey is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jovey owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, canned goods, snack foods, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Jovey has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jovey joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovey has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Jovey is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like detergents & instant noodles. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Jovey from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like detergents & instant noodles

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Don Manuel, reside en Jucuapa, departamento de Usulután, vive con su esposa y un hijo de 17 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de panes Hot Dog, el negocio fue por iniciativa propia hace 11 años, y su horario es de 8:00am a 8:00pm, el atraviesa una situación de escases de dinero para invertir en el negocio, por lo que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales como: mortadela, salchichas,  mayonesa, papel, toallitas, y refrescos.
Este préstamo le ayudara a adquirir todo lo necesario para continuar con sus ventas, así mismo estará atendiendo a los clientes ofreciéndoles los hot dog con todos los ingredientes.
Su aspiración es tener un lugar fijo donde realizar la venta con la intensión de mejorar sus ganancias, y estabilizar su condición económica y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel lives in Jucuapa, in Usulután department, with his wife and 17 year-old son.  His business is selling hot dogs.  He set up his business 11 years ago and he works from 8.00am to 8.00pm.  Right now, Manuel does not have enough money to invest in his business and, for this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can buy supplies such as bologna, sausages, mayonnaise, paper, napkins and soft drinks.

This loan will help Manuel to acquire everything he needs to continue making his sales.  He will be able to serve his customers hot dogs with all the trimmings.

Manuel's goal is to have a fixed spot where he can make his sales, so that he can improve his profits and stabilize his family's financial position.

loans.use: To buy bologna, sausages, mayonnaise, paper, napkins and soft drinks

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila B. is from the city of Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City. She is 41 years old. Lucila is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Lucila owns & operates transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating tricycle (three-wheeled vehicle) transport services. Lucila has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lucila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucila has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. Lucila is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair existing engine. This will be the second loan taken out by Lucila from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units office covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing engine

loans.name: Bayron Antonio

texts.es: El Sr E.  labora como INSPECTOR DE CAMPO  es  soltero,  es el primer  del crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, da gracia la oportunidad que le brindan con  este  desembolso, para realizarse  chequeo médico y compras de medicamento para su mama que se encuentra  mal de salud ya que no cuenta con ese dinero que necesita para poder curarla por que sin el opoyo de ustede no podria.
texts.en: Mr E. works as a field inspector and is single. This is the first loan that he has been granted by Ceprodel. He is grateful for the opportunity he has been given with this loan, which he will use to undergo a medical check-up and purchase medication for his mother who is in ill health. Without your support he could not cure her illness because he doesn't have the funds to purchase the necessary medication.

loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Maria Joaquina

texts.es:
Maria Joaquina T. R. tiene 47 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos solteros en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 6 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO ENMANUEL se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Juan  pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 17 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, trigo, papas en grandes cantidades y a la cría de animales como chanchos y gallinas.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la cría de chanchos y gallinas. Compra sus productos en Comercial Silva cada fin de semana por la comida de los animales y los vende en la feria de los jueves en la Ciudad de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz trigo, papas y  compra de  animales además para insumos de alimentación e insumos para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es mejorar la situación económica y dar la educación a los hijos.

Le gusta trabajar, descansar, salir de paseo con la familia.
texts.en:
Maria Joaquina T. R. is 47 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and her unmarried children in Guaranda canton, in Bolívar province.  She has 6 children.

The 'Grupo Emanuel' community bank is located in San Juan, in Guaranda canton.  The 17 members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, wheat and potatoes in large quantities.  They also raise animals such as pigs and hens.

María is a farmer who grows corn.  She also raises pigs and hens.  She buys her animal feed in 'Comercial Silva' every weekend and sells her products in Guaranda's 'Feria de los Jueves' market.

María is requesting this loan so that she can grow corn, wheat and potatoes, and buy animals.  She will also buy feed supplies and supplies for her crops.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her business such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to improve her financial situation and provide her children with an education.

María enjoys working, resting and going out for walks with her family.

loans.use: to grow corn, wheat and potatoes, and to buy animals, animal feed and supplies for her crops

loans.name: Parsman

texts.en:
Parsman I. lives in the village of Chapala, Kartli Region, together with his family – his wife and 22-year-old son. This part of Georgia is known for its rich soil and consequently agriculture is well developed there. Agricultural family business is the main source of income for Parsman’s family. They own a 1.1 ha plot of the land, where potatoes, cucumbers, tomatoes and haricot beans are grown. The harvested vegetables are sold on the local market. 

With the requested amount Parsman plans to purchase seeds for the vegetables. After the hard work, the family will sell the vegetables at the harvest season. With the income, they plan to cover the cost of education for their son, and also renovate their house, purchase some furniture,  and put aside some fertilizers for the next season.

loans.use: to pay for vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Maria Josefa

texts.es: Maria tiene 36 años de edad, es separada y tiene 2 hijos. Vive en casa propia en la parte rural del distrito de Lambayeque en el norte de Perú. Maria cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrece en venta a sus clientes abarrotes y otros productos de primera necesidad. Tiene mas de dos años de experiencia en este negocio, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Cuentan con clientela ya establecida en la zona. Adicionalmente, se dedica  a la crianza y venta de aves de corral en la parte posterior de su casa. Cuando sus animales ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo, los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Desea usar una parte de su crédito para surtir su bodega con más mercadería (abarrotes). Con la otra parte, invertirá en su ganado. Pretende hacer arreglos a sus corrales para mejor protegerlos del sol. Tambien aumentará su ganado con la compra de más animales y alimento balanceado. Para lograr sus metas, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles. Maria ha manejado otros prestamos de Edpyme Alternativa y pagó sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Maria is 36 years old, separated and has two children. She lives in her own home in the rural part of Lambayeque district in the northern part of Peru. Maria runs a small store out of her home. There she offers groceries and other basic supplies for sale to her customers. She has over two years of experience in the business, that is to say, she knows this line of business like the palm of her hand. She has an established customer base in the area. Additionally, she raises and sells poultry in the back part of her home. Once her animals have reached an appropriate level of development she offers them for sale to the merchants who frequently visit the area.

She wishes to use part of the loan to supply her store with more merchandise (groceries). The other part she will use to invest in her livestock. She hopes to make repairs to their corrals to provide better protection from the sun. She will also purchase more birds and buy them a balanced feed. To achieve her aims she felt it was advisable to seek a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Maria has handled other loans from Edpyme Alternativa and made her payments promptly.

loans.use: to stock her shop with merchandise, purchase more poultry and make repairs to their corrals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cosmetics and a  hair dryer for her salon.

loans.name: Susan Wambui

texts.en:
Susan has operated her retail shop in Ndunyu Njeru for the last year. She is 36 years old and a single mother of four children.

Susan was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more goods to sell in her shop. In the future, Susan hopes to expand her retail shop to wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more retail goods to sell.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has two children, who are both currently in school.  Harriet has a business selling cold drinks, which she has had for five years.         

To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more soft drinks for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Harriet hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Harriet hopes to own a bar.  Harriet is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her get enough capital that has helped pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: La

texts.en:
La (in the photo) has been a construction worker for more than 20 years. His wife, Hay, has been selling vegetables in the local market for more than three years. They have one son and five daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home, two are garment-factory workers, and the other three are in school. The family lives in a small village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

La is asking for a loan of $500 to make a new roof for his house because the roof is old and breaking.

loans.use: to make a new roof for his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cloth, sewing thread and cotton threads for his tailoring business.

loans.name: Sheilla

texts.en:
Sheilla is a 29-year-old married lady.  She runs a hardware shop to earn a living. She has been in this business for seven years and has employed two people.  

She joined a group in Faulu Kenya so that she could easily access financial resources, and because the members of the group guarantee each others' loans.  She has also grown her business because she has been trained on business management skills.  She hopes to expand her business in the future.  

She has requested 30,000 KES to buy wheels, rings and brushes.

loans.use: to buy wheels, rings and brushes.

loans.name: Nounagnon Adjadji Bata Group

texts.fr: NOUNAGNON ADJADJI BATA est un groupement constitué de dix sept personnes et dont la présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est nommée Jacqueline. Les membres du groupe résident dans le même village au Bénin et appartiennent à une même association. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupement sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Jacqueline est âgée de 36 ans et est mariée à un couturier du nom de Charles. Le couple a trois enfants. Jacqueline vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges du ménage. Pour faire face à ses besoins et assurer les besoins de ses enfants, Jacqueline mène comme activité depuis six ans, la vente d'escargots dans sa zone. De façon secondaire, Jacqueline prépare de l'"akassa" (pâte locale faite à base d'amidon de maïs) qu'elle vend dans sa zone. Jacqueline achète ses produits au Bénin.
