Ce premier prêt permettra certainement à Jacqueline et aux autres membres du groupement NOUNAGNON ADJADJI BATA, de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en: The Nounagnon Adjadji Bata group comprises 17 people and its president (the woman with the raised hand in the photo) is named Jacqueline. The group members live in the same town in Benin and belong to the same association. With the goal of increasing their working capital, this group is seeking its first loan with ALIDÉ. Jacqueline is 36 years old and married to a tailor named Charles. The couple have three children. Jacqueline lives together with her husband and children. The couple provide for the household together. To meet her needs and provide for her children, Jacqueline has run a business selling escargot in her area for six years. Secondarily, she also prepares and sells 'akassa' (a local paste made from cornstarch) in her area. Jacqueline buys her products in Benin. This first loan will certainly allow her and the other members of the Nounagnon Adjadji Bata group to raise the level of their business and increase their clientele and income.

loans.use: To buy 8 sets of 40 snails and one bag of maize.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MARIA ELENA MOYANO”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dionisia; la socia tiene 55 años de edad, la socia es conviviente; la socia tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 3 de ellos son independientes y  el ultimo de 23 años, la socia trabaja junto a su conyugue en la carpintería que ambos tienes, la socia apoya en todo lo que puede, como en los acabados, decoraciones, lacas o barnices que se tenga que poner en algunos muebles, la socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de madera para la realización de trabajos a lo a largo de los siguientes 4 meses, la socia desea comprar madera por pies para los trabajos que realizaran en los próximos meses.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "MARIA ELENA MOYANO" which is located in the district of Huanchac in the province and department of Cusco.

Mrs. Dionicia, 55, has a common-law husband and four children, three of whom are independent and the youngest, 23.  The member and her husband have a carpentry business where they both work.  She helps out in every way she can with the finishing, decoration, and varnish required for the furniture.  She has requested a loan to buy wood to fill orders over the next four months.  The wood will be bought by the foot.

Dionicia is grateful for the support and is committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy wood for orders to be filled over the coming months.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy works hard to support her family.  Daisy is married and has a fish and seaweeds business in the Philippines.

Daisy requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of fish and seaweed to sell.  Daisy has been in this business for 7 years now.  In the future, Daisy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Andrea; ella tiene 48 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artefactos, ella vende radios, televisores pequeños y linternas, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de artefactos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artefactos pequeños como radios y linternas al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI”. It is located in the district of Urubamba in the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.

The member's name is Mrs Andrea. She is 48 years old and lives with her partner and 2 children. She divides her time between her daily activities and selling electrical appliances. She sells radios, small televisions and flashlights. The member works from 6:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. Through her business she manages to get her children ahead in life. She wants to expand her business of selling electrical appliances. She is asking for a loan to buy small electrical appliances such as radios and flashlights in bulk.

The member is happy to be receiving the loan and agrees to make the repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy small electrical appliances such as radios and flashlights in bulk.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: María Luisa tiene 36 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este medio de vida, empezó con los ahorros que realizo cuando se fue a trabajar a otro país como costa rica, fue con lo poco que ganaba que decidió empezar su negocio, tiene una gran variedad de clientes que le solicitan variedad en sus productos. El crédito es para la compra de bolsos, calzado, cosméticos, ropa en general, billeteras, entre otros.
texts.en:
María Luisa is 36, and sells general merchandise. This has been her livelihood for more than 5 years.  

She started with her savings from when she went to work in Costa Rica.  With the little she was making, she decided to start a business. She has a great variety of customers, who request a variety of products.

She will use the loan to buy purses, shoes, cosmetics, clothing in general, wallets, and other things.

loans.use: To buy purses, shoes, cosmetics, clothing in general, wallets, and other things.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is married with 3 children. She is 66 years old and lives in Upper Centro, Tudela, Misamis Occidental
Clarita sells items such as canned goods, noodles and biscuits. She has had this business for 1 year. Each month she earns PHP 7,000.00. She has requested a loan of 50,000.00 to  purchase additional products for the grocery store.
Clarita has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Clarita hopes to save money for her old age.

loans.use: to purchase additional products for the grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ivone

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, provincia de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, viúva e mãe de 6 filhos dos quais apenas um ainda frequenta a Escola.Nunca teve oportunidade de estudar devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

É negociante ha mais de 35 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 6.000.00mt, por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Já teve emprestimos em outros bancos(PROCREDIT) e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades nenhumas. Conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos( óleo, açúcar, feijão, e outros.) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
Pretende solicitar mais valor para construir a sua casa, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the district of Boane, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. She is a widow and the mother of six children, of which only one still attends school. She never had the opportunity to study for lack of financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and doesn't support anyone else.
She has been a businesswoman for over 35 years and earns an income of about 6.000mt a month. She uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in her bank account.
She has had loans in other banks (PROCREDIT) and has been able to pay them back without any difficulties. She first heard of Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of this institution. This is her first loan with Hluvuku. It is for 10.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase goods (oil, sugar, beans, etc.) in order to increase the volume of her merchandise.
She intends to request more money in order to build her house. She will request other loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase goods for selling (oil, sugar, beans, etc.).

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza is a 44-year-old married woman, a mother of four children whom she's responsible for.  Aziza is a hard working woman with a good reputation. 
Her previous Kiva loan helped a lot in improving her income and in providing her family a good and healthy living.  She works from her house, and hopes to increase her stock of clothing with autumn/winter collections for sale.  

Aziza assures that her previous loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua helped a lot in improving her social and financial situations and hopes that this one will improve it even more.

loans.use: To expand her store by purchasing new merchandise for the autumn/winter season

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Selling grocery items such as sardines, coffee, milk, sugar, soap and detergents to the people in her neighborhood allows Veronica to acquire a minimum daily profit of P200. She has been operating her small store, located just in front of her house, for almost 10 years. 

At this moment, she has to replenish items sold but she has insufficient capital to buy more soft drinks, canned goods, instant noodles and shampoo to sell in her store. Profits gained last month were used to buy medicines and vitamins because she has been ill these past few days. 

She is 60 years old and has five grown up children. In the future, Veronica would like to improve her sales and bring back her strength to continuously operate her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, instant noodles and shampoo to sell in her store.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet, 36, is a single mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years she has operated a greengrocery business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality during the dry, hot season with the availability of her green vegetables for her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase bundles of vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of vegetables for resale

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice is a 33-year-old, married woman with six children between the ages of 2 and 15 years old.  Three of her children are in school.  Joice has operated a food stall business in Buluk, South Sudan for five years.

Joice requested a loan through Kiva partner BRAC South Sudan to purchase bread, tomatoes, and onions for her food stall. She will use the extra income she earns as a result of the loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase bread, tomatoes, and onions for sale at her food stall business.

loans.name: Chrinovic Plus Group

texts.en:
Georges is the chairman of the Community Bank named “Chrinovic Plus,” which is composed of 15 micro-entrepreneurs. The members are united by the same goal: to grow their businesses using loans from Kiva partner IMF HOPE RDC. 

Georges is 42 years old. His main business activity is selling tea and corn in detail. He buys them in bulk and resells them at profit. He sells his products daily at the market in his area located east of Kinshasa.

Georges started his business in 2009. He likes his business and works hard to make it thrive. His next loan will allow him to buy a larger quantity of tea and corn in bulk to increase his sales in order to make a better profit. The business makes a profit of about US $60 per week. The goal of taking this loan is to reinforce his working capital and provide food for his family. Georges is married and the father of four children between the ages of 5 and 13 years. All of them attend school.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of tea and corn in bulk for resale at a profit.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 62 years old and married with 3 children.

Fe works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling fermented shrimp in the Philippines and requested a 19,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell. Fe has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her shrimp business for 14 years and also earns an income from a sari-sari store.

Fe aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of fermented shrimp

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 38 years old and is married to Mutheu.  They have three children.  He has been in the quarrying business for the last two years, earning a monthly income of KES 5,000.

He is requesting his first loan with KADET Ltd of KES 20,000, with which he plans to purchase small equipment for quarrying i.e cold chisels, mattocks and hammers.  With the anticipated profits he will pay for his children's school fees.

His hopes are to establish a big mechanized quarry.

loans.use: to buy small quarrying equipment.

loans.name: Asomep Group

texts.fr: ASOMEP est un groupe composé de cinq personnes qui sont des amies et qui font des tontines ensemble. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. Le représentant du groupe, du nom de Agbaboessi Julien (celui qui a la main levée sur la photo) a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire.. Agbaboessi Julien est marié à un certain Françoise. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Agbaboessi Julien et sa femme. Pour cette raison, Agbaboessi Julien imprimeur de profession, activité qu'il exerce depuis neuf ans dans son atelier et a son domicile, fait aussi de l'agriculture de façon parallèle à son activité, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Agbaboessi Julien s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Agbaboessi Julien sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe ASOMEP, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des papiers et de l'encre.

loans.name: Sonia Maribel

texts.es: Sonia, tiene 23 años de edad, se casó a temprana edad y es madre de una hija de 3 años. Sonia realizo sus estudios de primaria de forma completa gracias al apoyo de sus padres quienes con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio realizaron para que Sonia pudiera estudiar ya que ellos son de escasos recursos. Ella y su esposo, se dedica a la siembra y cultivo de café siendo sus padres quienes le enseñaran a muy temprana edad y mismo que le heredaran el terreno que trabajan llevando a cabo dicha actividad desde hace 6 años ubicado a una distancia de dos kilómetros al cual se trasladan caminando. Sus metas, mediante el crédito que está solicitando a COMIXMUL en esta ocasión llevar a cabo la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, foliares, urea, alto 100 entre otros insumos que ayudaran a prevenir que sus plantas de café sean afectadas o maltratadas por alguna plaga o el factor clima ya que en estos momento cuenta con tres manzanas de café cultivadas del tipo 90. Su sueño poder apoyar a su hija y sus futuros hijos en sus estudios, que puedan prepararse para poder tener mejores oportunidades en la vida, con mayores conocimientos y demás que los aran exitosos en la vida por lo que espera ser apoyada para salir adelante pues la fuente de ingresos económicos para su familia es la siembra y cultivo de café.

loans.use: Para compra de abono, fertilizantes, alto 100, entre otros para asistir sus cultivos de café

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine aged 29 years. She is married with 2 children aged of 2 and 4 years. Not yet go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 3 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house and to buy a cow.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en: Annah is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a farm where she grows maize and other crops. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a fertile area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy seeds for planting. Her business goal is to be a large scale farmer within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting.

loans.name: Stilian

texts.en: Stilyan Atanassov is 33 years old, single. After his graduation from high school in 1992 he began to work as a builder in his father’s company “FERO”. In 1999 his father – Georgi Atanassov, retired and transferred the company to his son, who continues to manage and develops the company with the same subject of activity – finished off construction works. At the moment “FERO” Company works under concluded contracts with Elektrosnabdyavane (Electric feeding) Joint-Stock Company.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pauline Ngaruiya intends to pay school fees for her secondary-school-age child

loans.name: Noemi Amparo

texts.en:
My name is Noemi Amparo, and I am a businessperson. I have a business selling used clothing in my home, and I also distribute it door-to-door. I have several years of experience dedicating myself to this type of activity. Thanks to this business I am able to take care of my family and generate income to contribute to my family's expenses.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Mi nombre es Noemi Amparo, soy comerciante, cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa usada en mi casa de habitacion y tambien distribuyo de manera ambulante, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, gracias a este negocio puedo antender a mi familia y genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia.

loans.use: To buy men's shirts, children's clothes, women's clothes, and pants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Milka would like to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Aluola

texts.en: A. is 45 years old and has three children. He has a farm land in his village were he cultivates yams and cassava for sale. He needs the loan US $400 to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more yams and cassava stems for cultivation

loans.name: Kanchi

texts.en:
Mrs. Kanchi M. lives in a single family home with her husband, three sons and her daughter. Her husband Mr. Aasta lal M. works in his own grocery shop. Her oldest son works in a food shop. Her next son works in a private office and her youngest son is studying in school.

Mrs. M. opened her tailoring shop four years ago. Her daughter helps her in the shop. Mrs. M. makes different types of custom fitted lady's dresses like kurta-salwar, blouses, and trousers for girls and ladies. She took six months of tailoring training from a local tailoring shop. Now she seeks a loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring shop.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her tailoring work

loans.name: Nadiya

texts.en:
Nadiya and her best friend operate a small clothing sales business at the “Pyatachok” market in Ivano-Frankivsk, a large city in western Ukraine. They sell an assortment of women’s and children’s clothing. Due to some reconstruction work at their market, they have been temporarily displaced to a new market nearby and will continue to sell there until the work is finished. Nadiya has had her business for five years. She is single and her business is her main means of support, providing about $400-$500 income for her each month.

Nadiya has requested a loan of $600 so she can purchase new inventory supplies. Nadiya hopes to continue developing her business and would like to open an additional sales kiosk in the future.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Baraka B Group

texts.en:
Zelda, age 32, is married with 3 children (ages 16, 14, and 3). She owns a chicken business which she began 4 years ago. Her business is open from 8am to 4pm daily, and she makes a monthly profit of around $109.

In the past, Zelda took 3 previous loans with Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her business. She hopes for a new loan to increase the same business. She will be sharing this loan with her subgroup members who have businesses dealing in selling various foods, shoes, chicken, charcoal, and sarongs.

In the picture, Zelda is second from left.

loans.use: To increase business

loans.name: Kalin

texts.en: Kalin K. is single and lives with his mother.  She is ill and needs special care, so Kalin looks after her. He was unemployed for a very long time, so he decided to start breeding cows and now breeds two cows in a shed near his house. This little business is the only source of income for Kalin and his sick mother. Now he needs to buy another cow and enlarge his farm.

loans.use: To buy another cow

loans.name: Sei

texts.en: Mrs. Sei H., 24, is a housewife that stays at home raising the children and cooking food for her family. Her husband owns a plot of land growing rice and makes about $3 a day. He requests a loan from Kiva to purchase a cow to assist in farming. (Her husband is pictured with the cow they are going to buy)

loans.use: To purchase a cow.

loans.name: Confort

texts.en:
Confort A. is a trader who deals in jewels. She is married and has 5 dependents. Confort is a very hard-working woman who is helping her husband with the family’s expenses. She wishes to increase sales to increase her income.

She is asking for $325 as additional capital to buy more jewels for sale.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more jewels for sale.

loans.name: Savuth

texts.en: Mrs. Savuth S. is a farmer in Prey Beng Village in Kampong Speu Province. Her husband, Chanthuon Suong, is a farmer. They have three children, one of whom is car taxi-driver while the others are studying at school. Although the members in the family have different business activities, they still have insufficient money to build a house. Thus, Mrs. Savuth S. has decided to ask for a loan to add to the money that she has been saving for many years so that she can build it. In the picture, you will see the new stairs that have just built. Her husband is on the right of the picture.

loans.use: to build a new house.

loans.name: Fifty - Fifty Group

texts.en: Abdul K. is 35 years old and married with 4 children. As a leader of the group, he demonstrated honesty in repaying his previous loan promptly. He is happy that the loan enabled him to increase his stock. Like other group members, he would like to further expand his business and is requesting a total loan of Le. 1,900,000.

loans.use: To increase inventory of cosmetics

loans.name: Koy

texts.en:
Koy S., 54, lives in Kampong Cham with her husband, Chan Art, and three of their children. She takes care of her family and the house, while her husband works in construction every day and makes US $2.50. They have six children, four of whom are married. One of them still lives in the household with his parents. Two children are garment factory workers.

The garment factory workers are able to provide minimal support to the family, but they have been looking for ways to increase their income and improve their current living situation. Koy S. has asked for a loan of US $400 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to begin to operate a motortaxi service in his spare time. This service will provide a little extra income for the family and can give them some stability through providing another source of funds.

The family looks forward to the opportunities available to them with this loan.

loans.use: Purchase motorbike to start taxi service

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad Y. is 55 and married. He is a father of seven children and one of the residents of the Ningarhar province. Y. and his family have been living in the Shewa district for about 20 years; it's an agricultural area isolated from the city. His three sons and a daughter are studying in a public school in their village, and Y. has been teaching there since 2001.

Muhammad Y. is an active man. Besides teaching, he has a small animal husbandry business. Through it he attempts to cover his family expenditures. His monthly salary is just 3,000 Afghanis ($60), and it's too difficult to feed his family with this amount. His wife also helps him in his work. She brings grass for the cows and makes yogurt from their milk. Y. sells the yogurt in the bazaar.

Muhammad Y. has 300 Afghanis ($6) daily income, but it's not enough for him. There are 11 members in his family, and the costs are going to be increasing day by day. Besides these problems, his father has a serious illness and Y. must treat him because he doesn't have other brothers to take this responsibility. These hard problems definitely made a big headache for him, and he didn’t know how to find solution for it. After thinking deeply, he decided to buy more livestock and increase his income through them. He hopes that this decision may give a positive result. He has applied for a loan of 50,000 Afghanis from AFSG for 24 months.

Y. hopes to eradicate the barriers of the problems as soon as possible and then treat his sick father. Also he dreams of a bright and full future for his children as doctors and engineers in the future. He thanks the lenders so much.

loans.use: To buy stocks

loans.name: Indira

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua específicamente en el mercado Israel Lewites, la señora Indira L. se dedica a atender su propio negocio de veterinaria donde brinda atención a los animales y a la vez tiene una pequeña venta de medicamentos para los animales.

A medida qeu los años han venido transcurriendo, ha logrado mejorar su negocio y esto ha sido gracias a Ceprodel el cual le ha brindado el apoyo crediticio para su beneficio en la compra de los medicamentos y mejora del local. Una vez más busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito y de esta manera continuar supliendo las necesidades de su hogar.
texts.en:
In Managua and specifically in the Israel Lewites market, Señora Indira L. takes care of her own veterinary shop where she treats animals and also sells medicine for animals.

As the years have passed she has improved her business thanks to Ceprodel, who have supported her in providing the credit that helped her buy medicine and improve the premises of the business. Once again she seeks Ceprodel's support for credit so she can continue providing for her home's necessities.


Translated from Spanish by Nathan Paluck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy animal medicine for her veterinary store

loans.name: Thi Xuyen

texts.vi:
Chị Đào Thị Xuyến 49 tuổi tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2003, trước khi chưa tham gia vào Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chị còn gặp nhiều khó khăn do thiếu vốn làm ăn. Khi tham gia vào Quỹ gia đình chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và buôn bán nhỏ. Hiện tại chị đang đầu tư vốn vào buôn bán quần áo, thu nhập từ buôn bán bình quân 100.000đ/ ngày, chồng chị bán vé xổ số thu nhập hàng tháng ổn định, chị có 3 con, 1 con lớn đã xây dựng gia đình, 2 con đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ đầu tư vào buôn bán quần áo.
Thu nhập bình quân 5.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs. D. Thi Xuyen, 49 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 2003. Before joining the Fund, her family faced many financial difficulties due to the lack of fund to do business. Since joining the Fund, Mrs. Xuyen has borrowed loans to invest in raising livestock and small retailing. Currently, she sells clothes with the average daily profit of 100,000VND (about 6USD). Her husband sells lottery tickets with a stable monthly income. Mrs. Xuyen has 3 children. The eldest is married and the other two are still going to school. This time, she would like to borrow 9,000,000VND (550USD) to invest in selling clothes. Her family's average monthly income is 5,000,000VND (about 312USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling clothes

loans.name: Maksudjon

texts.en: Maksudjon has a small store where he sells confectionery goods. He isn’t married yet. He lives with his parents and this way he helps them to support the family. He buys his goods from other cities for much cheaper prices. He wants to take a loan for repairing his little store and equipping it in a modern style.

loans.use: Repairing his store

loans.name: Norma Azucena

texts.es:
La señora norma es una persona responsable de mediana edad, casada y con familia;
Tiene su propio negocio que es una  tiendita de abarrotes a la que le ha dedicado tiempo, esfuerzo, y dinero con tal de hacerlo crecer y tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia. Es por ello que solicita este credito para comprar mas mercancía para su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Norma is a responsible middle-aged woman, married, and with a family. She owns her own small grocery store to which she has dedicated time, energy, and money. Now she wishes to expand it to improve her own and her family’s quality of life. For this reason she is now seeking a loan to buy more merchandise for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more merchandise for her store

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Pen C. is grocery seller who lives in Pursat Province. She is widow with six children, one of whom is married. She has been selling since 2000 and her business is going well. She sells a variety of products to her customers such as cakes, Khmer wine, meat, and vegetables, etc. To expand her business by purchasing more groceries, she would like to request a loan.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing more groceries

loans.name: Hélène

texts.fr: Hélène A. est âgée de 37 ans, marié et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est coiffeuse à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Cette activité demeure sa principale source de revenu et, elle souhaite avec ce crédit accroître la capacité de son activité en achetant un séchoir et des mèches pour la revente à la clientèle.
texts.en:
Hélène A. is 37 years old, married, and the mother of two. She is a hairdresser in Lomé, the Togolese capital. This work remains her main source of income. She would like to use this loan to increase the capacity of her business by buying a hairdryer and hair extensions for resale to customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a hairdryer and hair extensions for resale

loans.name: Sopha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopha P., 56, and her husband, Mr. Vantha Ee, 65, live in a small village across Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 1971 and have six children who stay with them: three sons and three daughters. Two of their daughters are silk weavers, one son has full-time employment and the other three children are in school.

Sopha used to be a silk weaver but she transferred her loom to her daughters. She sells their finished products to the middleman in the village who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. Mr. Vantha has been a farmer for over twenty years, he grows corns and tomatoes. Sopha hopes to support her children’s further education.

She is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase silk materials, and will use the other part of the loan to buy blacksmith materials for her son-in-law to run his blacksmith business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials and to buy blacksmith materials for son-in-law running his business.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela A. D. has owned a small charcoal and firewood store in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for three years. Angela is married and has three children, ages 2, 6, and 19. Angela belongs to the Wapendanao group loan (group code 2008). Angela works every day at her business and earns an average monthly profit of $50 dollars.

Angela is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy charcoal, firewood, and salon items for her business. Angela is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha O. is 43 years old. She is married and the mother of one child, a girl. According to her, her daughter has completed vocational training school. Martha lives with her daughter and husband in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Martha works very hard to support her husband financially to provide for the family. She sells cosmetics such as creams, pomades, body spray, powder, etc., in her community. She has been in this business for eight years. She buys the cosmetics from Kumasi and hawks to sell. She also treks to nearby towns to sell. Martha wants a loan to procure more goods to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria vive en la Avenida “ Civica” de  la zona Villa Tejada Rectangular. en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive junto a sus hijas menores, ya que su esposo trabaja como chofer de transporte a larga distancia, lo cual le obliga a estar constantemente de viaje.

Trabaja en la confección de polleras para señoras,  las cuales vende a los intermediarios, en las distintas ferias de la cuidad. 

El crédito lo destinará  para compra de telas al por mayor y asi poder incrementar su producción.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Victoria lives on “Civica” Avenue in the Villa Tejada Rectangular zone in the city of El Alto. She lives with her younger sisters as her husband works as a long distance transport driver, and he is always away. She makes skirts for women. She sells them to vendors at different fairs in the city. The loan is to buy wholesale fabric and be able to increase her production. This is her first loan with Impro, but the evaluation shows that she qualifies for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric for her business of making women's skirts.

loans.name: Koura

texts.fr:
Koura Berthé a 62 ans, veuve et mère de 3 enfants (1 garçon et 2 filles), elle vit avec ses enfants dans la maison de son défunt époux à Médine, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso.
N’ayant pas été à l’école pour des raisons sociales, et après avoir mener plusieurs activités sans réussite, elle décida d’opter pour l’activité de vente de galette à base de farine de blé, il y a maintenant vingt  ans. L’insuffisance des ressources financières à bien mener cette activité constitue l’objet et la justification de sa demande de prêt  à Soro Yiriwaso.
Elle est en relation avec l’institution Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ quatre ans. Après deux ans en prêt solidaire (prêt du groupe), elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel et  tous ses prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.  
Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter, 6 sacs de farine de blé, 2 sacs du sel, 6 bidons d’huile alimentaire et 2 sacs de sucre sur place. Elle vend ses galettes au grand marché de Sikasso et sa clientèle est composée des femmes et surtout des foraines. 
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour résoudre l’essentielle des dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Koura Berthé, age 62, is a widow and the mother of three children (1 boy and 2 girls). She lives with her children in her late husband's house in Médine, a working-class district in Sikasso City. Not have attended school for societal reasons, and after done several kinds of work unsuccessfully, she decided twenty years ago to opt for a business selling galettes made of wheat flour.

Lacking the financial resources for managing this business properly sums up the goal and justification for her loan request at the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. She has had an association with Soro Yiriwaso for about four years. After two years in a solidarity loan (group loan), she is on her second individual loan. All the preceding loans were correctly repaid.

With this loan, she intends to buy six sacks of wheat flour, two sacks of salt, six drums of cooking oil, and two sacks of sugar, locally. She sells galettes at the grand marketplace of Sikasso, and her customers are composed of women and especially fair vendors. She envisions realizing a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will be used to resolve most of the family expenses, to make loan interest payments, and to invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, salt, and peanut oil

loans.name: Alikul

texts.ru: Аликул Сафаров живет в районе Абдурахмони Чоми. Возраст 52 года. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее. Аликул занимается услугой такси более 25 лет. Этот вид бизнеса является одним из источников дохода. Кроме этого двое сыновей работают в России, они также помогают семье. Клиент хочет взять у нас кредит, чтобы отремонтировать свою машину.
texts.en:
Alikul S. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. He is 52 years old, married and has six children. He has secondary education. Alikul has been providing taxi services for more than 25 years. This business is one of the sources of income. Besides that two of his sons work in Russia and also help the family. He want to take out a loan to repair his car.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair the car

loans.name: Đỗ Thị

texts.en:
T. Đỗ Thị (727020923) is a 45-year-old female living in the town of Mê Linh. She is married and has four school-aged children.

T. owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over twenty years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month.

In 2002, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase piglets to raise and sell.

T. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be her 6th loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Flor De Canela De Jovenes Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal  “Flor de Canela de Jóvenes” tiene cuatro integrantes, su presidente es Oscar M., quién tiene el negocio de costura y utilizará el préstamo para comprar materia prima, como es la tela. Oscar actualmente trabaja solo pero su objetivo es montar una microempresa, contar con activos fijos y tener empleados. Los demás integrantes de la Asociación también tienen negocios como el tejido de guantes, costura y venta de ropa, ellos también utilizaran el préstamo  para la compra de materia prima.
Los cuatro se mostraron muy motivados a trabajar juntos y apoyarse mutuamente.
texts.en:
The community organization “Flor de Canela de Jóvenes” has four members. Its president is Oscar M., who has a sewing business and will use this loan to purchase raw materials like cloth. Oscar currently works alone but his goal is to start a small business with fixed assets and to have employees.

The other members of the association also have their own businesses, like knitting gloves, sewing, and clothing sales. They will also use the loan to purchase raw materials.

The four members are very motivated to work together and support each other.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Sarith

texts.es: Sarith tiene 19 años, es madre soltera de un pequeño de 3 años, actualmente vive en su casa propia con su hermana. Se dedica a la venta de ropa para adultos y niños, estas prendas las lleva a vender por las distintas calles de su localidad y semanalmente viaja a los caseríos o comunidades alejadas de la ciudad. En esta actividad lleva 8 meses y le está yendo muy bien, ya que no tiene mucha carga familiar y solo vela por sus gastos personales y de su hijo. Lo que le gusta de este trabajo es que conoce muchos lugares y mantiene amenas conversaciones con sus clientes. Además le es rentable porque sus prendas las vende a diario y trabaja sólo a pedido. Posteriormente, Sarith quiere comprarse un bote a motor donde pueda transportar su mercadería hacia los caseríos que se encuentran en las riveras del río y están más alejados de la ciudad. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y lo que le ha gustado es que se ha integrado a un banco comunal donde existe compañerismo entre todos los integrantes y son muy responsables en sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más ropa para aumentar sus ventas, además construirá un pequeño kiosco para implementar un negocio de venta de comida por las noches.
texts.en:
Sarith is 19 years old and a single mother of a three year old son. She and her son live in her own home, along with Sarith's brother. Sarith works selling clothing for adults and children. She takes the clothing to distinct areas of her neighborhood, and each week she travels to communities farther away. She has been doing this work for 8 months and it is going well. She is able to cover the costs of supporting herself and her son. What she likes about her work is that she gets to know different places, and she is able to have pleasant conversations with her clients. It's also a good business since she sells clothing every day, and only by request. Sarith would like to purchase a motor boat to be able to transport her clothing to the towns along the river outside of the city. This is the first loan she is requesting with MFP. She likes that she has joined a communal bank where there is companionship between all the members and that everybody acts responsibly with the payments. With the money she is requesting, she will purchase more clothing to expand her sales. In addition, she will construct a small kiosk to sell food in the evenings, as a way to supplement her income.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to expand her sales, and to construct a small kiosk so that she can supplement her income by selling meals in the evenings.

loans.name: Janett Del Socorro

texts.es: Janett del Socorro M. es cliente de Fundación León 2000. Es una mujer casada, tiene 3 hijos que dependen de ella. Janett es una mujer eficiente pues debido a la alta necesidad de generara ingresos para su familia decide incursionar en este negocio. Ella se dedica a una pulpería hace más de 35 años. Anteriormente su Mama era la que se encargaba del negocio, ubicada en su vivienda. Actualmente al fallecer su Mama decide hacerse cargo de este negocio que ha durado por generaciones. Con este financiamiento podrá comprar gaseosas, jugos, cigarrillos y golosinas en general. Por lo que su deseo es obtener un pequeño restaurante para incrementar un poco sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Janett del Socorro M. is a client of the Fundación León 2000. She is married, and has three children who depend on her. She is an efficient woman, and decided to work at this business because of the need to earn money for her family. She has been working at a grocery store for more than 35 years. Before, her mother was in charge of the business, and it was located inside her home. Now, after her mother's death, Janett decided to take over the business, which has lasted for generations. With this loan, she will be able to buy pop, juice, cigarettes, and candy. Her dream is to start a small restaurant to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is a member of the Mwangata D borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 50 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 5 children.Her children are aged 30,28,26,22 and 18 years. 

Hawa started her own business selling maize 3 years ago,she works 12 hours and earn monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Hawa first loan from BRAC _Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more maize.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Hawa hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more maize for sale

loans.name: Ameth

texts.fr: Ameth D. enseignent de son état s’active dans l’élevage de la volaille .Il a aménagé dans sa maison une poulaille   où il élève des poulets destinés à la vente. Cette activité annexe qu’il exerce depuis trois (3) ans lui permet de gagner des revenus supplémentaires  pour payer les frais de scolarités de ses enfants  mais aussi certaines dépenses de son ménage. Le poulet est très demandé pendant la fin du mois de ramandan et les fêtes de fin d’année  pour faire face à cette forte demande Monsieur D. sollicite un prêt  a fin de renforcer des capacités de production
texts.en:
Ameth D. teaches and engages in poultry farming. He created a hen coop within his house where he breeds chicken for sale.This side business that he's been doing for three (3) years enables him to make additional income in order to pay for school fees of his children and also for some expenses of the house. The chicken is in high demand during the end of ramadan and end of year festivities. In order to meet this high demand Mr. D. requests a loan in order to strengthen his capacity for production.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chicken

loans.name: Dios Es Mi Salvador Group

texts.en:
Bellaniris is the group coordinator of 'Dios es mi Salvador', a Bank of Hope located in Santo Domingo, the capital of the Dominican Republic, where running water and electricity are unreliable. She lives in a cement block house with four of her five children, all of whom are currently attending public schools, and her husband. She is currently looking to start her second loan which will help her run her business.

Bellaniris runs a small restaurant in a building that she already owns, right next door to her house. She will be using this loan to buy cups, passion fruit, gum, a blender, butter, cheese, bags, cookies, ham, and more, allowing the selection she offers to her clients to grow. With these items, she believes that the community will be more interested in visiting her restaurant, providing her with more income to achieve her dream of seeing all of her children graduate from college. She has very much enjoyed working with Esperanza International so far and appreciates your support.

loans.use: Sugar, cups, bags, napkins, blender, butter, etc.

loans.name: Srey Da

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Da O. is a villager in Mea Neak village in Takeo province. She is a rice wine maker in the local village. Since this business is going well, she wants to buy more equipment to produce a better rice wine for her customers. She would use the rest of the loan to buy fishnets and boat for her husband, Mr. Tum Sareourn, who is a fisherman. Mrs. Srey Da O. is 20 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more equipment to produce a better rice wine for her customers.

loans.name: Conjester

texts.en: Conjester N. is a 33 year old woman and the sole owner of a tailoring business. She started this business in 2008 as a self-employment project. She says it has paid off and she buys her tailoring stock twice a month. Initially, she was in the grocery business. Conjester says the income from the grocery business helped her get trained as a tailor. Now she has her eyes set on buying more sewing machines and resurrecting her old grocery business.  Her future dream is to buy a parcel of land with the profits from her businesses.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials and equipment

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou A.'s main source of income comes from selling food and daily use products in a sari-sari (variety) retail shop in her community. She is 51 years old, married and has two adult children. They are from the village of Mailag, Valencia City. Marilou has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Marilou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Marilou is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy O. is married to a commercial driver and they are blessed with 4 children. Her children are excelling in school. Joy sells groceries, drinks and foodstuffs at retail prices to her customers.This  is the high season for her business and she hopes to make more profits during this season. She hopes for the loan amount of 60,000 NGN to purchase more groceries, drinks and foodstuffs to sell. Joy hopes to own a super market in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries, drinks and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Sokneang

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokneang K., 34, and her husband Mr. Theara Roeun, 35, live on an Island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

They have been married for 15 years and have three sons; two attend school and the youngest son stays at home.

Sokneang has been a silk weaver since she was 15 years old; she learned the skill from her sister. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village who then takes them to sell in a Phnom Penh market.

Her husband has been working in a company for 6 months.

Sokneang is requesting her first loan of $350 to purchase silk materials for her silk weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her silk weaving business.

loans.name: Anita

texts.es: Anita tiene 39 años, es madre soltera, y vive en la compañía de sus tres hijos que estudian y le apoyan mucho, en su  casa que es propia.Se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, que comercializa  por los distintos caseríos o simplemente la intercambia con algunos productos comestibles que los lleva  a vender al mercado de su ciudad, en esta actividad ya tiene 1 año,  y le gusta mucho porque gracias a ella esta sacando adelante a sus hijos quienes valoran su trabajo y siempre sacan buenas calificaciones en señal de agradecimiento. Además este negocio le es muy rentable porque siempre vende toda su mercadería .Ya tiene pensado para el futuro  incursionar en la venta de papaya al por mayor.Es el segundo préstamo con MFP y  le gusta  mucho trabajar con su banco comunal porque todos tienen una buena relación y son muy organizados.
texts.en:
Anita is a 39 year old single mother who lives in her own home with her three school-age children who provide her with a lot of support. She sells used clothing in different villages or barters them for food products that she can sell at the city market. Anita has been in this business for a year and enjoys her work. Her children have been able to succeed because they value their mother’s work and always earn good grades in school to show their appreciation. Also, Anita’s business is very profitable because she is always able to sell all of her merchandise. In the future, she hopes to enter the papaya market as a wholesale vendor. This is her second loan with MFP. She is enjoys working with her Communal Bank because all the members have good working relationships and are very organized.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: J. Antonio

texts.es: El señor J. Antonio H. es un cliente distinguido de nuestra Institución ya que anteriormente se le había otorgado el crédito para realizar una mejora en su vivienda y todos sus pagos se registraron siempre puntuales, y en estos momentos esta tramitando nuevamente el crédito para la impermeabilización del techo de su hogar ya que en estas temporadas de lluvia su techo se ha ido dañando.
texts.en:
J. Antonio H. is a distinghished client of our institution who has had loans with us in the past to do home improvements; his repayments were always on time. Currently, he is requesting new funding to weatherproof the roof on his house because it has been damaged in the current rainy season.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To weatherproof his house.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena S., 36, is a rice farmer. She has three children, the eldest of whom is 10 years old. She tills a small rice field in Veruela, Agusan del Sur. She has been married for 11 years. She wanted to grow her business more to be able to provide her children an adequate supply of food, clothing and other basic needs. 

She said that aside from growing rice, she also raises hogs. She wanted to apply for a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., a Kiva partner. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies and fertilizers.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Legioncito.
Maria es separada, tiene 36 años y 3 hijos, Maria tiene un restaurante llamado Rubi, en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hija, además vende yogurt natural que prepara su hija.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leche, baldes, ollas.
Los sueños de María son ahorrar para los estudios de sus hijos y tener una tienda para vender el yogurt.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Legioncito Communal Bank. Maria is separated, is 36 years old, and has three childlren. Maria has a restaurant, called Rubi, in a leased site. She tends to her business every day with the help of her daughter. She also sells natural yoghurt that her daughter makes. Maria needs a 900 sol loan to buy milk, buckets and pots. Maria's dreams is to save money to pay for the education of her children and to have a store in which to sell yoghurt.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy milk, buckets and pots.

loans.name: Thou

texts.en:
Mrs. Thou O. is a villager who lives in Pongro village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Mao Em, are farmers who own a 2-hectare field where they cultivate rice. Aside from farming, her husband is also a duck breeder who earns a small income to support his family.
                                           
Now is the dry season, so Mrs. Thou O. needs a loan from AMK to buy a water machine, fertilizer and pesticide to support her farm. She is 56 years old and the mother of two children, who are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy a water machine, fertilizer, pesticide

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: El señor Fernando es casado con la señora María del Pilar y con ellos vive un hijo de nombre Erik Martínez quien los apoya económicamente ya que labora para una empresa ecológica como recolector desde hace un año, y Don Fernando trabaja para una empresa de recursos y servicios empresariales como oficial, contando con una antigüedad de 13 años. Su esposa se encarga del cuidado del hogar. Ellos como una familia muy unida y establecida están tramitando este crédito para la impermeabilización del techo de su casa, ya que con la temporada de lluvias su techo se daño interior y exteriormente. (No se encontraba el solicitante por lo tanto se le tomo la fotografia del conyuge).
texts.en:
Mr. Fernando is married to Mrs. María del Pilar and they have a son named Erik Martínez who lives with them. He supports them financially now that he has worked for an environmental services business as a collector for a year. Fernando has worked for a business service and resource company for 13 years. His wife takes care of the house. They are a very close and stable family. They are requesting this loan in order to waterproof the house’s roof. Now that it’s rainy season, the roof is in danger internally and externally. (The applicant was unavailable for the picture, so the picture is of his wife.)

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: waterproofing the home's roof

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana D. R. is a 41-year old married woman who lives in Bagumbayan, Valladolid Negros Occidental. She earns a living by operating her general store, cafeteria and food vending businesses.

Ana’s husband, Ireneo, is 41 years old and works at a buy and sell of scrap business.  They have 2 children ages between 7 to 12 years old who are currently going to school.  They also help their parents as part of their daily chores.

Ana joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by starting the general store, cafeteria and food vending businesses. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 6,000.

Her previous loan of Php 20,000 was used to fund operations of her businesses, and had a positive impact on her family’s living conditions.  Ana is a member in good standing. Now she is borrowing for her 13th cycle loan, the amount of Php 20,000, which she intends to use to support her businesses. Ana is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.
----------------------------
About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret O. is a single woman who sells vegetables, fruits, charcoals and other items from a stall at her home.  She has been in this business for three years and has no other source of income. She sells mainly to neighbors. Her main challenge is that there are few customers in the middle of the month as most of her neighbors get paid at the end of the month. She rents her home, shares electricity with neighbors, and does not have piped water. Her greatest expenses are water and food. 

With the 60,000 Kenyan shilling (Kes) loan Margret is requesting, she wants to buy rice, flour, sugar, kale, tomatoes, onions, cooking oil, and charcoal.
She decided to work with Yehu because she liked their policies and loan terms. Her aspiration is to grow economically to be able to support herself. Margret describes herself as hardworking and independent.

loans.use: Rice, flour, sugar, kale, tomatoes, onions, cooking oil, and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia M. is from the town of Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 40 years old. Delia is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Delia owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Delia has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Delia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as additional working capital. Delia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Delia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Хусайнова Дилбар проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 34 года. Замужем, имеет 2 детей. Муж, на заработках в России. Сама Дилбар занимается животноводством. Имеет небольшой коровник, где разводит скот. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 3 лет. Кредит берет для закупа мелко - рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Dilbar H. lives in the region of Yavan. She is 34 years old. She is married and has two children. Her husband is working in Russia. Dilbar does animal husbandry. She has a small cow house where she breeds cattle. She has been in this business for more than three years. She is taking out the loan to buy small cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy small cattle

loans.name: Marylin De Fatima

texts.es: Marylin De Fátima tiene 41 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Inicio con fondos propios, realizando negocios con una pequeña pulpería, ubicada en su vivienda pues su Mama trabajaba en este negocio, con el paso del tiempo a ella le ha gusto y decidió hacerse cargo pues es una actividad muy rentable, luego decidió iniciar con su propio negocio, ya que necesitaba de un medio de ingreso para mantener a su hijo. El financiamiento es para la compra de ropa interior, juguetes, pantalones, camisas entre otras cosas. Sueña con establecer una tienda en donde ofrezca sus productos.
texts.en:
Marylin is 41 years old and sells general merchandise. She began with a few funds and started a small general store out of her home. Her mother used to run the business, and eventually [Marylin] liked it so she began to run it. It was very profitable and she decided to start her own business, since she needed a source of income with which to support her son. She will use the money from this loan to buy undergarments, toys, pants, and shirts among other things. She hopes to open a store where she can sell her merchandise

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Eustaquia

texts.en:
Eustaquia A. is from the village of Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 60 years old, married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Eustaquia owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling delicacies like fried peanuts, fried bananas and candies in the local community. Eustaquia has been in business for more than 25 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Eustaquia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eustaquia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Eustaquia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Eustaquia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet R. is from the village of Santa Felomena, Iligan City. At the age of 35 years old, she is married and has one young infant. To make a living, Juliet owns & operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks especially native delicacies in the local community. Juliet has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Juliet joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juliet has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients for her food products. Juliet is requesting a loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase more raw ingredients needed to make her food products. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Juliet from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for food products

location.town: Santa Felomena, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La Sra. Lucia A. tiene, 51 años D. edad, esta casada, y tiene 3 hijos, D. los cuales solo una es menor D. edad y esta cursando la secundaria.
La Sra. Lucia y su marido son docentes jubilados y ambos desD. el momento que inició el cobro D. sus jubilaciones decidieron abrir en su domicilio un copetín para dar servicios D. comidas y minutas a empleados D. un supermercado que se encuentra en frente D. su casa.
Solicita el crédito para la compra D.  materia prima como: carne, pollo, panificados, bebidas en general, aceite, harina y otros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucía A., 51, is married and has three children only one of whom is still a minor and in middle school. Lucía and her husband are retired teachers and since they retired they opened a small snack bar in their home in order to proviD. meals and snacks to employees of a supermarket across the street from their home. She is asking for funds to buy raw materials like: meat, chicken, baked goods, assorted beverages, cooking oil, flour, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials like: meat, chicken, baked goods, assorted beverages, cooking oil, flour, etc.

loans.name: Santiago Desiderio

texts.es:
Santiago Desiderio A. M. tiene 50 anos. Vive en union libre en el canton de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios. Tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 6 anos. 

Santiago es socio de la ventanilla rural San Francisco de Sibimbe. Son 13 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. 

Santiago se dedica a la agricultura y al cultivo de cacao. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en Ventanas. Solicita el credito para siembras de cacao. Con el apoyo de este prestamo mejorara mas la calidad de sus productos. Su sueno es avanzar en la agricultura y no quedarse en el mismo lugar. 

Le gusta pescar en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Santiago Desiderio A. M. is 50 years old. He lives with a woman in the Ventanas canton in the Los Rios province. He has 2 children who are 4 and 6 years old. Santiago is a member of the rural bank San Francisco de Sibimbe. There are 13 members in total, and most of them work in agriculture. Santiago works in agriculture and he grows cacao. He buys and sells his products in Ventanas. He is asking for the loan for cacao crops. With the support of this loan he will improve the quality of his products. His dream is to advance in agriculture and not stay in the same place. He likes to fish in his spare time.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cacao crops

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mr. Chantha L. is 42 years old and his wife, Mrs. Lam Thor, is 38 years old. They have been married for three years and have no children yet. The couple live in a small village along National Road Number Five about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Chantha has been a construction worker since he was single and his wife has been a garment factory worker for nine years. He hopes to change his business to a motor remoque taxi, so he is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike and trailer to launch the business.

A motor remoque is a motorcycle connected to a trailer at the back, and can carry many goods and people.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and trailer

loans.name: Amor Y Paz 1, 2 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Iluminada is the coordinator of her group Amor y Paz 1, 2 & 5 (Love and Peace). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and a child. She says that her most difficult challenge is to overcome their economic situation. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to play Domino and decorate.

Iluminida is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for three years, starting with some savings. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying home products. She will use the profits to buy her child school supplies and to invest in her business. She is dreaming to have her own house and she also wants her family to join her to improve her business.

This Esperanza associate began with us because she wanted to improve her business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican cleints, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production and the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water, none of which is potable, and electricity.

loans.use: To buy liquid soap, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio de 47 años, vende ropa junto a su esposa en un pequeño local viven en una zona periurbana llamada “Duran” este lugar esta caracterizado por su ecología en disolución.  

Comenzó a vender ropa invirtiendo sus ahorros por los problema económico y para que su esposa pudiera tener otro ingreso, con sus pocos ahorros compro ropa y comenzó a vender en su pequeño loca, por la buena clientela continuo con su negocio hasta ahora trabaja desde las 08h30am hasta las 20h00pm. 

Para mejorar sus ventas el quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa. En el futuro quiere que su negocio crezca y que sus dos hijos terminen los estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
Julio, 47, sells clothes with his wife in a small locale. They live in a periurban zone called Duran, notable for its deteriorating environmental conditions. He started selling clothes investing his own savings due to economic problems and so that his wife would have an extra source of income. With his meager savings he bought clothes and started to sell them in his small store. Thanks to his good customer base he continued with the business and now he is open from 8:30am until 8pm. To improve sales he wants to use the loan to buy clothes. In the future he’d like his business to grow and that his two children successfully finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For clothes.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily C. is from the village of Linconcomonan, Gingoog City. She is 43 years old. Emily is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $100 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Emily joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Emily is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Lebanese Kiva borrower is a 47-year old married man and has four school-age children. He has been working as a professional taxi driver since 1985. His income from his taxi business is essential to the development and care of his family. His main route is between his town and the surrounding villages. 

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1000 to perform much-needed repairs to his taxi, including improving the car’s body and engine after being in bad circumstances. He says that with the modifications, he will present a comfortable transportation service to his clients. In the future, he is hoping to expand his business by purchasing a new car.

loans.use: To perform much-needed repairs to his taxi.

loans.name: Kisa Kya Maria Women's Group-Kayunga

texts.en: David William S. is 44 years old and 'Kisa Kya Maria' is the group he belongs to. He has been operating a retail shop in Ntenjeru- Kayunga for the last three years. David is happily married with four kids. He also operates rentals, coffee sales, and stone quarrying. He says to start up in this business, he used his savings. 80,000 shillings is what he makes in a week. With this loan, William says he is going to purchase more general merchandise for resale at his shop.

loans.use: purchase of more general merchandise for resale

loans.name: John Kabare

texts.en:
John Kabari K. is 40 years old. He is married to Gladys Wangare and is a father of two children, aged two and a half and four years. John is a businessman and he deals with electrical services. He has been in the business for the past ten years.
  
John learned about KADET from a member of a group within his locality. This will be his fifth loan and he is planning to buy more electrical items to expand his electrical business. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to reinvest in the business and build a house for his family.

His dream is to become successful in his business and be known country-wide.

loans.use: To buy electrical items to expand business

loans.name: Chum

texts.en: Chum S., age 39, is a worker in the garment industry. She is married to Vanny, age 37 a motor taxi driver in Phnom Penh City.  They have three children all of whom are students. Chum S. has been working in ther job since 2008,  Her house is only partially built.  Chum S. says that her savings are insufficient to pay to finish the house. To solve this problem, Chum S. would like to request a loan to be used to finish building the rest part of her house and adding a toilet and kitchen.

loans.use: To  finish building the rest part of her house.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen A. O. is twenty eight years old. She is married.  Her husband is a teacher, and they have two children, aged ten years old and five years old. Her business is located at a busy market in Kisumu known as Dago market. She has a grocery stand at which she sells such items as vegetables, tomatoes, onions and fish. She has been in this business for five years now and she says that this business is profitable .
