The only major challenge she has is the long distance she walks in search of wholesalers from whom she purchases the items she sells. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She will use her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy cabbages, tomatoes and onions to expand her business and meet the demands of her customers. In the future, she hopes to grow her business to wholesale and provide employment to people through her business. She describes herself as obedient, disciplined and a risk taker.

loans.use: Cabbages, tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Asim

texts.en: Asim X. is a 40 year-old-man who lives and works in Sabirabad. He never received a formal education but all his life did his best to provide for his family. Asim is married and has one son, aged 16. His wife actively helps him in his cattle-breeding business, which he started in 2005. Asim buys animals at profitable prices and then raises and sells them in the livestock bazaar for a profit. Asim also has a little poultry business. His monthly income  is 300 AZN to support his family. This is the first loan that he has taken from Aqroinvest and Kiva. He used this loan of 1000 AZN to buy three cows. Asim says that the success of his business lies in the quality of his meat and dairy produce. Now he has six cows but after repaying this loan he would like to take out another loan to buy four more cows.

loans.use: to buy three cows

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
Shahida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her business of selling paper envelops. She receives orders from different stationary shops in the market and fulfills them in a timely way to earn an income for her family. With the loan she will buy paper envelops in bulk and increase her sales.
 
She started this business after the death of her husband. It was a time of great difficulty for her, but she faced it bravely.
  
Shahida couldn’t provide education facilities to her children due to financial constraints. Now both of her sons also work to contribute to the family financially. Her elder son works in the motor workshop while the younger one is an employee in a general store.
 
She lives with her family in Okara, which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fifth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy paper envelops for selling

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “EL MOLINITO II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alicia; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de pescados, la socia vende pescados en el mercado desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de pescados. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pescados al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Alicia is a member of the El Molinito II Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Alicia is 40 years old and single.  She has three children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business of selling fish.  She sells fish in the market from 6:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  Through this business she gets her children ahead.

She wants to expand and improve her business of selling fish.  She is requesting the loan to buy fish wholesale.  She is very happy about the loan, and she pledges to make the payments in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy fish wholesale

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie B. is from the village of Samay, Gingoog City. She is 24 years old. Rosalie is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalie owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling coconuts for copra in the local community. Rosalie has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Rosalie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalie is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional coconuts to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Rosalie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts to sell

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
CARLOS ALBERTO B. E., ES DE MANAGUA, EL TRABAJA DIARIO COMO FONTANERO, ES PADRE DE FAMILIA DE TRES HIJOS, Y ESTOS  ACTUALMENTE DEPENDE DE ELLA Y SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR.
DON CARLOS ALBERTO ACUDE A LAS OFICINAS DE CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN PRESTAMO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU VIVIENDA PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: ARENA, CEMENTO, PIEDRA Y HIERRO  PARA LA CONSTRUCCION DE UN MURO EN SU CASA DE HABITACION.
TODO ESTO PARA MEJORAR LAS CONDICIONES DE VIVIENDA PARA SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto B. E. is from Managua. He works every day as a plumber. He is the father of a family with three school-age children who all depend on him.

Carlos Alberto went to CEPRODEL's office to request a loan for making improvements to his home. He will invest in the purchase of construction materials like sand, cement, stone, and iron bars for building a wall in his house. He wants to do this in order to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace W. has been the owner of a retail store business for 10 years, and she works seven days a week. Grace sells her products from her home. She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and cans of cooking oil. The main business challenges for Grace include defaulters and the ever-increasing prices of commodities. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling at the wholesale level.    

Grace and her husband own a home in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. The have four children, all of whom are in school. The family has access to electricity and to piped water. Their major monthly expenses include food, school fees, and utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and cans of cooking oil

loans.name: Luis Salomon

texts.es:
LUIS SALOMON G., tiene 52 años de edad, es divorciado, vive con los 3 hijos, vive en San Miguel  en el Recinto Tangara perteneciente a la Provincia de Bolívar.

Esta Ventanilla se llama CAMPECINOS UNIDOS  esta ubicada en el recinto Tangara y se encuentra a unos 15 minutos del Cantón San Miguel, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura y al comercio.

Luis se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz y trigo por que son los productos que mas se venden.
Comprar sus productos, como semillas, en San Miguel y los vende en la Feria del mismo Cantón.

El crédito lo solicita para la comprar de insumos agrícolas fertilizantes y semillas, el crédito apoyado en el negocio familiar ya que produce mas y se tiene que trabajar para pagar la deuda. Su sueño es construir una chanchera grande y comprar cerditos para vender.

Los desafíos que se enfrenta son plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Le gusta festejar el carnaval con la familia.
texts.en:
Luis Salomon G. is 52 years old and divorced. He lives with his three children in Tangara, San Miguel Canton, Bolivar Province, Ecuador.

The credit window to which Luis belongs, Campesinos Unidos, is located in Tangara, about 15 minutes from the San Miguel Canton. (A canton in Ecuador is similar to a county in the USA.) The members of this credit window work in agriculture and trade.

Luis works in agriculture, planting corn and wheat, because these are the most commonly bought agricultural products. He buys his products, such as seeds, in San Miguel, and sells them in the market of the same canton.

He is applying for this loan to buy agricultural inputs, such as fertilizers and seeds. The credit will be supported by this family business, which will produce more as a result of the inputs and be able to pay back the debt promptly. His dream is to establish an operation to raise pigs for sale.

The biggest challenges that Luis faces are pests and sicknesses in his crops. He enjoys going to the carnival with his family.

loans.use: to buy inputs, such as fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar tiene 60 años y es soltero. Vive en casa familiar en el distrito de Motupe, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Cliente vive en la parte rural del distrito no cuenta con servicios de agua y luz. Gana la vida vendiendo ganada para engorde. El vende animales menores a clientes de su caserio y sus alrededores que los crian y los engordan para luego venderlos a los comerciantes que suelen visitar los mercados locales. Oscar desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales menores y alimento balanceado. Con esta inversión, podrá seguir generando buenos ingresos que usa para solventar sus gastos familiares y de su hogar.
texts.en:
Oscar is 60 years old and single.  He lives in his family home in Motupe district, an agricultural area in Lambayeque province, one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo.  Oscar lives in the rural part of the district and he doesn't have access to water or electricity services.

Oscar earns a living selling livestock to be fattened.  He sells young animals to customers in his village and surrounding areas who then raise them and sell them to the traders who visit the local markets.

Oscar would like to expand his business by purchasing more young animals and balanced feed.  With this investment, he will be able to continue making good profits which he uses to cover his family and household expenses.

loans.use: to buy more livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Albert Einstein once said, "Learn from yesterday, live for today, hope for tomorrow." This is what Gloria S., 60, does to make the most out of her life. At 60, Gloria has already lost her life partner. She currently lives with her children and young grandchildren in Silang, Cavite. Gloria finds fellowship and entrepreneurial training in CCT*, where she is one of thousands of Community partners.

Gloria is a fruit and vegetable dealer. She primarily sells tropical fruits like mangoes and pineapples, as well as fresh vegetables for every-day meals. Gloria's commercial space is located in another municipality; while she lives in Silang, her store is located in Kawit (still in Cavite). Monthly she earns a net income of Php5,400. 

Due to previous financial struggles,  Gloria decided to request a loan of Php10,000 to help her grow her business. She will use this to purchase more fruit and vegetables to add to the array of goods in her store. Gloria will only pick the freshest produce to sell to her valued customers. Gloria says that this loan will impact greatly on her business capital.

At present, one struggle she has is the long lists of debts accrued by some of her customers. Gloria will make use of her 38 years of experience in the business to solve this issue. She aims to improve her business and include more products to sell. Above all, she hopes that her children will be successful and that her grandchildren will finish their education. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 61 years old and married with four adult-aged children. She earns PHP 4,000 per month as a farmer working in the Philippines.

Erlinda has been growing corn for 25 years. She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fertilizers and seeds.

In the future, Erlinda hopes that her farming business will become progressive to be able to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 52 years old and lives in Bagacay, Sibutad Zamoboanga del Norte, She is married with one child.

To earn a living, Anecita has a grocery store where she sells a variety of food products. She earns about 4,500 PHP each month doing this type of work. Anecita has a requested a loan to purchase more products for her grocery store.

She has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her grocery store

location.town: Calamba - Bagacay, Sibutad, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a single woman with one child who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past five years, she has operated a restaurant business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation and seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a hotel in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase twenty plates, cooking pots, three bags of beans and four bags of maize. She decided to join Yehu to access loans because of its good customer relations.

loans.use: To purchase twenty plates, cooking pots, three bags of beans and four bags of maize.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin, 28, is married to Florence and has two children. He has been running his grocery business for the past two years. He earns a monthly income of about KES 20,000, which is used to meet family expenses and pump money back in the business.

He is asking a loan of KES 30,000 through KADET Ltd. He intends to use the loan to purchase more stock i.e. sugar, wheat flour, rice in bulk, maize flour in bulk, among others.

He plans to use the anticipated profit to open another shop. In the future, he hopes to open a super market.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of grocery items like sugar, wheat flour, rice in bulk, maize flour in bulk, among others.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 35 years old and she is a hardworking and determined businesswoman. She is married and blessed with two children, aged 16 and 13. She has been selling clothing for the last four years to make ends meet and supplements her income from the earnings she gets by offering hairdressing services.

In the next five years, she wants to have expanded her business and bought a plot so that she can actualize her dream of owning rental houses.

She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy ladies and gents undergarments. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for advancing her loans to inject into her business.

loans.use: to buy ladies and gents undergarments.

loans.name: Elena Nancy

texts.es:
Elena es madre de familia de 44 años, vive con su menor hijo en su casa propia, cuenta con el servicio de agua y luz, ubicado en el distrito de San José que pertenece al departamento de la Libertad.  Zona de actividad agrícola, ganadera y turística.

Elena cuenta con su negocio de venta de comida en su domicilio, brinda pensión a los trabajadores del Banco de la Nación de la ciudad donde vive, actividad que realiza desde  hace varios años, cuenta con su propia clientela, pero a pensado en solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1800 nuevos soles para comprar insumos y utensilios, con la finalidad de seguir brindando un buen servicio y satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su hijo.

Con su trabajo y sus ganas de salir adelante Elena se ha ganado la confianza y el respeto de sus vecinos, demostrando que cuando uno se propone una meta se puede hacer realidad, con el objetivo de que su hijo tenga un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Elena is a mother and 44 years old. She lives with her youngest son in their own house, which has water and electricity. It is located in the district of San José, which belongs to the department of La Libertad, which has agriculture, cattle, and tourism.

Elena has a business selling food in her home and she rents rooms to workers from the Bank of the Nation in the city where she lives. She has had this business for several years and has her own customers. She thought to request a loan from Edypme Alternative for PEN 1,800.00 to buy ingredients and utensils, with the goal of providing better service and satisfying the needs of her customers. With the income she receives she will be able to cover her loan and improve the quality of life for her son.

Through her hard work and her desire to get ahead, Elena has earned the trust and respect of her neighbors, demonstrating that when she sets a goal, she can make it into reality, so that her son can have a better future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and utensils so she can continue making the food she offers to her customers.

loans.name: Nova Niza

texts.en:
Nova Niza is 25 years old and is married with one child. She lives in Talairon, Oroquieta City. For the past four years, Nova Niza has run a shop where she sells a variety of goods such as candies, soft drinks, and bread. She has been a member of PMPC for ten years.  

Nova Niza is requesting a 3,000 PHP loan to purchase more merchandise for her general store. In the future, she hopes to own big grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase products for her general store

loans.name: Laura Isabel

texts.es: Laura tiene 33 años, casada con Ítalo quien trabaja de albañil y tienen 4 hijos cada uno de 12, 9, 8, 3 años y son estudiantes en instituciones fiscales. Ellos viven en la zona suburbana del fortín (localidad de Guayaquil), Laura empezó hace 2 años en su negocio, a ella le gusta tener sus propios ingresos y además contribuir con los gastos del hogar. Inicia sus labores desde la 6h00 hasta las 21h00. La zona en la que vive tiene lomas y caminos de tierra por lo que se hace dificultoso salir a hacer alguna actividad fuera de casa. Con el préstamo que ella espera obtener está pensando comprar 100 cuadernos para venderlos en $1,50; 20 láminas educativas a costo $0.50  entre otra mercadería para comercializar, espera obtener una buena ganancia y seguir apoyando a  sus hijos  para que el futuro sean una excelentes profesionales.
texts.en:
Laura is 33 years old, and married to Italo who works as a bricklayer. They have 4 children, aged 12, 9, 8, and 3, who are students in tax-supported institutions. They live in the suburban zone of El Fortin (a locality in Guayaquil). Laura began her business 2 years ago. She likes to have her own  income and also to contribute to covering household expenses.

Laura works from 6:00 am until  9:00 pm.  The zone where she lives  is hilly and has dirt roads, which makes it difficult to carry out any activity outside the home.

With the loan she hope to obtain, Laura plans to buy 100 notebooks to sell at $1.50, and 20 laminated school sheets at $0.50, among other merchandise, to sell. Laura hopes to obtain good earnings and to continue helping her children so that in the future they may become excellent professionals.

loans.use: to buy notebooks and paper products to sell.

loans.name: Las Palmas Km 14  Portoviejo Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Las Palmas KM 14 se reúne cada quince días en el  en el sitio D. mismo nombre D. Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Este es un grupo de personas que hace 4 meses atrás decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal que les ha servido  de mucho ya que con los créditos ellas han podido mejorar sus pequeños negocios. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.

Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Ruth, es socia fundadora D. Banco comunal y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos. Tiene 49 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 4 hijos, tres de ellos ya son mayores de edad y el menor de 7 años el mismo que estudia en escuela. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que lo da todo por su hogar y por sus hijos, ella para ayudar a su marido con los gastos que genera el hogar se dedica a la venta de zapatos y sandalias por catálogo, trabaja cuatro días de la semana y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta pues ella visita a sus clientes en estos días mas que todo por las tardes cuando está desocupada, nos cuenta que ya lleva dos años dedicada a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene bastantes clientes.

Este crédito es para comprar zapatos y sandalias ya que tiene varios pedidos.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y en el banco comunal.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank, Las Palmas KM 14, meets every fifteen days in the Canton of Montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its arts and crafts which are nationally and internationally recognized.  They are also known for their famous Panama-style hats.

Four months ago, these members decided to organize and form a communal bank.  The credit that they have been able to receive has helped them improve their small businesses.  All of the members work in diverse areas, such as business, services, food sales.

One of the members of this group is Ms. Ruth.  She is one of the founding members of the communal bank and likes it very much because she can easily obtain loans.  She is 49 years old and has 4 children, three of whom are adults and one of whom is a minor of seven years old who attends school.  Her husband is a business man.

She is a very good house wife who gives her all to her home and to her children.  In order to help her husband with their household costs, she works in the sale of shoes and sandals by catalog.  She works four days a week and sells them door to door, mainly visiting her clients in the afternoon.  She has been doing this for over two years and states that is has been going very well, as she has numerous customers.

This loan will be used to purchase shoes and sandals, since she already has many orders.

Her dreams are to expand her business and the communal bank.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and sandals.

loans.name: Khlok's Group

texts.en:
This 5-member group of people, led by Klork, resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area with a variety of businesses including agriculture, livestock-breeding, and fisH..

Klork is a 46-year-old married woman who lives with her common-law husband with whom she has six children, one of whom is already married and living separately. The other five are single, living with her, and attending high school and primary school. A very hard-working woman involved in the fisH. business, she can earn enough income to cover her family’s expenses.

Klork is now requesting her first loan with Kiva partner HKL in the amount of $100USD to buy fisH. materials. She and her family hope that it will contribute to her family's financial well-being, and they are very grateful to all of Kiva's lenders for their support. Klork’s dreams are to have a large house and enable all of her children to at least finish high school.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials.

loans.name: Glem Americo

texts.es:
Glem casado, su hijo estudiante, trabajador, de profesión ingeniero, junto a su compañera de vida tiene un negocio en el cual tiene planes de ampliarlo e ingresar mayores cantidades y variedad de productos. Su negocio se basa en la venta de comida siendo el principal factor de comercialización. Inicio su negocio en pequeñas cantidades y de la idea de vender tacos leoneses. El negocio está establecido desde hace un tiempo siendo rentable. Es su primer ciclo de préstamo el cual requiere para realizar mejoras en el local del negocio. 
Con el préstamo comprara materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, azulejos, láminas de zinc, cielo rasó, pinturas,  bloques entre otros. Ya que remodelara la cocina del restaurante, le pondrá cielo rasó, cambiara algunas paleta de ventana, lo pintara. Dándole mejor presentación y mayor comodidad a los clientes que lo visita. Agradece a ala financiera por el apoyo al desarrollo de su negocio y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Glem is married, his son’s a student.  He’s hardworking and is an Engineer by profession.  He has a business together with his life partner that he’d like to expand and add larger amounts and variety of products.  His business is based on food sales, the main products he sells.  He started the business with small amounts and the idea to sell León-style tacos.  The business has been in operation for some time now and it’s been profitable.  This is his first loan cycle and he wants to use the loan to make some improvements to the business’ locale.

He will use the loan to buy building materials and supplies like: cement, sand, tile, metal sheeting, ceiling panels, paint and concrete blocks, among others because he will remodel the locale’s kitchen, install a ceiling, replace window hinges and paint to give it a better appearance and more comfort to the customers who come by.  He thanks the financial institution for the support for his business’ development and to his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Gerlyn

texts.en:
Gerlyn is 33 years old. She is married with 3 children.

Gerlyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Gerlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Gerlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks to sell

loans.name: Rabiaa

texts.en:
Rabiaa is a 32-year-old married woman and mother of three children.  

She sells women clothes, is hard working and has been in business for three years.  Rabiaa is a talented business woman who has a very good reputation.

She requests a loan from Kiva partner A. Mjamoua so she can start selling women lingerie.  Rabiaa works hard to introduce her customers to this new section of her shop and plans to develop it and increase sales more and more in the future.

Rabiaa wishes to open a shop that sells family clothes and shoes.

loans.use: to increase her business products by selling lingerie.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 45 years old and a married woman. She is a very loving mother with her children and spouse. She is very busy with her rolling store, offering a variety of vegetables to the people of the community. She sells house to house.

Luz is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy tomatoes, beans, leafy vegetables and fruits for her business. She dreams that someday she can construct her own stall for her business.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, beans, leafy vegetables and fruits for her business.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is 45 years old with one child aged 14. He is married to a businesswoman. He has been selling foodstuffs for 2 years. He would like a loan to buy beans and maize to sell. Emmanuel would like to use the profits to build his own business space so he does not need to rent space.

loans.use: To buy more beans and maize for sale

loans.name: Dopé

texts.fr:
Dope est une femme âgé(e) de 44 ans. Elle est mariée å un imprimeur avec 02 enfants en charge.
Dope travaille comme revendeuse de jus et des produits génériques depuis 2005. Elle vend à domicile à ses clients et achète les produits au Grand Marché de Lomé.
Dope a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des sucres, de l’arome et des produits génériques.
Dans les prochaines années, Dope voudrait diversifier son commerce.
texts.en:
Dope is a 44 year old woman. She is married to a printer and they have two children in their care.  
Dope has been selling juices and generic products since 2005.  She sells to her clients from her home and gets her supplies at the Grand Marché in Lomé. 
Dope has requested her second loan through WAGES in order to buy sugar, flavorings, and general merchandise. 
In the years to come, Dope would like to diversify her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar and general merchandise.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is 33 years old and is a married woman with four children. Two of them are in school. She has had a business selling fish in Bor South Sudan for two years.

Amer is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of 8 children, Marilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and raising pigs. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is 33 years old and married to Amos. They have three children. She has been running a retail shop for the last three years, earning a monthly income of KES 6,000.

She is requesting her first loan with loan KADET Ltd. of KES 15,000 to buy stocks of maize and wheat flour, cereals, washing detergents, sugar and cooking oil. With the anticipated profits she will expand her business and educate her children.

Her dreams is to uplift the living standards of her family and own a wholesale store.

loans.use: to buy stock of wheat and maize flour, cereals, detergents, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 39 years old married and has three children. She has been buying and selling scrap metal for the last 7 years earning a monthly income of Kes 9000.

She is requesting her first loan with KADET Ltd of Kes 7,000. She will use the loan to purchase more scrap metals for sale. With the anticipated profits she will pay school fees.

Her hopes and dreams are to be financially stable and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy scrap metals.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Cheyenne her daughter is 18 years old and is the first of two children in the family. Her mother Ruby, who is the member of Project Dungganon, supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines.

Cheyenne is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Radiologic Technology and is currently in the first year of this four-year course.

Cheyenne is borrowing 10,000 PHP to pay the tuition fees for the second semester of the 2013-14 school year.

When she graduates, Cheyenne plans to finish her studies and help her parents.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Justina Mariluz

texts.es: La Sra. Justina tiene 68 años de edad, está casada y tiene 6 hijos que ya no dependen de ella. Tiene como fuente de trabajo una bodega en casa desde hace algunos años donde ofrece diferentes productos y alimentos al por menor, es por ello que el préstamo lo utilizara en comprar al por mayor productos para su bodega como paneton, yogur, leche y demás productos. Ella se siente contenta y agradecida por el apoyo que está recibiendo por parte de los inversionistas de kiva, y pide que el apoyo continúe con muchas personas que lo necesitan para cumplir con sus objetivos.

loans.use: COMPRA DE PANETON YOGUR LECHE Y DEMAS PRODUCTOS

loans.name: Marta

texts.en:
Ms. Marta is wise and very friendly. She has 8 children who are all economically independent of their parents; Ms. Marta started her business when faced with her husband\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\'s illness when she became responsable for her home\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\'s expenses. Five years ago she began her business; her children help, but she needs economic support to give the business a boost. Currently Ms. Marta and her husband live off what her small business makes, but they need your support and generosity. She needs a $200.00 USD loan to buy merchandise that will enable her business to have more products in order to meet with her business\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\'s high demand. Support Ms. Marta. She thanks you for your kindness and generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Marta es una persona sabia y muy amigable, ella tiene 8 hijos y todos son económicamente independientes de sus padres; Doña Marta inició su negocio al enfrentar la enfermedad de su esposo y tener que ser la responsable de los gastos de su casa, hace 5 años que ella empezo su negocio, sus hijos ayudan en el mismo, sin embargo este necesita de un apoyo económico para ser impulsado. Actualmente Doña Marta y su esposo viven de lo que su pequeño negocio les proporciona, sin embargo necesitan de tu apoyo y generosidad.

Ella requiere de un préstamo de $200 USD para comprar mercancía que le permitirá tener mas cantidad de productos en su negocio y de esta forma enfrentara la alta demanda que tiene su negocio. Apoya a doña Marta, ella agradece tu cariño y generosidad.

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Astou

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the ten women of the Dieuf Diauregnou association, led by Astou N.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

«Our business consists of purchasing various food and household supplies in bulk at very good prices, and selling them at prices that are very appropriate in the local markets. Our business strategy depends on the regular refilling of our stocks of goods.

The members of the Dieuf Diauregnou group are very actives in FAFS of Diourbel [a village-based environmental protection organization] and very experienced in the retailing business. The lack of finance for investment has always been the obstacle for the strengthening and expansion of our small business. The group is also engaged in the retailing of traditional cloth skirts and other small clothing items, and this activity is very profitable. Our members will profit greatly from access to finance for investment, with a positive effect on the training of other sectors, such as traditional artisans.”

Original French business description:

« Contexte du projet : la pauvreté dans les ménages est aujourd’hui une donné incontournable dans la commune de DIOURBEL. Les conséquences au niveau du tissu social sont frappantes surtout du point de vue du développement de l’entreprenariat féminin de l’accès des femmes aux sources de financements. Les chefs de ménages les moins nantis éprouvent d’énormes difficultés pour satisfaire leurs besoins. Les femmes ( chefs de ménages ) sont les plus touchées par le mal. Cette situation poussent les femmes à partir dans les grandes villes comme DAKAR sans réellement de projets et souvent sans financement. Mais avec un peu de soutien matériel et un suivi les femmes peuvent sans sortir . Les membres ( FAFS de DIOURBEL ) sont des partenaires de l’ écovillage KEER GU MAG depuis de longues dates et se retrouvent dans plusieurs activités touchant l’environnement et la protection de la nature. Objectif général : Améliorer les activités du petit commerce au profit des membres du groupement DIEUF DIAUREGNOU membre de la FAFS.

ACTIVITES : Activés 01 Il s’agira d’acheter dans un premier temps du matériel de consommations et divers articles à de très bons prix et les revendre avec des prix très adaptés dans les marchés locaux. La stratégie : elle repose sur le renouvellement des stocks périodiques des articles

Conclusions : le groupement sopeye sérigne Fallou S/c de DIEUF DIAUREGNOU est un groupe de femmes membres très actives de la FAFS de DIOURBEL est très expérimenté en matière de vente de petits articles divers, le manque d`appui a toujours été le frein pour le renforcement et l ’élargissement des activités du petits commerces. Le groupement s investit en même temps dans le petit commerce de pagnes et autres effets vestimentaires et cette activité est très rentable. Avec un peu d’appui les membres bénéficiaires tireront beau coups de bénéfices avec un effet entraînement. pour les autres secteurs comme l’artisanat. »

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Bulk purchase of food and household goods; transportation to market; rental of shop or market stall for retail sale

loans.name: Inés

texts.en:
Ines has owned her clothing store for twenty years. When she first began at the age of 18, she was looking to support herself when her husband left her. She sold fast food, household items, clothes, and women’s accessories, so now she is mature enough to be considered a seasoned salesperson. Ines wanted to sell clothes because they were her favorite products to sell, and she thought she could make a decent living selling quality products door-to-door. She did that for a period of time, marketing her items mainly to friends and family, as well as local neighborhoods where she knew most of the people.

This 37 year-old entrepreneur has four children, all of whom still live with her. Two of the children are working and help Ines financially with necessities for the house. Her husband has been working in a factory for the last 15 years, and whenever Ines has to attend to her children or visit her distributors, her husband is able to watch over the business which is open from 8am until 11pm every day.

Ines has borrowed from Kiva and Mifex before. She was able to successfully invest her first loan. She saved her extra profits after purchasing a wide variety of products to sell. Shortly afterwards, she opened a new point of sale that is being run by her children. She is very happy about this because it is bringing in extra income for herself and also providing for her children. The new loan she will take out will be invested in new inventory for her two stores.

loans.use: Increase her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his auto-mechanic shop

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es:
My name is Blanca and I have been selling home-made meals for four years. Along with my daughter we sell meals all day. We sell snacks like fried bananas, baleadas (burritos), enchiladas, tacos and others. The income from the sales is the only family revenue, for this reason we need working capital to improve our revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Blanca y me dedico desde hace cuatro años a la venta de comidas caseras. Junta a mi hija vendemos comidas desde horas de la mañana y por la tarde vendemos golosinas como platanos fritos, baleadas, enchiladas, tacos y otros. Las ventas son el unico ingreso familiar, por lo que necesitamos capital de trabajo para mejorar nuestro ingreso.

loans.use: Buy lard, corn flour, beans, sodas and vegetables.

loans.name: Bukola

texts.en: Bukola A. is 31 years old, married with 3 children. She has 7 years' experience in her business. She sells drinks and equally rents videos to people living in her community. Hence she is in need of $1175 to buy more drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and videos

loans.name: Lagos 3 Group

texts.es:
Rosa is a artisan. Her entire family -parents, brothers and sisters, and children- is involved in this activity. They sell their products for wholesale or retail in Zincantan or Nachij. They also rent a stand in the city of Ocozocuautla and pay someone to attend to that business. Every 20 days she travels to where their stand is and brings more goods to sell. They make napkins, tablecloths, shawls, blouses and pillowcases. The rest of the members of the group also make embroidered clothing which they sell to tourists. Maria M. is the only one who devotes her time to the purchase of seed and cultivation of flowers, in particular, roses. She rents a stand in the city of Tuxtla where she sells her flowers and makes floral arrangements for different events.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

ROSA ES ARTESANA TODA SU FAMILIA DESDE SUS PADRES , HERMANOS E HIJOS SE DEDICAN A ESTA ACTIVIDAD SUS PRODUCTOS LOS VENDEN POR MAYOREO O MENUDEO EN ZINACANTAN O NACHIJ. TAMBIEN CUENTAN CON UN LOCAL QUE RENTAN EN LA CIUDAD DE OCOZOCUAUTLA Y LE PAGAN A UNA PERSONA PARA QUE ATIENDA EL NEGOCIO Y CADA 20 DIAS ELLA VIAJA LLEVANDO MERCADERIA PARA SURTIR EL LOCAL .HACEN SERVILLETAS , MANTELES , CHALES, BLUSAS Y COJINES.LAS DEMAS MIEMBROS DEL GRUPO TAMBIEN TRABAJAN HACIENDO PRENDAS DE ARTESANIA QUE VENDEN CON LOS TURISTAS SOLAMENTE MARIA M. SE DEDICA A LA COMPRA DE SEMILLAS Y CULTIVO DE FLORES EN ESPECIAL ROSAS, RENTA UN LOCAL EN LA CIUDAD DE TUXTLA DONDE VENDE SUS FLORES Y HACE ARREGLOS FLORALES PARA EVENTOS .

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of fabric, thread and materials for weaving, in order to reduce costs

loans.name: Siti

texts.en: Siti H.,35, has three children. Her husband, Akah, is no longer working; therefore, to provide income for the family, Siti opened a small shop at her house where she sells food, earning US$15 a day. She is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan of US$100 to buy more goods for her shop. Siti will repay the loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Purchase of goods for sale

loans.name: Pavlina

texts.en: Pavlina I. lives in the village of Mighailovo near Vratza. She is married and has two kids. Together with her husband, she breeds two cows and now wants to buy one more. That’s why she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy one more cow

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Mrs. Kong H., 53, works selling Khmer noodle at school and earns around $2 a day of profit. Her husband is a teacher at a school in his village with a salary $55 a month. They have 8 children, one of who is married and lives away from home and others who are students. She requests a loan from Kiva to reinvest in her business selling more fruits such as mango, orange, sugar cane and etc.

loans.use: Use this loan to sell more fruits.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es: The experience of Genoveva's husband in putting together fireworks shows, motivated her to start promoting his business. Now she helps with each of his contracts and also contributes in the production and final arrangements of each show, including security to avoid any accidents. These fireworks shows are very popular in every village of their city. That's why Genoveva, with her excellent administrative skills, would like to grow the business and prepare for the requests from their clients who are getting ready for the festivals they will celebrate in this beautiful Peruvian valley. La experiencia del esposo de Genoveva, para fabricar espectáculos pirotécnicos han conducido a esta trabajadora madre ha introducirse y ser un especie de promotora de la labor de su querido esposo, ella asesora cada uno de sus contratos y también contribuye con la fabricación y arreglos finales de cada uno de los castillos que llevan a cabo, también está pendiente de las normas de seguridad y trata de supervisar a diario el cumplimiento de lo pactad a fin de evitar accidentes,Estos espectáculos son muy vistosos y agradables y no faltan en las actividades de cada pueblito de su ciudad, ella como excelente administradora desea incrementar su capital de trabajo a fin de prepararse con antelación a las solicitudes de sus exigentes clientes que están próximos a hacer las peticiones por las fechas festivas que celebrarán en este hermoso valle del Perú.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE THE SUPPLIES THEY WILL NEED FOR THEIR FIREWORKS SHOWS,  PREPARING IN ADVANCE FOR THE UPCOMING FESTIVALS.

loans.name: Khim

texts.en: Mrs. Khim P. lives in Kork Char Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is married with seven children, three of whom stay at home to help their mother, one studies at state school and the  other three are employed in a garment factory. The garment factory is far from the family home and the family have been spending a lot of money on taxis. Mrs. Khim P. has asked for this loan so that she can buy a motorcycle which the three children will use to go to work, saving money in the long run.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her three children.

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en:
Sreng S. is 31 years old and a mother of four. She is a widow living with her four young children in Prekmohatep Village, Battambang Province. For income, Mrs. Sreng works at the local office of a non-governmental organization (NGO) and also rents out rooms in her house. She earns a combined $6.80 per day from these activities.

Mrs. Sreng seeks a $500 loan to purchase tools to construct more rooms and decorate existing rooms for her tenants. The loan will allow her to attract more tenants and possibly increase rental rates for rooms in her home.

loans.use: To purchase tools to construct more rooms in her house as well as decorate existing rooms to cater  to tenants.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom M., 41, lives in Kampong Cham with her husband, Khim Kuy, and five of their children. She goes to the local market each day and sells vegetables for about US$1.60 each day, while her husband works in construction and typically makes US$2 per day. Three of their daughters are also employed, and contribute some money each month from their work in the garment factories.

Despite these five sources of income, though, inflation and other economic difficulties require Mom M. to look for other ways to increase her family's income to support them. In an effort to diversify her family's income and create more economic stability, Mom M. has asked for a loan of US$700 to purchase a motorbike for her husband. With the new motorbike, he can operate a motortaxi service in his spare time after his construction work. She believes this investment can be of great benefit to her family and is optimistic about her future.

loans.use: Purchase a motorbike to run a taxi service

loans.name: Bich

texts.en:
Bich S., 27, is a married mother of a young child living in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She earns about $1 U.S. dollar every day working in the fields as a farmer, while her husband, Chea Sary, operates a taxi service. He can typically bring in about US$5 a day.

Bich and Chea depend largely on his salary. Unfortunately, his taxi cab is broken, and they lack the funds to repair it. That's why Bich has applied for a loan of US$1,000 to repair her husband's car and help support her family. She looks forward to the return of a steady source of income and is optimistic about their investment.

loans.use: To pay for repairs for a taxi cab

loans.name: Aida

texts.es:
Aída después de haberse divorciado, decidió emprender un negocio que le dejara ganancias pues para salir adelante y vivir cómodamente. Al darse cuenta que sus vecinas batallaban para llevar a sus hijos a la escuela por estar retirada de la colonia, vio la oportunidad de emprender este negocio, ya que son muchos los niños que van a la escuela, primero empezó llevando a niños de primaria, posteriormente con el paso del tiempo decidió que también le era posible llevar a los de secundaria, ya que hay un buen numero de jóvenes de secundaria. Actualmente le ha ido muy bien, pero tiene el deseo y la inquietud de ampliar su negocio extenderse a colonias aledañas a su domicilio, al igual a escuelas del mismo sector.

Ella necesita de un préstamo por US $775 que pagara en 6 meses para compra una camioneta para el transporte escolar y así ampliar su negocio, tiene toda la fe que con el apoyo de Kiva obtendrá su crédito y podrá ampliar su negocio y así poder apoyar a las madres de familia con sus hijos.
texts.en:
After her divorce, Aida decided to start a business that would allow her enough earnings to get ahead and live comfortably. She realized that her neighbors were struggling to take their children to school due to living in remote areas of the neighborhood. She saw the opportunity to start this business since there were so many school-aged children. She began taking children to elementary school, and as time passed she decided that it was also possible to take those who go to secondary school since there were also a large number of them. It has been going very well for her, but she has the desire and the interest to expand her business and extend to other surrounding neighborhoods as well as the schools in the same sector.

She needs a loan of $775.00 US which will be repaid in 6 months in order to buy a bus for school transportation and thereby expand her business. She has complete faith that with the support of Kiva she will obtain her credit and will be able to expand her business. This will in turn allow her to support the mothers of the families with children.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a bus

loans.name: Olayinka

texts.en: Olayinka is 39 years old and married to Mr. O.; they have one child. Olayinka is a Lapo client; she sells provisions and has been in this business since 1998. Recently, she started selling kerosene. Olayinka hopes to buy and sell kerosene in the wholesale market. She is seeking a loan of 1200 USD to buy kerosene wholesale to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders and to Lapo microfinance!

loans.use: To buy more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Mwesigwa Jalia's Group

texts.en:
Jalia M. is a client of Pearl Microfinance in Massajja. She is a business woman selling green bananas (‘matooke’) and tap water from her home since 2001. She has been in her lending group for one year and so far, the situation is not bad. She is married with six children and she cares for two orphans including paying their school fees and up-keep, and providing clothing for them. With her matooke selling business, she sells both bunches and banana fingers plucked and this has enabled her to sell more, since not everyone can afford a bunch.

Jalia needs a loan to help with buying more produce for sale from the trucks that usually bring to her place; though, at times, she waits for the trucks by the road side. She also has a dream of starting up a retail shop with a hope that it will bring in more profits; hence, a much better life for her family.

loans.use: To help with buying more produce for sale from the carriage trucks

loans.name: Magda

texts.es: Magda tiene 20 años, es soltera, vive sola en un cuarto que alquiló. Es una joven que ha trabajado desde hace 6 años en la venta de joyas que adquiere de revistas, trayéndolas desde otros lugares, para venderlas en la ciudad de Juliaca. Le gusta su trabajo, ya que se trata de ayudar las mujeres a sentirse más bonitas de lo que ya son, con los productos que ella ofrece, ella piensa que su trabajo es muy dignificante, ya que le permite sentirse útil y tiene deseos de crecer y superarse mucho más. Magda se encuentra en el primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de joyas para poder mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Magda, 20, is single and lives by herself in a rented room. Magda is a young woman who has been selling jewelry for six years. She buys jewelry from a catalog, and brings it from other places to sell in the city of Juliaca. What she likes about her job is that she is helping women feel prettier wearing the jewelry that she sells. Her job makes her feel useful and worthy. Magda's goal is to make her business grow and to have a much better life. This is Magda's first loan through Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma. The loan will be used to purchase more jewelry and improve her sales and profits.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing the amount of jewelry to sell

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte C. sells food, like beans and maize, in Elmina. Charlotte has received no formal education.  She is married and has 1 child. Her husband is a fisherman. 

Charlotte has been selling food since 1991. She is responsible for helping her husband to pay their children's school fees, utility bills, and family expenses, because her husband's income is too small to meet the needs of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more food to meet her customers' increasing demand. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in a building project she is embarking on with her husband for the family.

In the picture, is she in her warehouse where she keeps the bags of maize, beans, and other foods for distribution. On the floor are the empty food sacks. She was out of stock when the picture was taken.

loans.use: To buy more food to meet her customers' increasing demand.

loans.name: Yesenia Guadalupe

texts.es:
L. señorita Yesenia tiene un negocio propio que viene D. tradición en tradición no solamente en su familia sino en L. D. todos los mexicanos. Ellos L. han ido conservando ya que su negocio “Piñatas S.” tiene 15 años exportando piñatas a  Estados Unidos.
ElL. solicitando este crédito para invertir en material para L. elaboración D. más piñatas  asi  su negocio seguirá creciendo y será más productivo.
texts.en:
Yesenia owns her own business based on a tradition that doesn't belong just to her family, but a tradition that belongs to all Mexicans. She is helping conserve this tradition through her business 'Piñatas S.', which has exported piñatas to the United States for 15 years. She is seeking a loan to buy materials to make more piñatas, so that her business can continue to grow and become more productive.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in the manufacture of piñatas

loans.name: Naim

texts.en: Naim is a 23-year-old single man living in Maarakeh, southern Lebanon. He already took several loans from Ameen to improve his butcher shop. Today, Naim wants to borrow $1,200 in order to increase his inventory and to buy a new meat slicer.

loans.use: Buy meat inventory

loans.name: Mbathio's Group

texts.fr: Réunues au sein d'une association dénommée associationdes relais de Djilakh, ces femmes habitant un village pres de la ville de Mbour s' activent dans le secteur de l'agriculture notament dans dans l'élevage de betail depuis plus de trois ans.l'association achette une vache ou un boeuf pour chacune d'elle .Cet animal est élevé pendant au moins 4 mois avant d être vendu.les recettes titrées de la vente de cet animal vont permettre à la femme de parciper aux charges du foyer.Avec le pret q'elles sollicitent elles veulent renforcer leurs activités et accroitre ainsi leur revenu.
texts.en:
Gathered together in the heart of the association called “Association des relais de Djilakh”, these women living in village near the city of Mbour. They have been active in the agricultural field, notably in raising livestock, for three years. The Association buys a cow or a steer for each of the women. The animal is raised for at least four months and then sold. The receipts derived from the sale of the animal will enable the group member to help meet household expenses. With the loan the women are requesting, they want to bolster their businesses and thus increase their income.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
ROSARIO SAJAMÍ SANTAMARÍA, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Rosas” con domicilio en la Av. Yarinacocha N° 1090 del distrito de Yarinacocha, tiene 30 años, 04 hijos pequeños, y su cónyuge trabaja en la municipalidad.

El primer préstamo fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con el que inicio junto con su hermana un restaurant, que al principio estuvo muy bien, pero después dejo de funcionar y se retiro del negocio.

Hoy se dedica a arrendar habitaciones y es por eso que el préstamo que es de S/.1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la refacción  de unos cuartos y dándole el acabado así como la seguridad para alquilarlos, por lo que está invirtiendo en compra de listones, tablas, puertas, clavos y todo lo necesario para que los cuartos sean habitable y confortables.

Muy agradecida comenta que Manuela Ramos es una ONG, que ayuda a las mujeres a crear y mantener una mini empresa, siempre que sean buenas pagadoras.
texts.en:
ROSARIO SAJAMÍ SANTAMARÍA is a member of the “Las Rosas” Community Bank located at Av. Yarinacocha, no. 1090, in the district of Yarinacocha. She is 30 years old, and has 4 small children. Her husband works for the municipality. Her first loan was for 300 Nuevos Soles, which she used to start a restaurant with her sister. Initially things went well, but it eventually stopped working, and she closed the business. She now rents rooms; therefore, she is requesting a loan of 1,200 Nuevos Soles to invest in remodeling and putting the finishing touches on several rooms, as well as making them secure, in order to rent them out. She is investing in purchases of batten trim, paneling, doors, nails, and everything else to ensure that the rooms are habitable and comfortable. In expressing her immense gratitude, she comments that Manuela Ramos is an NGO that helps women start and maintain micro-businesses on the condition they faithfully repay their obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Claudio Cambon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodeling of rooms. Purchase of batten trim, paneling, doors, nails - everything  to ensure that the rooms are comfortable.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị NguyễnThị Bẩy 66 tuổi, gia đình chị có 2 con đều đã trưởng thành. Chị Bẩy tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1999. Ban đầu chị vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi bò. Sau một thời gian tham gia Quỹ, với số vốn vay được tăng dần gia đình chị đã sử dụng để đấu thầu đồi rừng trồng cây ăn quả. Hiên tại bên cạnh nguồn thu từ công việc trồng trọt gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu từ việc đi làm thuê của con trai với thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 12.000.000đ để đầu tư mua 2 con bò và mua phân bón phục vụcho công việc trồngtrọt của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi B. is 66 years old. She has two grown-up children. Mrs. B. has participated in TYM Fund since 1999. Initially she borrowed money to raise cows. After a period of participation in the Fund, with the increased amount of loan, her family invested the money to bid for forest land to plant fruit trees. Currently, apart from the income from the plantation business, her family also receives financial support from her son with a total income of VND 3,000,000 per month.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND 12,000,000 to buy two cows and fertilizer for the plantation business of her family.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy two cows and fertilizer for the plantation business

loans.name: Marcelina  Josefa

texts.es: La señora Marcelina  es originaria de la aldea Nimasac pero hoy en dia esta arquilando casa en la comunidad de Vasquez ella desde hace 15 años viene ejerciendo la activida en la compra y venta de ropa Americana en el mercado municipal de la localidad los dias martes y Miercoles hoy necesita un credito para incrementar su negocio para los dias restantes de la semana ya  que se le autorizo otro  punto de venta en la plaza municiapl en la cual necesita de un nuevo capital,  para poder desarrollarse  y tener un nivel de vida adecuada de su familia
texts.en:
Marcelina is a native of the small village of Nimasac, but now she is renting a home in the community of Vasquez. For 15 years, Marcelina has bought and sold American clothing in the town market on Tuesdays and Wednesdays. Now she needs a loan to expand her business to the other days of the week, given that she was authorized to sell in another location in the town plaza. For this reason, she needs new capital to be able to develop and to have an adequate standard of living for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is a vegetable vendor in the village of Minallo, Naguillan, Isabela. She is 43 years old and is married to Charlie R.. The couple is blessed with three children. Cherry is 21 years old and a high school graduate; Laila is 18 years old and working as a restaurant server in Manila; and their youngest child Charlie R. Jr. is 13 years old attending high school student.

Luz is requesting a loan through ASKI for PHP 12,000 to use in her vending business. She earns around PHP 300 in net income each week, which helps cover the family's basic daily commodities. Luz is grateful that she is able to help her husband provide for their important needs, especially in giving financial support towards the studies of her youngest child. She hopes that the loan will pave the way to a progressive business that enables her to continue sending her child to school through college. Aside from that, Luz also dreams of having their house renovated someday and is working very hard for the attainment of all her life dreams.

loans.use: To expand her vegetable vending business.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Nguyễn Thị is a 37 year-old woman living in the town of Mê Linh. She is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Huệ raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising cattle for sale. Huệ has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 4000000 VND a month.

In 1996, Huệ joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Huệ has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000000 VND from TYM Fund used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. Huệ requests a loan of 15000000 VND to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be the twelth taken out from TYM Fund.

Huệ plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: Purchase breeding livestock.

loans.name: Carmen Ruth

texts.es:
La señora Carmen Ruth Martínez Z. tiene 62 años, vive en el Distrito de La Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Superior  Secretariado Ejecutivo,  no tiene  hijos que depende económicamente de ella.
Carmen se dedica a la Elaboración de Carteras y Almohadones bordadas en cintas y tejidos, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Nueva Esperanza  II, lo invirtió en la compra de materiales como cintas, hilos, broches, lentejuelas y telas.
El crédito de 500 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de  materiales como cintas, hilos, broches, lentejuelas y telas para implementar su negocio.
Carmen tiene como sueño aprehender más manualidades como bisutería para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carmen Ruth Martínez Z. is 62 years old and lives in the La Espranza district of Trujillo in La Libertad, Peru. Carmen studied to be an executive secretary. She has no dependent children. Carmen makes wallets and embroidered pillows for a living and works from home. She bought materials like: belts, thread, brooches, sequins and fabric with the first loan of 300 soles she received through her communal bank “Nueva Esperanza.” This loan of 500 soles will be invested in the purchase of similar materials needed for her business. Carmen has a dream of learning how to make more crafts like making costume jewelry so she can grow as a small business owner.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de cintas, hilos, broches, lentejuelas y telas para implementar su negocio.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 67 years old. She is widowed and is the mother of three children. Currently two of her children are working and her last born is schooling.

Agnes sells smoked fish and started her fish sales eight years ago at Sefwi Bekwai community market. She prepares and serves her customers with very tasty and good quality fish and, because of that, many customers buy from her stand. She has a high customer base that travel from other parts of the surrounding communities to buy her fish.

Agnes buys stocks of salt fish and other fish from the fishmongers. She requests the loan to upgrade her stock of fish. She dreams of giving her last-born a better education through the profits from her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock of smoked fish and dried fish

loans.name: Marlin Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Marlin del Socorro Hernández C. se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa usada, la cual vende en su casa y también de forma ambulante. Ella actualmente es soltera, tiene 50 años, y no tiene hijos. Ella empezó con este negocio desde hace 15 años, ya que su hermana le regalo una paca de ropa en ese tiempo para que se ayudara con sus gastos. De ese tiempo, ella decidió invertir parte de su dinero a la venta ambulante de ropa usada. Actualmente está solicitando este crédito para la compra de más mercancías de ropa. Cabe señalarse, que la señora recibe ingresos adicionales ya que trabaja medio tiempo como maestra en una escuela de primaria de Jinotepe. Su sueño siempre ha sido llegar a tener una tienda grande de ropa usada  para trabajar todo el tiempo en ese negocio.
texts.en:
Doña Marlin del Socorro Hernández C. has a business selling used clothing from her home and also door-to-door. She is 50 years old, single and does not have any children. She started her business 15 years ago when her sister gave her a bale of clothing to help her with her expenses. Since that time, she decided to invest part of her earnings to purchase more used clothing to sell door-to-door.

Today, she is requesting a loan to increase her inventory of clothing. It should be pointed out that Doña Marlin earns additional income working part-time as an elementary school teacher in Jinotepe. Her dream is to open a large clothing store so that she can work full-time in this line of business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette M. is from Prk. Pag-unlad, Brgy.Ma-ao, Bago City Neg Occidental. She is 45 years old and married with two children of school age. Raising a family with two children with only one breadwinner in the family is very difficult. This is why Bernadette has decided to help her husband and use her innate talent at sewing by making and selling customized dresses to her neighbors and community.

Currently, Bernadette is borrowing PHP 10,000 to buy additional equipment for her tailoring and dressmaking business.

About NWTF:  
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few women but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment for her tailoring and dressmaking business

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Fifty-year-old Yaa is married with six children, four of whom attend school in their local community. They are a very humble family who want to invest in their children's future by providing them with a quality education.

Yaa is a grocery shop owner and sells item like cooking oil, spices, pepper, onions, cassava, plantain, dried fish, tinned tomatoes, and bags of rice etc. Yaa says these products sell very fast and she can easily recover her money to restock. Her goods are delivered from the capital city of Kumasi.

With two years experience in her business, Yaa wants to expand her stock in response to frequent customer demands for items such as maize, smoked fish, and more. She believes that this could be possible with the help of a loan.

Yaa says she would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Estela  Marcelina

texts.es: doña Estela es originaria del cantón cojxac de 22 años de edad con residencia  en tierra colorada lugar muy hermoso por sus bosque que se tiene su principal ingreso es la elaboracion de  canastas de plasticos ella aprendio dicha actividad como operaria pero hace dos años inicio su propio negocio lo que le hace falta hoy en dia es capital ya que tiene un pedido que entregar para el mes de Noviembre, su producto lo vende en Matzatenango y Totonicapan.
texts.en:
Doña Estela is originally from Cantón Cojax. She is 22 years old and lives in Tierra Colorada which is a very beautiful place because of it´s forests. Her principal form of income is making plastic hampers. She learned this business as an operator and then two years ago began her own business. What she now lacks is financial backing as she already has an order due in the month of November. She sells her product in Matzatenango and Totonicapan.

Translated from Spanish by Tess Siemer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in Capital

loans.name: Sinoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Sinoeurn P. lives 27 years old single and she lives in Mean Neak village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn for living. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because she does not have rice seed to grow on the field. Thus, Mrs. Sinoeurn P. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy rice seed to grow on the field.

loans.name: Ann Njeri

texts.en:
Ann Njeri is 32 years old and married with two children. She owns dairy cows which help her supply milk to people in a country where dairy products are very popular.  She has been in the business for eight years.

Ann wants to use the loan to buy an extra cow in order to increase her milk supply. She was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a member.  She hopes to one day own a big dairy farm that will help her maximize her profits.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy an extra cow to increase milk supply.

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanny K. lives in Kampong Chhrey village in Takeo province. She is 26 years old and the mother of a child who is attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Chhou Nat, is a farmer who owns a plot of land he uses to cultivate rice. He is on the right in the photo.

Mrs. Vanny K. is a fruit seller in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more fresh fruit to resell to earn more income.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fruit to resell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Mrs. Evelyn A. enjoys farming. She is 34 years old and married. She plants rice and tends to her crops with care so they stay healthy, and makes sure not to let weeds grow. Seeking financial assistance, she applied to CEVI and requested a loan of PHP 11, 000 which will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs necessary for Evelyn to produce a quality harvest. She will also pay the laborers she hired to work at her farm.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and pay laborers.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria, 50 years old and married with five children, sells tubers of yam at retail prices to her customers. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers and hopes to be a yam distributor in the future. A client of LAPO, she hopes for a loan amount of 40,000 NGN to purchase more tubers of yam to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

About LAPO Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to achieving the goal of economic empowerment of clients through access to affordable financial services delivered in a cost effective and innovative manner.

loans.use: To purchase more tubers of yam to sell

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn L. is from the village of Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Merlyn owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Merlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,500 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Susan Gabriela

texts.es:
Susan es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras.
Susan es casada, tiene 25 años y 2 hijos, Susan junto a su esposo tienen un taller mecánico en un local alquilado en donde realizan trabajos de reconstrucción de piezas, accesorios para puentes.
Susan necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de fierros y planchas de metal.
Los sueños de Susan son tener un local propio y que Susan pueda tener un trabajo propio.
texts.en:
Susan is a member of the Obreras Communal Bank. Susan is married, is 25 years old, and has two children. Susan and her husband have a mechanic's workshop in a rented space where they work on the reconstruction of spare parts and accessories for bridges. Susan needs this loan of 1000 soles, which she will use for the purchase of metal pieces and metal irons. Susan's dreams are to own her space and to have a business of her own.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of metal pieces and metal irons.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen A. is a 36-year-old mother of two. She hails from the beautiful city of Morong, Rizal Province in the Philippines. Her eldest daughter, Trixie, is a 16-year-old high school student. Her youngest, Jayvee, is a 15-year-old high school student. Aileen is married to 38-year-old Gilbert, her partner in business and a carpenter.

Aileen joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and a Kiva partner in the Philippines, in 2006. Since then, she has had to acquire capital for her business. She used her first to fourth loans for the direct selling of Avon and Natasha products. It has been great for her family. The business is running smoothly and bringing in enough proceeds. Now on her fifth loan, Aileen is applying for 25,000 pesos as additional capital for her business.

She hopes that in the near future, she can build a more durable concrete house. And she also dreams of sending her children to school up to college so they can find good jobs. She is hoping to have more stock for selling for her business.

loans.use: Additional capital for direct selling of Avon and Natasha products

loans.name: Walter Jose

texts.es:
El Señor Walter José M., Labora como Ayudante de Mantenimiento en el Centro de Capacitación Profesional Nicaragüense Alemán CECNA.
 El tiene un  hijo a su cargo, y este se encuentra en edad escolar, esta soltero, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante nueve año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido nuevo créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: 5 laminas de zinc para el techo de su casa por lo que este se encuentra en mal estado.
Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Walter José M. works as Maintenance Assistant at the Nicaraguan-German Professional Training Center CECNA. He has a son under his care, who is of school age. He is single. He has collaborated with CEPRODEL for 9 years and has used his loans to improve his home; he is an excellent client. He will use the requested funds to buy the following building materials: 5 sheets of zinc metal for the roof, which is in bad condition. His objective is to provide his children with better security and improved quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For home improvements.

loans.name: Toke

texts.en:
