Toke is a hard-working woman, and she is friendly. She sells sarongs and shoes at retail prices to her customers. She hawks her goods within her community in Ibadan. She hopes to own a stall in the future. She hopes for the loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. 

To support their home, her husband sells tires. Toke has 3 children. Her eldest child is 20 years old while the youngest child is 5 years old. Her children are schooling and this makes her happy. She duly thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Aracely Del Carmen

texts.es: La joven Aracely del Carmen O. A. de 25 años en el 2008 instalo una pequeña venta con cien dólares con lo cual compro gaseosas y luego con los prestamos y ganancias ha ido surtiéndola con los productos de mayor demanda. Ella con el préstamo piensa invertir en mayor cantidad de productos y variedad para hacer más grande el negocio.
texts.en:
Aracely del Carmen O. A. is a 25 year old young woman. In 2008 she set up a small sales business. She used one hundred dollars to buy soft drinks. Then, she used loans and her earnings to stock her business with the products that are in the most demand. She plans to use the loan to invest in a greater quantity and variety of products. She will do this to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Aracely del Carmen  from  Nicaragua

loans.use: Buy basic grains and sausages

loans.name: Rizel

texts.en:
Rizel V. is a 38 year old married woman who supports her family by operating a fish vending business. She lives in Brgy Malo, Siaton, Negros Oriental with her husband and 3 children, who are adults.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of NWTF and her own efforts.  By working hard in her fish vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of Php 30,000.

Rizel is now borrowing Php 19,500 to support her fish vending business.  This will be her 7th cycle loan from NWTF.  Her previous loan of Php 27,000, which she paid off within its term, was another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  Rizel aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well being.  
----------------------------------------------
About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital.

loans.name: Arelis Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora

loans.use: To buy food items like: rice, beans, cooking oil, bread, chicken, meat, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Thanuja

texts.en:
Thanuja is a 30-year-old married woman living with her husband. She has a 2-year-old child. Her husband assists with her business and they are very close. They have a grocery shop where she is selling items to local customers and villagers for their daily consumption. She started this business three years ago.

Thanuja has requested a 20,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to purchase items for her grocery shop and expand her business. She is grateful for BRAC because of the financial support it provides to her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy grocery items and expand her grocery shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy flower pots and nets

loans.name: Lon

texts.en: Mrs. Lon L., who lives in Ta Skor village in Kandal province, was born in 1968. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice to sell in order to support her family living. However, she faces a problem, her field is far away from irrigation system and she does not have enough money to access water. So to improve production, Mrs. Lon L. is asking for a loan to buy a water machine and hose. She is widow and has one child who works as a babysitter.

loans.use: To buy a water machine and hose.

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra N. lives with her husband and children in Multan, which is famous for its tombs, saints and history.
Her husband is a cobbler and started his independent work 10 years ago. He makes shoes specifically for gents. He takes orders from different factories and shoes shops and delivers them in time to make an income. 
 
Azra herself is a very talented lady; she operates a business selling clothes. She has contacts with different boutiques. She takes orders from the neighboring areas and completes their orders by purchasing from the boutiques. She also travels outside of the city to buy clothes, specifically to Faisalabad (famous for its textiles) and Lahore (famous for its new designs & fashion). 

Azra has applied for a loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan)  to invest money in her husband’s shoe-making business. He will purchase materials such as leather, nails and polish, which he needs to make shoes. The stock in bulk will enable him to finish bigger orders on time. Azra is hopeful that this investment in her husband’s business will enable her family to make their financial life better.

loans.use: To purchase required items for shoe making business

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie C. is from the village of Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 46 years old. Rosalie is married and has 3 adult children. Rosalie owns & operates a pig raising business. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Rosalie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Rosalie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU DE SAN JERONIMO”; La  socia vive en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Margarita; ella tiene 43 años de edad y La socia es natural de San Jerónimo, ella es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos,   la socia es natural de Quincemil en la ceja de selva del territorio peruano, su conyugue es albañil y ella se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir, para damas, caballeros y niños, ella acomodó un pequeño espacio en su casa y hay trabaja fabricando todo tipo de ropa a la medida y gusto del cliente. La socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos de cocer y otros.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “Kantu de San Jerónimo” communal bank. She lives in the province and department of Cusco.

The member is Margarita. She is 43 years old and is a native to San Jerónimo. She has a live-in partner and has 4 children. She is native to Quincemil in the fringes of the jungle on Peruvian territory. Her partner is a bricklayer and she works making clothing for women, men, and children. She arranged a small space in her house and she works there making all types of clothing fit to the size and taste of the customer. She is requesting the loan to be able to purchase fabrics, sewing thread and other items.

Margarita values and is infinitely grateful for the loan provided since it allows her to grow with her business and improve her quality of life. Likewise, she promises to make her loan payments according to the stipulated time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To be able to purchase fabrics, sewing thread and other items.

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es:
Teodosia pertenece al Banco Comunal Bonanza hace 5 años y lo que mas le gusta son los prestamos fáciles.
Teodosia es viuda y tiene 7 hijos D. los cuales una ya es profesional y trabaja, Teodosia venD. leña en su casa, productos que adquiere D. los productores que le traen hasta su casa, actividad que realiza todos los días. Teodosia necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles para la compra leña.
Teodosia sueña con mejorar su negocio y que sus hijos tengan un negocio propio.
texts.en:
Teodosia has been a member of the Community Bank Bonanza for the past 5 years and she really appreciates the easy loan process. Teodosia is a widow and she has 7 children, of whom one already has a career and is working. Teodosia sells firewood from her home. She acquires her product from producers that deliver to her house. She works at this business every day. Teodosia requires a loan in the amount of 3000 soles to purchase more firewood. Teodisia dreams of improving her business and she dreams of seeing her children running their own businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase firewood.

loans.name: Meriecris

texts.en:
Meriecris T. is from the village of Bunawan Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Meriecris is married and has two school-age children.  Meriecris owns a specialized retail store selling mobile phone credit loads, can goods, noodles, eggs, candies, and shampoo in the local community. Meriecris has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 14,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Meriecris joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Meriecris has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase new equipment and tools to expand the business. Meriecris is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in further expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Meriecris from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mery

texts.es: Mery, de 30 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijo alguno. Reside en la hermosa selva tropical peruana, ubicada en la localidad de Santa Rosa, donde tiene su propia casa. Para María, llevar una carrera a consciencia es una gran inversión; desde luego que su carrera de enfermería lo está aplicando en el campo, ya que tiene su propio botica en donde expende medicinas para todo el público en general, ella recalca que siempre trata de cumplir con la calidad y los precios de sus productos medicinales, es por ello que sus clientes recurrentes confían en su persona, por lo que le genera además buenas ganancias, logrando tomar posicionamiento dentro de su localidad. Por lo general trabaja por cuenta propia y su rutina diaria es a partir de las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 9:00 de la noche y su punto de venta lo realiza en su barrio de su propia localidad. Sus planes a futuro es ampliar su botica con la finalidad de introducir productos nuevos y de primera necesidad para el hogar familiar, de esa manera pueda retener a sus clientes, además piensa actualizarse continuamente, mediante cursos de capacitación, para que así sea una enfermera competitiva. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además hace referencia al buen funcionamiento de su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la comprar productos medicinales que tengan mucha demanda, con la necesidad de que los pueda atender a sus clientes más exigentes.
texts.en:
Mery, 30, is single and has no children. She lives in the beautiful Peruvian jungle in Santa Rosa where she has her own house. For María, exercising her profession in a conscientious way is a great investment. She is applying her nursing career in the countryside for she owns a drug store where she dispenses medicine to the general public. She stresses that she always tries to provide high quality products at affordable prices. For this reason, recurring customers trust her and this leads to better profits positioning her very well in her community. She generally works by herself and is open from 7am until 9pm. Her sales point is in her own neighborhood. Her plan for the future is to expand the drug store introducing new products and basic items for home use so that she can keep her customers. She also intends to always update herself through courses and workshops so that she can be a competitive nurse. This is her 5th loan with MFP and she pledges to continue to repay in a timely fashion. She also mentions the good functioning of her communal bank. She plans to use the requested funds to buy medicines that are in high demand so that she can have them available for her most demanding customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock medicines for her drug store.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
La Señora María Magdalena M. es socia del banco comunal El Tocte, vive en la comunidad de Vegaspamba que pertenece a la parroquia de Jadan,  la mayor parte de su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, también salen a la ciudad para trabajar en diferentes áreas como en la construcción, en fábricas etc.

Doña María tiene 43 años, es casada y tiene 7 hijos de 26, 22, 21, 19, 17, 15 y 13 años de edad. Sus tres primeros hijos son casados, solo su hija casada  vive con ella y comparten gastos, sus hijos de 19 y 17 años trabajan y ayudan en la economía del hogar, sus dos últimos hijos estudian en el colegio. Su esposo es maestro albañil y el trabajo en conjunto les ha permitido construir su casa propia.

La Señora María trabaja hace 6 meses como empleada domestica 3 días a la semana sin horario fijo, los demás días se dedica a su invernadero que ya lo tiene dos años y medio en donde siembra tomates, también se dedica a la cría de cuyes, cerdos y gallinas  que son para su consumo o los vende cuando tiene laguna necesidad económica.

Es una socia que tiene una gran amistad con todas las socias. Este es el séptimo crédito que realiza y lo va  a invertir en la compra de  plantas de tomate para su invernadero.
texts.en:
María Magdalena M. is a member of the El Tocte community bank. She lives in the Vegaspamba community which belongs to the Jadan parish. The majority of its people raise animals and work in agriculture. They also leave for the city to work in different areas such as construction, in factories, etc. Maria is 43, married and has 7 children ages 26, 22, 21, 19, 17, 15 and 13. Her three oldest children are married, but her married daughter lives with her and shares costs. Her 19 and 17 year-old children work and help with the household costs. Her two youngest children are in school. Her husband is a master builder and working together has allowed them to build their own home. Maria has worked as a maid for 6 months. She works 3 days a week without a fixed schedule. On the other days she works in her greenhouse which she has had for two and a half years, where she sows tomatoes. She also raises guinea pigs, hogs and hens for consumption or sells them when she has any economic need. She is a borrower who has strong friendships with all of the other bank members. This is her seventh loan and she will invest it in the purchase of tomato plants for her greenhouse.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase tomato plants

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine Lunkuse, who is 22 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala West region of Uganda, is single and has one child who attends school. Christine has operated a tailoring business for three years. To help expand her business, she has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to purchase materials for sewing clothes. With this loan, Christine hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, she hopes to own another business.

Christine is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by aiding in the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To buy more materials for sewing clothes

loans.name: Reina Verónica

texts.es:
Reina Verónica V. C. tiene 37 anos. Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos de 21, 16, y 6 anos.  

Reina es socia de la ventanilla rural El Placer de Ser Amigos, que está ubicada a 20 minutos de la parroquia San Jose del Tambo. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de cacao o tienen sus propios pequeños negocios.  

Reina se dedica a la agricultura. Siembra cacao. Las compras de sus productos se realizan en Mata de Cacao cada 15 días. Solicita el crédito para comprar los insumos como la semilla del cacao, fertilizantes y abonos para el mantenimiento de cacao. Con el apoyo del préstamo, realizaría su sueno de tener mas cultivos de cacao. Su sueno es darles una buena educación a sus tres hijos. 

En su tiempo libre, le gusta salir de paseo con su esposo y con sus 3 hijos.
texts.en:
Reina Verónica V. C. is 37 years old. She lives with her partner in Chillanes canton of Bolivar Province. She has three children who are 21, 16 and 6 years old. 

Reina is a member of the El Placer de Ser Amigos ("The Joy of Being Friends") group loan, whose members live 20 minutes from the San Jose del Tambo parish. There are 15 members in all, most of whom are cacao farmers or have their own small businesses. 

Reina works in agriculture. She plants cacao. She buys her products in Mata de Cacao every 15 days. She is requesting this loan to buy the cacao seeds and fertilizers she needs to maintain her cacao. With this loan, she will be able to achieve her goal of growing more cacao. Her dream is to give her children a good education. 

In her free time, she likes to go on outings with her husband and three children.

loans.use: Buy agricultural inputs such as cacao seed and fertilizers

loans.name: Hana

texts.en:
Hana is a young mother and wife – she has three daughters and three sons. Hana's husband works with the Palestinian NationA. Authority. The family owns a small bookstore in the city selling books, stationary, gift items and accessories. Hana wants to improve the business by selling more variety; therefore, Hana came to FATEN for a loan to purchase stationary and books.

Hana's son, Ziyad, appears in the picture as Hana comes from a conservative background.

About Shariah-compliant lending:
 
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the culturA. context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principA. loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase books and stationary

loans.name: Burisika

texts.en:
Burisika is 52 years old and is from the Khiwesero area.  She is married to David, a businessman. They have four children who are between 22 years and 12 years old.

Burisika is a tailor and has been in this business for the past 2 years. Her monthly income comes to Kshs 6,500. She is applying for a loan from KADET LTD to enable her buy clothing materials to add to her stock. She has received quite a number of orders from her clients and wants to meet their demands. The profits made from this business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

Her desire is to be able to open up a tailoring college in the future.

loans.use: To buy clothing materials for tailor shop

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: K. Moses is an individual client from Kyenjojo. He has a butcher shop on Ntoroko Road where he sells goat meat, beef, and hides to the local residents. His cousin is an employee who helps with the business. Moses is able to make 600,000/= a month profit and he also grows and sells tea. Moses has been in the business for eight years and needs a loan to buy goats and cows to butcher. Moses is a hard-working man, 34 years old, and married with three children.

loans.use: Buy goats and cows for his butcher shop.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma A., 45 years old, is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is a farmer, and cultivates her land to plant and harvest rice crops for sale. She has been farming for more than 20 years already. She also raises pigs for fattening and sale. Erma works hard to support her family financially. She also wants to be able to save for future emergencies.

Erma joined CEVI to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 that she will use to buy farm inputs and feed for the pigs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and feed.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio tiene 45 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el sector Tranca Fanupe, uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito de Mórrope, una zona agrícola que está poblada principalmente por gente humilde y bastante trabajadora. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y esta situada a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde que era joven. El cría ganado ovino y animales menores en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Usualmente comercializa la leche que producen sus vacas entre sus vecinos. Los animales menores los comercializa entre los negociantes de la zona y el público en general una vez que hayan alcanzado su desarrollo completo. Por otro lado Antonio también se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura como peón en los campos de cultivos vecinos.

Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades le ayudan a sacar adelante a su familia, por ello Antonio siempre está buscando la manera de sacar adelante su negocio. Actualmente el desea adquirir alimento parta sus animales de modo que estos puedan desarrollarse de mejor modo y pueda brindar una mejor producción, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Antonio, 45, is married and lives together with his wife and children in Tranca Fanupe, one of the villages that belong to the district of Mórrope, an agricultural region populated mainly by humble and hard-working people. It belongs to the province of Lambayeque and is located more than an hour outside of the city of Chiclayo. 

Antonio has worked in agriculture since he was young. He breeds sheep and small animals in the back of his house. Usually, he sells the milk from his cows to neighbors. He sells the young animals to local merchants and to the general public once they have completely developed. In addition, Antonio also works as a laborer in one of the neighboring fields. 

The income earned from these activities help Antonio care for his family. He is always looking for ways to get ahead in his business. He wishes to buy food for his animals so that they can develop better and he can supply better production. For this purpose, Antonio has decided to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,500 soles (USD 500).

loans.use: Purchase animal feed for better growth and prodcution

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria F. is from the village of Kilikili, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 48 years old. Maria is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Maria owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes  from providing computer games to local community members. Maria has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Maria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed for the maintenance of the service. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Maria from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to maintain the service

loans.name: Ketty

texts.es: Ketty tiene  20 años, vive con sus padres en una casa arrendada. Desde hace 1 año se dedica a trabajar de manera independiente en la venta de cosméticos que ofrece a las personas  que conoce  dentro de su actual centro laboral  y en su mismo barrio. Los productos que ofrece son de marcas reconocidas, y siempre lleva a la mano catálogos y pequeñas muestras que son ofrecidos a sus clientes para que rápidamente puedan elegir el producto que deseen. Considera que este trabajo requiere de mucha inteligencia y persuasión para tener una venta exitosa que la  beneficie. En adelante desea mejorar sus ventas y aumentar su capital de trabajo. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más cosméticos y con una parte en el pago de un terreno que esta por adquirir.
texts.en: Ketty is 20 years old and she lives with her parents in a house that is rented. For the past year she has been selling cosmetics independently, offering them for sale to individuals that she knows in a business area in her community. The products that she sells are of well known brand names and she always has catalogues and samples at her disposal to give to clients in order to help them choose the products they want. She estimates that this type of work requires intelligence and persuasion in order to have a good volume of sales. IN the future she wants to improve her sales and to increase her working capital. This is her first loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is very happy to have this financial support. She also enjoys taking part of her communal bank because all of the other members are responsible and team oriented. She is thankful to all those individuals who will contribute to the loan she requests. It will be very helpful to the progress of her business. The loan that she requests will be invested in the purchase of cosmetics and a part will be used to pay for a plot of land she wants to buy.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Mbogo Group

texts.en:
Mohamed A., who is in his early thirties, is married with two children.  He has had a charcoal business for three years now.  He works from 2:00am to 6:00pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Mohamed's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He hopes for a loan to increase his charcoal stock. His dream is to sell charcoal at wholesale prices and to send his kids to higher education.

Mohamed will share this loan with his loan group, Mbogo, which has a total of 19 members.  The members of the group will hold each other responsible in paying back the loans.

In the picture, Mohamed is in blue, first on the right.

loans.use: To increase his charcoal stock

loans.name: Maria Georgina

texts.es:
Después de laborar por cerca de 15 años en diferentes talleres formales e informales de confección queda desempleada, sin  embargo decide aprender la labor de elaborar y comercializar productos de aseo, como suavisantes, quita grasas, límpidos para poder tener el sustento de su familia.

Actualmente el negocio ha crecido y para esto necesita implementos mas grandes que le faciliten el proceso de elaboración de cada producto, además así tiene la posibilidad de incrementar la producción y mejorar así cada vez la calidad de vida de sus hijos y nietos.
texts.en:
After having worked for nearly 15 years in different formal and informal sewing workshops María Georgina G. Gomez lost her job.  She decided to begin making and selling cleaning products, softeners, degreasers, etc. in order to provide an income for her family.

Her business has now grown and she needs larger utensils to help her in the production process so she can increase output and improve the quality of life for her children and grandchildren.

loans.use: To buy bottles and ingredients

loans.name: Santos Balbina

texts.es:
doña Santos Balbina A. tiene 32 años de edad, vive en el caseriio El Obraje y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, tiene muchos clientes ya que su negocio esta ubicado en un lugar estrategico en donde pasan muchas personas.
Santos es madre de un niño de 3 años.
Santos esta casada y junto con su esposo trabajan duro para salir adelante, su esposo trabaja en el rubro de la agricultura.
Santos tambien se dedica a la crianza de gallinas y cerdos.
su meta es hacer crecer su negocio y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia al por mayor para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Santos Balbina A. is 32 years old and she lives in the community of El Obraje. She sells every day goods from a store installed in her house. She has many clients because her business is located in a strategic location where there are many passers-by. 

Santos is the mother of a 3-year old boy. 

She is married and together with her husband they work hard to get ahead. Her husband works in the field of agriculture.

Santos also raises poultry and pigs.

Her goal is to make her business grow and to provide her son with a better quality of life. 

The loan will be used to purchase merchandise in wholesale to supply her business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to supply her general store

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius I. C. is 51 years old and has four children.  He has been raising pigs for 10 years.  He works hard in his business so as to educate his children.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has improved his business and he is now able to provide for his family.  He hopes to be financially stable in the future.  He is requesting a loan for 80,000 KES to buy cement for constructing his house.

loans.use: To purchase cement

loans.name: Aidah

texts.en: Aidah is 42 years old, married and a mother of 6 children living in Hioma, Uganda. She has no other dependents and she is the soul breadwinner for her family. For 3 years she has been running a produce business, which she started with her savings. She faces challenges of competition and scarcity of food supplies. Her dream is to own a food store. Aidah needs a loan to buy maize flour to sell.

loans.use: to purchase maize

loans.name: Sevela

texts.en: Sevela is currently in the business of selling bread and tea. She is 35 years old and married. She has eight children, and all of them go to school. Sevela borrowed a loan to stock more bread and tea to sell. With the extra profit from business, she hopes to pay for her children in school and build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to stock more bread and tea to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a big shop and organize a good general store

loans.name: Carmen Luz

texts.es:
Carmen nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y tiene 40 años edad.  (Paucartambo se encuentra a 2 horas de la ciudad del Cusco). Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad de Calca, está casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos. (La ciudad de Calca caracteriza por tener hermosos paisajes por ser una zona turística, ganadera y agrícola). Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Clorinda Matto de Turner” de la Asociación Arariwa.    

En la reunión del banco comunal conocimos a la Señora Carmen que se dedica a la venta de comestibles y tiene un puesto de venta alquilado en el mercado modelo de la ciudad Calca. Ella paga una alquiler de aproximadamente de 80 nuevos soles para trabajar desde las 5h30 hasta las 18h00 todos los días de la semana. Ya son 7 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que realiza en su trabajo. Ella en esta oportunidad accede al crédito para comprar mercadería así poder surtir y abastecer el puesto de venta. Con este préstamo de USD. 500 dólares aumentara el capital del negocio, comprará sacos de arroz y azucar.
 
Carmen es una mujer luchadora y su sueño es hacer crecer su negocio. Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Asociación Arariwa por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de poder hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Carmen was born in the city of Paucartambo and she is 40 years old. Paucartambo is 2 hours from the city of Cuzco. At present, she lives in the city of Calca. She is married and has two children. The city of Calca is characterized by having beautiful landscapes and for being a tourist attraction with cattle and farming. She belongs to the “Clorinda Matto de Turner” community bank of the Asociación Arariwa.    

We met Carmen at the community bank meeting. She sells food and has a rented locale in the market of the city of Calca. She pays approximately 80 nuevos soles in rent to work from 5:30 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. every day of the week. She has been doing this business for 7 years and it is going very well for her thanks to her hard work.  She is taking out the loan at this time to buy merchandise to be able to supply her sales location. With this loan of USD. 500, she will increase her working capital, buying sacks of rice and sugar.  
 
Carmen is a fighting woman and her dream is to grow her business. She is very grateful to the Movimiento Asociación Arariwa for helping women such as her to have opportunuties to be able to make their dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and sugar.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Married with five children between 5 and 15 years of age, Vivian has been a dairy farmer in the town of Litein, South Rift Kenya for 15 years. She sells her milk locally.

Vivian has requested a loan of 70,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She believes her production will significantly improve with the new acquisition. Although dairy farming is relatively expensive due to the cost of animal feeds, Vivian is optimistic about the future and plans to construct a modern dairy unit.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase and insurance of a dairy cow.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 39-year-old married woman with three children ranging in age from 16 to 4 years old. She and her husband are both farmers who own the land upon which they grow rice. Josephine also raises pigs in their backyard.

To help fund their farm and piggery, she is requesting a loan to purchase six sacks of fertilizers, one sack of pig feed, and other farm inputs. Josephine works hard to support her family and strives for them to be happy and healthy always.

loans.use: to purchase six sacks of fertilizers, one sack of pig feeds, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Benkadi  4 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi  4  est constitué de femmes mariées du village de DIGAN dans la sous préfecture de OUELESSEBOUGOU, région de KOULIKORO (deuxième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles, ont en moyenne 40  ans,  6 enfants et  cultivent de l’arachide gombo.   
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont à leur  cinquième  prêt  de campagne.
FARIMA, la troisième debout à gauche,  compte utiliser son  prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semences d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles,  au grand marché de OUELESSEBOUGOU. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de OUELESSEBOUGOU, BAMAKO et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail,  souvent en gros, au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 20.000 à 35.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Benkadi 4 group is composed of married women from the village of Digan, in the Subprefecture of Ouelessebougou, Koulikoro Region (the second administrative region of Mali). They live in traditional families and average 40 years of age with six children. They grow peanuts [ground nuts] and “gombo” [okra]. 

In order to make their agricultural work profitable, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program and are now on their fifth harvest-cycle loan. 

Farima, the third one from the left standing photo, plans to use her loan to buy peanut seeds, small tools and agricultural inputs [such as fertilizers and pesticides] at the big market of Ouelessebougou. After the winter season, the harvested produce is stocked for a while until it gains enough value to be sold at the big market of Ouelessebougou, in Bamakao and at other nearby markets, retail, for cash and often wholesale, to customers mainly coming from large towns.

After selling their produce, the group members plan to earn a profit between 20,000 and 35,000 West African Francs each, which will be used to repay loan interest and cover ongoing family expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and small tools

loans.name: Zakariah

texts.en: Zakariah is a 41-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and three children. Two of the children are still attending school. He is an experienced furniture painter; He has been involved in this type of business for the past 23 years. Zakariah is a very talented man. He knows how to end up with original mixed colors. He is the main income provider of his family. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional wood for his work. He estimates that the loan will help him increase his profits by 15%.

loans.use: to purchase wood

loans.name: Santos Manuel

texts.es:
Santos tiene 48 años de edad es casado y padre de familia de conco hijos pero los cuales dependen actualmente de el, trabaja como conductor de transporte pesado en la ciudad de  managua.
 el visita nuevamnete las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un nuevo prestamo para el seqguir realizando las mejoras de su casa de habitacion, todo esto para brindarles mejores condiciones de vida a toda a su familia.
va acomprar materiales de construccion para terminar las mejoras en su casa.
texts.en:
Santos, 48, is married and the father of five children who depend on him.  He works as a heavy transport driver in the city of Managua.

He once again visits Ceprodel’s offices to request a new loan to continue doing home improvements to provide his entire family with better living conditions.  He will buy building materials to finish the home improvements.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Margy

texts.en:
Margy is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Margy has a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for her shop.

Margy is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Margy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Los Girasoles Group

texts.es: La Sra. Roció  es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar, Roció tiene 33 años D. edad  actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Los Girasoles” grupo  conformado por 10  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades D. comercio. Roció   trabaja desD. hace 8  años en la venta D. comida es D. decir venD. menú (almuerzo y desayuno) en su domicilio  este negocio surge  por que sus hijos empezaron a ir al colegio y el sueldo D. su esposo no alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos básicos alimentación, educación y pagos D. servicio. Es así que trabajo muy duro para sacar  adelante a su familia, empezó vendiendo desayuno y con el tiempo tuvo mayor clientes  y después empezó a vender almuerzo Roció nos cuenta que su motivación eran sus hijos, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos, sus hijos pudieron estudiar, poco apoco fue comprando cosas para su hogar y sobre todo su familia cuenta con una mejor calidad D. vida,  con el fin D. seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercadería(Arroz, Fideos) .Sabemos que Roció  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos D. Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Rocío is 33, is in a common-law relationship, and has two school-age children. Currently, she is a member of the "Los Girasoles" (Sunflowers) communal bank, which is maD. up of 10 members, who work in various retail businesses. 

Rocío has sold food for 8 years; that is to say meals (breakfasts and lunches), that she serves in her home.  She started the business because her children were starting high school, and her husband's salary wasn't enough to cover basic expenses, such as food, schooling, and service payments. This is how she worked very hard to help her family get ahead in life. 

She began selling breakfast and in time had more customers, and began to offer lunches. Rocío tells us that what motivated her were her children. Thanks to her efforts and dedication she has managed to increase her income, and her children were able to go to school.  Gradually, she began to buy things for the home, and above all, her family now has a better quality of life.  

With the aim of continuing to grow, she has applied for a new loan to buy ingredients (rice, noodles). We know that Rocío will achieve her goals, with a lot of work and effort, and that the loans from EDAPROSPO will help her.

loans.use: To buy rice and noodles for cooked meals.

loans.name: Danitza

texts.es: Danitza tiene 25 años, es una mujer muy alegre y emprendedora, convive con su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos de 7 y 5 años. Juntos viven en su casa que es propia. Su mayor anhleo es darles una buena educación a sus hijos y una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Danitza consiste en la venta de golosinas, es así que se va muy temprano a un instituto superior de su localidad en donde tiene un pequeño puesto de golosinas, ahí los alumnos y docentes son sus clientes fieles. Tiene un año trabajando en esto y lo hace sola. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede estar en actividad todo el tiempo, ya que los alumnos no le dejan de comprar en ningún momento, además de su trato es muy bueno con ellos y eso le da más ventaja. Espera en adelante poner una tienda en su casa y continuar vendiendo golosinas entre productos de primera necesidad. Este será el segundo préstamo que tiene y espera contar nuevamente con su ayuda para continaur trabajando. Con el monto solicitado, comprará golosinas y algunos otros productos para seguir con su venta e intentar agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Danitza, age 25, is a cheerful and hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her partner and their two children, ages 7 and 5. Her greatest wish is to provide her children with a good education and a better quality of life. Danitza’s work involves selling candy. She leaves very early for a college in her town where she has a small candy stand. Her loyal customers consist of students and teachers. Danitza has been working by herself in this manner for one year. What she enjoys about her work is that it is an activity that happens all the time. There is never an occasion when students stop buying candy. In addition, she treats her customers very well, which gives her more of an advantage. She hopes that in the future she can open a store in her home and continue selling candy as well as basic necessity products.

This will be her second loan. Danitza hopes that she will have renewed support so that she can continue working. The amount she requested will be used to buy candy and other products so that she can continue selling and expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy candy and other products to sell.

loans.name: Selita

texts.en:
Selita is 33 years old and has a hog-fattening business. She's in this business to save for the future of her three children and to provide for their needs.

This causes her to asks a loan amount of PHP 6,000 to buy two more hogs and feed. 

She felt so happy to know about Alalay sa Kaunlaran (ASKI) Inc. because this organization let her borrow for the improvement of her business as well as their poor living. She hopes to uplift her family from poverty through her hard work and courage to confront financial problems.

loans.use: to buy two more hogs and feed.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos de 35 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa de sus padres, la cual no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Morropón que pertenece al departamento de Piura.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.

Carlos desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (ovejas, cabras y cerdos), sus corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento ideal para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos personales.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles  para la compra de más animales y su respectivo alimento, con las ganancias que obtenga con la venta de sus animales podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Carlos es una persona que con esfuerzo, trabajo y empeño a sabido sacar a su familia adelante a pesar de las dificultades que se presentan en la vida.
texts.en:
Carlos is 35, single, and lives in his parents' house, which has basic services. It is located in the rural area of Morropón district, which belongs to Piura department. People in this area make their living from farming and livestock-raising. 

For several years, Carlos has been raising and selling farmyard animals (sheep, goats, and pigs). His pens are located behind his house, and are large and suitable for this purpose. He provides them with balanced animal feed and natural grazing, so that his animals attain their maximum growth. This is so he can sell them in the different markets in the area, and obtain good earnings to cover his personal expenses.  

He has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles to buy more animals and their respective feed.  With earnings that he gets by selling his animals, he will be able to pay back his loan and have a better quality of life. 

Carlos is a person who with effort, hard work and determination has managed to help his family get ahead, in spite of the difficulties that have arisen in his life.

loans.use: To buy more farmyard animals, and their respective feed.

loans.name: Jesse

texts.en:
Jesse, age 30, describes himself as honest and visionary. He operates a bakery where he sells cakes, doughnuts, and other baked goods to the local people. He has been involved in this business for five years and employs two staff members. His business is located in a shopping center. He describes his biggest business challenge to be financial constraints. 

Jesse and his wife have a three-and-a-half-year-old child.

Jesse intends to use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy flour and cooking oil. His goal is to grow his business into a larger bakery within five years. He is hopeful that he will eventually be able to provide a good education for his children. He also aspires toward buying a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy flour and cooking oil for his bakery business

loans.name: Aligismat

texts.en: Aligismat is a teacher of physical education and his wife is a retired teacher of the Russian language. He is 54 years old, and lives with his wife and grandson. Aligismat's business is raising sheep. He sells them at the bazaar. He’s asking for 1,500 Azerbaijani manats to invest in farming. He will buy feed and hay. The loan will be very useful for his business.

loans.use: to maintain the business.

loans.name: Mairamkul's Group

texts.en:
Mairamkul is the leader of this borrower group. She is 36 and married to a driver, and together they are raising two sons and two daughters. Except for their youngest daughter, all of their children study at school.

In order to make a living, Mairamkul sells detergent, beverages, socks and many other home products. She started this business five years ago with an initial investment of 8,000 soms. Her monthly profit from this trade is 8,000 soms, and it has made it possible for her to increase the turnover of goods in her business and to build a shed at home where she keeps livestock.

Mairamkul plans to use the proceeds from this loan to buy detergent, sugar, oil and tobacco for trade. In the future, she hopes to use profits realized from her business to purchase furniture to improve her family's living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase detergent, sugar, oil and tobacco

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.es:
La Sra. Gulnara pertenece al Banco Comunal “Alisson II”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Tiene 51 años, está casada y tiene 02 hijos que ya son independientes.
Con la finalidad de apoyar con los gastos económicos de su hogar decidió emprender su negocio de venta de frutas, pero al ingresar al banquito comunal vió  la oportunidad de darle un giro a su negocio, compró al  crédito un mototaxi que puso en alquiler y de esa manera recibía diariamente su pago, con el tiempo ahorró y solicitó otro préstamo en su banquito, es así como adquirió otra unidad más. Con el alquiler de sus unidades pudo ahorrar para comprarse un terreno, donde podrá hacer realidad el sueño de la casa propia.
Con este préstamo de S/. 3000.00,  pagará las últimas letras del segundo mototaxi y accesorios para el mantenimiento de las unidades.
Gulnara es una mujer luchadora,  uno de sus sueños es construir su casa en el terreno que compró gracias a las ganancias de su negocio, para poder acondicionar un ambiente donde pueda  implementar una tienda surtida.  Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por apoyarla y crecer junto a ella.
texts.en:
Gulnara is a member of the Alisson II communal bank, located in the Tarapoto district, within the San Martín department and province.  She is 51 years old, married, and has two adult children on their own.  In order to help with the household expenses, she decided to start her own business selling fruit, but upon joining the communal bank she saw the opportunity to give her new business a go and bought a moto-taxi with a loan.  She leased it out and in this way she received a daily payment.  After some time she saved some money and requested another loan.  This enabled her to buy another unit.  Renting out her units gave her the opportunity to buy some land, where she could make her dream of having her own house become a reality.


She will use the money from this loan of 3,000 PEN ($1,1125) to pay off the second moto-taxi and provide maintenance on both units.


Gulnara is a hard working woman.  One of her dreams is to build a home on the land that she bought, thanks to the earnings from her business.  She also wants to open a small, well-stocked, store [in her new home].  She is very grateful to “Movimiento Manuela Ramos” for their support and for growing with her.

loans.use: to pay off her moto-taxi

loans.name: Rahmatsho

texts.ru: Рахматшо проживает в районе Данагара. Ему 31 год. Он женат. Более пяти лет Рахматшо печет и продает самбусу. Кредит берет для аренды нового помещения и приобретния продуктов.
texts.en: Rahmatsho lives in the Dangara district.  He is 31 years old and married.  Rahmatsho has been baking and selling samosas for over five years.  He is requesting this loan to lease a new space and purchase products.

loans.use: to lease a new space and purchase products

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 41 years old.  She is married and has 3 children, aged 20, 19 and 18.  In 2000, she established her vegetable farming business.  Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her business.  In the future, Rita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Pardakhon

texts.ru: Пардахон жительница города Вахдат. Ей 59 лет. Она замужем. У нее шестеро детей. В ее семье только она работает. Она занимается торговлей. Пардахон арендует торговую точку на рынке, где продает овощи и рис. Этим видом бизнеса она занимается три года. Кредит берет для покупки картошки, лука, моркови и разных сортов риса.
texts.en: Pardakhon is a resident of the city of Vahdat.  She is 59 years old, married and has six children.  She is the only one in her family working.  Pardakhon is involved in sales.  She leases a retail outlet at a market, where she sells vegetables and rice.  She has been in this business for three years.  Pardakhon is requesting this loan to purchase potatoes, onions, carrots and various types of rice.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, onions, carrots and various types of rice

loans.name: Rosario Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Rosario es cliente de la institución desde el 2011 ella trabajaba antes en la agencia Pampahasi es una cliente puntual ella vive en zona de Pampahasi en  alquiler ella vive con su hijo el cual le ayuda con los gastos de la casa la Sra.  Rosario se  dedica a la confección de ropa hace ya varios años, confecciona ropa de dormir para niños y poleras, pijamas  los cuales los realiza a pedido y también entrega en los distintos mercados de la ciudad, el dinero del crédito será para la compra de telas e hilos y material que necesita para la confección de ropa ya que tiene pedidos para fin de año que entregar, la Sr. Rosario es una persona muy amable y trabajadora, se siente feliz con el apoyo brindado por la institución.
texts.en: Rosario has been a client of EMPRENDER since 2011; she worked before with the Pampahasi office.  She is a punctual client who lives in the Pampahasi area.  She lives in a rented home with her son, who helps her with the household expenses.  Rosario has had a business making clothing for a number of years.  She makes sleepwear for children, T-shirts, and pajamas to order, and she also delivers her products to various markets in the city.  The money from this loan will be used to buy fabric, thread and supplies that she needs to make the clothing, since she has orders from the end of the year that she needs to fulfill.  Rosario is a very friendly and hardworking person.  She feels happy with the support provided by this institution.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread

loans.name: Ansu

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Ansu.  He is married and has two children aged 2 and 7 years. In 2002, Ansu established his shoes and sneakers business. He began his business because he wanted to be self-sustainable. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about 1,200,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 4,500,000 SLL.

 Ansu has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to increase the stock and improve the stall. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. In the future, Ansu plans to move from a stall to a kiosk; the loan will help to increase the stock and raise the profit. 

When it rains, the business is disturbed and therefore he needs a loan to make a more secure structure (kiosk) for his business.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for shoes

loans.name: Dative

texts.en:
Dative is 26 years old. He is married with 2 children aged 1 and 4 years, Not yet go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 3 years.  Also his wife is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to improve his welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn is 38 years old, married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Genalyn has a frozen food business in the Philippines. Genalyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more frozen food to sell.

Genalyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, Genalyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more frozen food to sell.

loans.name: Mammadali

texts.en:
Mammadali sells the electric equipments.
This 26-year-old single man is from Salyan region Yenikand village. He is a hard worker. He has  his own shop. He has had his business for 6 years ago and it allows his to support to his family.  He applies for the loan amount of $600 to buy  the electric equipments and to expand the area of his shop.

loans.use: To expand the area of his business

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy W. is married, has three children and also lives with her younger brother. She decided to live with him to enable him search for a job since this is not easy in the rural areas. She is 36 years of age and lives in Kayole, an informal settlement area of Nairobi. Lucy and her husband are living positively with HIV. Her husband is a soldier while she sells second-hand shoes at Gikomba market. This is an open-air second-hand clothes and accessories market.

In the year 2000, Lucy was given Ksh 10,000.00 (USD140) by her husband to enable her start the second-hand shoe business. She used the money to buy a bale of second-hand shoes and also to apply for a location to do her business, and was given a card that permits her to trade in that particular location. She previously used to sell with a friend for a period of one year and according to Lucy, this was a good exposure for her to master the skills required in the trade.

Lucy buys one bale of second-hand shoes and this can last her one week before she can buy another one, though sometimes the stock does not last as long and so she is left with nothing to sell. Unlike her friends who buy two or three bales that can keep their businesses in operation before another container of bales is dispatched, her business is affected and records minimal sales. By buying two bales, Lucy will not run out of stock for at least for two weeks before she can be sure to buy another bale, hence striving to maintain her customers. The increased stock will also enable her to supplement the household needs. Lucy is therefore requesting a loan of USD150 to enable her purchase stock for her business, which she intends to pay back within 6 – 12 months.

loans.use: To purchase stock for second-hand shoes

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin is an active member of PEMCI. He has finished his first loan successfully. The first loan enabled him to purchase equipment for his video shop. He started his business two years ago. He is not married and he has not had any formal training.  With the proposed second loan from PEMCI Martin wishes to open another video shop. Through his business, Martin has been able to pay school fees for his siblings and attend to his personal needs. He has brought entertainment services and the world closer to his community through his video shows.

loans.use: To Buy Equipment for a Video Shop

loans.name: Zulma

texts.en:
Mrs. Zulma C. C. is 37 and lives with Mr. Celso Lopez.  They have 3 sons, 14, 12, and 4.  The first two are in the 9th and 7th grade, respectively, at the Escuela Niños Trabajadores in Caaguazú.

Mrs. Zulam works as a street vendor in Caaguazú.  She started off with very little – a mere $40 – and currently works with a capital of $400, which shows her dedication and determination to move up.  She wakes up every morning at around 5:00 to stock her merchandise. She sells her wares until 8.30 in the evening, at which time she comes back home to take care of her children.
Her husband, Celso, works in a bakery and contributes to the family's income.  It is his dream to open his own bakery some day and manage it as he sees it fit.  It is worth noting that he has been in this business since he was a boy of 12.  

Zulma is requesting the current loan to buy more goods to sell. She intends to buy undergarments and sewing notions to increase her sales.  Her loyal clientele is requesting more variety, and she is determined to meet the demand.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as undergarments, sewing thread, needles, towels, shorts, and cups.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia has 3 small children and is married. Her husband is a photographer. She opened up a printing business in order to help her family get ahead, but it did not go well, so they changed the business to photography services, which is what her husband knows how to do. She's been running the business for 5 years now, servicing mainly their friends and neighbors. Right now they are more established and better known in the community. She would like to grow the business in order to meet the growing requests of her clients.

Lucia is requesting a loan of $475 US, which she plans to repay in 6 months. She plans on using the loan to purchase materials for her business. She is grateful for the help which is given to her in order to grow her business and in turn improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer

Lucia tiene tres hijos pequeños y esta casada, su esposo es fotógrafo, ella inició su negocio por que necesitaba obtener recursos para poder vivir con su familia y comenzó teniendo una imprenta pero les fue mal por ello cambió de giro de negocio a lo que es la fotografía, que es lo que su esposo sabe hacer, esto fue ya hace 5 años atrás tomándole inicialmente a sus familiares, vecinos y amigos, y ahora ya es más conocida y ya tiene varios clientes a quienes atender y desea continuar con el crecimiento de su negocio.

Lucia esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 475 que ofrece pagar en 6 meses, ella invertirá este dinero en la compra de materia prima para su negocio, y les agradece mucho el apoyo que le dan para continuar con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: To purchase materials for their photography business

loans.name: Norma Luz

texts.es:
Mrs. Norma Ramirez is 30 years old and is a hard working mother, we can find her working tirelessly in her father's restaurant, where she shows a great talent for cooking and where her plates are always a delight to her customers. She works very hard because of her great love for her two small children, who are a source of motivation and drive. One year ago, her husband passed away in a terrible accident, an event which pained her deeply. Nevertheless, she has never allowed her optimism to fail her and continues working with the goal of creating a better life for her family. Today, she desires to invest in the restaurant in order to save money, with the end goal of opening her own point of sales from her modest home. This will help her to support her children and to be able to have more time with them. We make this request (for a loan) in order to offer her children a better standard of living and education.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

La señora Norma R. de 30 años de edad, es una laboriosa madre de familia, a la que encontramos trabajando incansablemente en el restaurante de su papá, donde muestra su gran habilidad para la cocina, siendo sus platos un deleite para sus clientes. Ella se esfuerza mucho por el gran amor que posee por sus dos pequeños hijos, quienes son su fuente de motivación y de ánimo. Pues hace un año su esposo falleció en un terrible accidente que le causó un gran dolor; sin embargo no ha hecho decaer su optimismo y sigue esforzándose con el objetivo de ver mejor a su familia. Ahora desea implementar el restaurante para ahorrar un poco de dinero con el propósito de aperturar pronto su propio local de ventas en su modesta casa, con el fin de seguir apoyando a sus menores hijos y así estar mayor tiempo con ellos. Posibilitemos esta petición para que pueda brindarle a sus pequeños un mejor nivel de vida y educación.

loans.use: Investing in a small restaurant.

loans.name: Martina Heredia

texts.en:
Martina is thirty-eight years old, and she and her partner have four children who go to the university. Martina is a very active businesswoman who struggles to provide a comfortable lifestyle with her children. She says that since childhood, she has learned the price of persistence. Her parents used to force her to work to make a living.

Now, Martina runs a beauty salon that she started ten years ago. She offers services of hair dying, hair treatment, hairdos and so forth. She has a well-established clientele. She has a local salon where she operates the business. Martina plans on enlarging her salon and adding new services so that she can attract new clients.

With her loan, she will purchase goods that are running low in the salon, such as a hairdryer, rinse and shampoo. Martina says that goods are the raw materials with which she runs the business. The entrepreneur hopes her business can grow and she can make more profits in order to keep working for the sake of her family.

loans.use: Martina will use her loan to buy beauty products to keep operating her salon.

loans.name: Trinh Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Trinh Thi V., 44 years old, is living in Quang Xuong, Thanh Hoa with her husband and her 5 children. Her family’s main activities are fishing and selling fishes. The two oldest sons together with their father go fishing on the ocean, and Mrs. V. sells fish in the market. During previous years, her family life was difficult because she had to send the children to school and borrowing money was not as easy. Since the TYM Fund comes to her region and it has a proper repaying method, Mrs.V. enthusiastically joins it. The money borrowed is used effectively, and as a result, her family income increases. Her current family income is 180 USD/month. This time, she wants to borrow 375 USD to buy more tools for fishing.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Trình Thị Viết, 44 tuổi, sống tại Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa cùng chồng và 5 người con. Công việc chủ yếu của gia đình là đánh và bán cá. 2 người con trai lớn theo bố ra biển đánh cá, chị bán cá ngoài chợ. Những năm trước hoàn cảnh gia đình rất vất vả, do phải nuôi 5 người con đang tuổi ăn tuổi lớn, nguồn vốn vay lại khó khăn. Từ khi có Quỹ Tình thương về hoạt động tại địa bàn huyện nhà với cơ chế vay trả phù hợp nên chị Viết tham gia tích cực. Đồng vốn được sử dụng có hiệu quả, kinh tế gia đình được nâng lên rõ rệt. Thu nhập hiện tại của cả gia đình chị Viết là 180USD. Vòng vốn này chị quyết định vay 375USD để sắm thêm đồ nghề, phục vụ việc đánh bắt.

loans.use: Buy fishing-net

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en: Together with her husband, Genoveva M. breeds 15 cows in her own farm around the village of Medkovetz near Vratza. The couple also have land that they lend to other agricultural producers in the region. Now they need to buy two more cows and so they have applied for a loan.

loans.use: To buy 2 more cows

loans.name: Kagali East A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Betty N.. She is currently in the business of selling fish and is requesting a loan to purchase in larger quantities. Betty is 40 years old and is married. She has 4 children ranging from age 11 to 20 and her children go to school. Each week, Betty makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a house for her children. Betty has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 50000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Betty is joined in her small group by Jesca N., Prossy K., Rose A., and Yurita M.. Jesca N. has a business running a retail shop and wants to purchase another fridge and add more stock. Prossy K. is currently operating a business selling tomatoes and wants a loan to boost business. Rose A. operates a business selling fish and wants to expand business. Yurita M. is currently in the business of selling fish and is requesting a loan to add more capital.

loans.use: To add working capital to fish selling business

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Ever since moving to her current home and since her only child started school, Modesta has felt it was time to find an activity to fill her spare time. It was important that she found something which meant she was rarely far away from her house, so that she could look after her home and child in the afternoons. With the aim of improving her economic situation, Modesta decided to open a small shop. Today, four years down the line, it is a grocery store. She is proud to see how her business has grown, since when she started she had nothing. In time, she wants to extend her premises and offer more products.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Desde que se mudo a su actual vivienda y desde que su único hijo, en ese entonces de cinco años, ingreso al colegio, Modesta creyó necesario ocuparse en una actividad en sus tiempos libres. Una actividad que no la alejara tampoco de su casa pues aun tenía que ocuparse de su hogar y de su hijo por las tardes. Con la idea de progresar y mejorar su situación económica, Modesta se animo a brir una pequeña tienda. Hoy en día ya lleva cuatro años en su bodega. Ella cuenta sentirse orgullosa al ver cómo ha crecido su negocio, ya que cuando empezó no tenía casi nada. En un tiempo, ella quisiera ampliar su local e implementarlo con otro rubro de productos.

loans.use: She wishes to offer beauty products in her store

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a grandmother (babushka) and great-grandmother from Ivano-Frankivsk in western Ukraine. She has three children, eight grandchildren and one great-grandchild. A widow, Anna helps to support herself with a small market business selling meats and sausages. She currently has two sales locations, one in a bulk sale market and one at a regular retail market. Anna has been in this type of business for 16 years. Loans received through Nadiya Ukraine have helped her establish a successful, profitable business.

Anna has requested a loan of 5000 Ukrainian Grivnas ($US1050) to help purchase a new supply of meat and sausages called “kalbasa”. This loan will allow her to purchase 150 kilograms of meat so she can increase her inventory and continue earning a good income.

loans.use: Purchase more meat for her market sales.

loans.name: Zaynura

texts.en:
U. Zaynura is 54 years old. She is a widow and has three adult children. Zaynura is an economist. She works as an operator of the subscriber department in Tojiiktelelecom for more than 15 years. After the death of her husband it was difficult for her to raise and to educate her children alone. Thus, she decided to run the business. 

With the help of IMON she purchased a small store where she sold video cassettes. Now with the help of her son, she provides computer services and also sells DVD disks and MP3 disks. Today Zaynura requests 1700 Somoni (500 $ US Dollars) with the purpose of purchasing new DVD disks to increase the variety of goods. Also, with part of the loan, she plans to spend for a new printer. She promises to repay the loan within 10 months. Your support will really help her. Be an important part of the growth of Zaynura’s business.

loans.use: Purchasing a new printer and DVD disks for increasing the variety of goods.

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.en:
T. Mehriniso is 46 years old, married, and has four children. Both of her daughters are married and financially independent, while her sons still live with the family. Mehriniso’s husband works as an entrepreneur.

Mehriniso has been running a drug store for the past 12 years. She sells certified medicines in the center of town, which allows her to access a wide range of clients and customers.

Mehriniso would like to request a loan of $450 in order to increase her business. Her son is about to marry, and she needs the extra income to ensure that the marriage and new family succeeds. Mehriniso is a driven and organized individual, and is sure that she will be able to repay the loan in 4 months.

loans.use: Purchasing medicaments for expanding the business

loans.name: Gezira 2015-7 Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Elizerbeth P.. She is currently in the business of selling clothes at the market and is requesting a loan to expand the business. She is 35 years old and her husband is a businessman. She has two children, age two and six, who are both in school. Each week, Elizerbeth makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profit. With the extra capital from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

Elizerbeth is joined in her small group by Monika L., Rose P., Teresa W., and Jackline N.. Monika has a business selling clothes at the market and wants to open a shop. Rose is currently operating a business selling bread and wants a loan to expand her business. Teresa operates a business selling booklets at her book shop and wants to expand the shop. Jackline is currently in the business of selling charcoal brew and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Dinh Thi

texts.vi: Chị Đinh Thị Nhương năm nay 58 tuổi. Hai vợ chồng chị đều là cán bộ hưu trí với thu nhập từ lương hưu 3.500.000đ/ tháng. Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương gia đình chị đã có một cửa hàng sửa chữa ô tô tại nhà. Chồng chị vốn là sỹ quan quân đội và là thợ sữa chữa xe ô tô lành nghề vì thế sau khi nghỉ hưu gia đình chị đã vay thêm vốn để đầu tư cho chồng chị  mở rộng quy mô xưởng sửa chữa. Hiện nay để phục vụ nhu cầu khách hàng  ngày càng đông nên gia đình chị đã thuê thêm một thợ phụ. Ngoài thu nhập từ lương hưu, sửa chữa xe ô tô gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu từ chăn nuôi lợn, gà. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm máy móc phục vụ cho việc sửa chữa ô tô.
texts.en:
