Ms. Dinh Thi N. is 58 years of age. She and her husband had retired from civil services with a retirement check of 3.500.000d/month. Before becoming a part of this organization, her family ran a small auto repair shop out of their home. Her husband was a soldier in the military, when he wasn’t working he used his time to repair automobiles as a side job at the family’s business. After he had retired, the family had borrowed extra loans to invest in expanding his auto repair shop. To meet the demands of the growing number of customers he presently have, they had to hire an additional worker to help. Beside the retirement income, the family is able to bring in additional revenues from the shop and from raising pigs and chickens. This next loan, she is hoping to borrow 20.000.000d to invest into buying machinery for the auto repair shop.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: By machines

loans.name: Panah

texts.en:
Panah H.  is 47 years old. He is married and he has three daughters of school-age for whom he works very hard. Panah wants his children to be well-educated and he wishes to send them to better schools. His wife is a homemaker. Panah raises onions and then sells them in the local bazaar. Because he sells onions from his garden, his onion wholesale prices are lower than the regular market prices. He has gained rich experience by working in this kind of business for 9 years. 

He is going to use this loan to diversify the types of vegetables that he sells. He will also purchase potatos, seasonal fruits and vegetables. Panah expresses his gratitude to everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To diversify the vegetables he sells

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.es: Jennifer tiene 21 años, es natural de la ciudad de Juliaca donde vive con su familia, es madre soltera de un hijo de un mes de nacido, llamado Rodrigo. Jennifer trabaja vendiendo productos naturistas desde hace ya 11 meses, tiempo en el cual le ha generado buenos ingresos económicos.  Es por eso que se dedica a su negocio casi todo el día, no teniendo un horario fijo, ya que ella trabaja por pedidos. Le gusta su trabajo porque tiene bastante libertad sobre las horas en las cuales realizarlo. Jennifer trabaja muy duro para satisfacer las necesidades de su pequeño bebe. Con el dinero del préstamo adquirirá más de sus productos, para venderlos y poder crecer en su negocio, en el futuro a ella le gustaría tener un negocio más estable, como una tienda o una boutique.
texts.en:
Jennifer is 21 years old and is a native of the city of Juliaca where she lives with her family. She is a single mother with a month-old son, named Rodrigo. Jennifer has worked selling natural products for the past 11 months, during which time she has generated good economic returns. It is for this reason she works almost all day long, without a fixed schedule, since she works for orders. She likes her job because she has a lot of freedom with the hours in which she works. Jennifer is working very hard to meet the needs of her young baby. With the money from the loan, she will acquire more products and sell them in order to be able to grow her business. In the future, she would like to have a more stable business, such as a shop or boutique.

Translated from Spanish by Larissa Kravanja, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase the greatest amount of natural products she can sell

loans.name: Oun

texts.en: Mrs. Oun C. is 39 years old. She is a farmer and also raises pigs. She started this work in her village over 7 years ago. She lives in Pursat Province and takes care of four children, all of whom are in school. Her husband, Mr. Kheav Chinda, 39, is a local farmer. Oun hopes to acquire more piglets to raises because it is the main source of income for her family. Hence, she needs a loan of $800 to buy piglets and to purchase a cow to help plow a field.

loans.use: To buy piglets and a cow

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en:
Dalal, a 28-year-old woman living in Bourj el Barajneh, Lebanon with her husband and their child, has owned a grocery store selling food and candy for almost a year, having begun it with the support and encouragement of her brother. Her clients are friends and neighbors.

Dalal is requesting a loan of $1000 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase more merchandise and food products for her shop. Although this is the first time she has asked for a loan, in the future she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and food products.

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Pen K. is 55 years old and has a business selling bananas in a busy market in Siem Reap province. She makes US$ 10 a day and her husband, Kim Hout, 54, makes US$ 6 a day arranging wedding ceremonies, renting out chairs and tables. She will use this loan to purchase bananas from individual growers for re-sale to meet her customers' demand.

loans.use: To purchase bananas from individual growers

loans.name: Khun

texts.en: Mrs. Khun Y. is a villager in Trapaing Kdar village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a grocer. Her husband, Mr. Krouch Chhoem, is a village chief and a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. With this plantation, he earns a small income to support his family. Thus, Mrs. Khun Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn more income. She is 41 years old and the mother of four children who are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land to cultivate rice

loans.name: Lochinoy

texts.en:
D. Lochinoy has four children. She is a very honorable and resolute woman. Ever since she was a young girl she has learned the honest work of raising cattle, a knowledge she has passed down to her own children who have also managed to improve their quality of life. Lochinoy and her husband started their livestock business with only one cow. After a number of sacrifices, they were able to increase little by little the quantity of calves. At the moment, with the support of their children, they have started to produce milk. They sell these on the weekends in their village. Lochinoy wants to expand her business and to purchase more cattle. With the desire of improving their living, Lochinoy is counting to your generous heart. 
  
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, Tajikistan is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase cattle

loans.name: R.e.c Primary School, Bassa Town Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the R.E.C. Primary School, Bassa Town Group. R.E.C. Primary School Bassa Town was founded in 1945 by the Rural Council to give education to the children of Waterloo. R.E.C. Bassa Town is divided into Lower Primary School (Classes I – III) and Upper Primary School (Classes IV – V). The Lower and Upper schools have a total number of 731 pupils and a total number of twelve staff. R.E.C. Primary school is proud that their pupils are able to make good grades at the National Primary School Exams (NPSE).

Over the years, the school has grown so much that it now lacks adequate classrooms. Staffing is also a problem facing the school. It lacks enough trained and qualified teachers to meet the growing number of pupils.

This will be the first loan for teachers of the B.E.C. Primary School from SMT/Kiva. This loan will certainly be of immense help to these teachers. Since salaries are usually small in Sierra Leone, especially for people in the teaching profession, they could not use their salaries to buy or do anything great. But with a loan, they can now buy or do something big and then repay over a period of time. Some of them will use it to begin or continue building a house, others to pay either for themselves to pursue further studies or pay for their children’s education. Some will use it to invest in businesses in order to complement their monthly salaries. Still others will use it to buy furniture.

Irene M. C. (back row third from left) is the head teacher of R.E.C. Lower Primary School. She was born in Waterloo, twenty miles (thirty-two km) from Freetown. She is fifty years old and married with four children. Two of her children are grown, one is in college and the other is in Junior Secondary School III (JSS III). She has been a head teacher of this school for over five years. Irene will invest this loan in her business. It will enable her to expand her business. She sells cigarettes, sugar, soft drinks, rice and so on. With the loan, she will be able to buy these items in wholesale.

loans.use: To supplement their salaries

loans.name: Giovana Silvia

texts.es: La Srta. Silvia tiene la actividad de servicio de desayunos en una entidad pública de nuestra ciudad, con la ayuda de su mama que desde tempranas horas de la mañana preparan los sándwich, cafés etc. Para dar una buena atención a la institución, de esta forma ayuda a sus hermanitos menores en el estudio y asimismo paga sus estudios de la Universidad , con el crédito que le brindaremos podrá renovar la vajilla que es su primera herramienta de trabajo, ella es muy responsable ya que trabaja con nosotros desde hace un año.
texts.en:
Senorita Silvia runs a breakfast diner in the city with her mother's help. Starting very early in the morning, the two prepare sandwiches and serve coffee. They are working to support Silvia's younger brothers and to pay for their education, as well as to pay for Silvia's own university tuition. The loan will be used to buy new dishes, crockery and cutlery, since these are the most important items they use. Silvia is very responsible and has been a member of her communal bank for one year.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Dishes, crockery and cutlery

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora María de Jesús es casada con el señor Juan Pablo Cárdenas y viven en la colonia Gobernadores casas donadas por el gobierno de Coahuila por la fuerte tragedia que sucedió el día de la inundación en Villa de Fuente. Ella es empleada domestica de una residencia desde hace un año, su esposo trabaja en el área de mantenimiento de una promotora ambiental también desde hace un año. 
A pesar de haber pasado por esta tragedia donde perdieron todo, lo que los hace más fuertes es el deseo de superarse, deseo que les transmiten a sus tres hijos en edad de escuela, ellos están solicitando este crédito para la realización de los acabados interiores de su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. María de Jesús is married to Mr. Juan Pablo Cárdenas and they live in the Gobernadores neighborhood, at houses that were donated by the Coahuilan government because of the strong tragedy that happened on the day of the Villa de Fuente flooding. Mrs. María has been a domestic helper at a residence for a year. Her husband has also been working for a year at the maintenance area of an environmental promoter agency. In spite of going through a tragedy where they lost everything, their desire to overcome this is what makes them stronger. They communicate this desire with their three children, who are all in schooling age. They are requesting this loan to finish building the interiors of their home.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finishing the walls of her home

loans.name: Ruziboy

texts.ru:
Рузибой Файзоев  занимается сельским хозяйством , выращивает пшеницу на арендованной земле.  Выращенный урожай продает мельникам. Сельским хозяйством Рузибой занимается уже около 6 лет. В этой сфере деятельности ему помогает отец Анорбой.
  Дополнительный семейный доход в семью приносит мастерство Рузибоя, он опытный столяр. Изготавливает предметы, полезные в  домашнем хозяйстве.
  Для  выращивания пшеницы запрашивает сумму в размере 1300 сомони.
  Рузибой женат, и имеет 3 детей.
texts.en:
Ruziboy F. grows wheat on a rented parcel of land. He sells the wheat he gathers to local mills. Ruziboy has been growing wheat for 6 years with the help of his father Anorboy. Ruziboy earns an additional income working as a carpenter. He makes a variety of useful household items. To sustain his wheat farming business, Ruziboy needs a loan of $325 (1300 TJS). Ruziboy is married and has 3 children.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: wheat farming

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Thế Nguyễn Thị is a 49-year-old woman living in the town of Mê Linh. She is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Thế makes and sells herbs and spices in her community. Thế has been engaged in this business for more than six years and earns approximately 4000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2002, Thế joined TYM Fund, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Thế has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Thế is now requesting a new loan of 20000000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the sixth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Thế plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia P. is from the village of Danao. She is 60 years old and is widowed. Alicia owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Alicia has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Alicia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Alicia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Alicia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Silvio Antonio

texts.es: El señor Silvio Antonio M., reside en el Km. 40 carretera a pochomil 3 Km. abajo ½ c al sur, tiene 37 años de edad, su esposa le tiene tres hijos que estudian, su objetivo es pode ayudar a sus hijos que estudien. Don Silvio se desempeña como director de servicios municipales,  con este préstamo desea hacer un intermedio para los cuartos y poder tener privacidad. Su planes a futuro es ampliar su vivienda para poder gozar junto a su familia de los logros alcanzados. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo con los créditos ya que es la única manera de poder hacer mejoras.
texts.en:
Mr. Silvio Antonio M. lives at km 40 Pochomil Road – 3 km down and ½ c to the south. He is 37 years old. His wife has three children who are students, and he want to help them continue with their studies. Don Silvio works as a director of municipal services. His loan will be used to build a hallway between the rooms of his house to provide privacy. His future plans include making expansions to his home for his family to enjoy. He thanks the institution for supporting him with this loan because this is the only way for him to make these improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to finish a hallway

loans.name: Tap

texts.en:
Tap P., 45, is a village woman living in Siem Reap Province. She is a local farmer, growing rice, vegetables, and some fruit on her own farmland. To help meet the family's daily expenses, her husband works in construction. Tap P. now has six children, one of whom is married and has ready started a new family home, while the other five are single. Two of her children are employed: her son is a building worker and her daughter is a garden keeper.

Tap P. saw that her two employed children face difficulties with transportation when they go to work since they have no vehicle of their own. Hence, Tap P. would like a loan of $700 to buy a motorcycle for her children to ride to their workplace.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her children to ride to their workplace

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: Justina C. is married and has 4 dependants. She has received schooling through junior high school. Justina has a small grocery store where she sells tin tomato and  cooking oil at Secondi near Takoradi, which she has done since 1996. Her husband sells cement blocks. Justina uses her income to pay for the family’s expenses. Justina will use the loan to purchase more groceries for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Justina plans to save.

loans.use: Justina will use the loan to purchase more groceries for resale.

loans.name: Souleye

texts.fr: Souleye D. âge de 34 ans est un exploitant de sel minéral Il achète le sel produit pour le revendre  .les revenus tirés du commerce lui permettent de nourrir sa famille. Pour faire face à la demande il sollicite un prêt lui permettant d’acheter des quantités plus importantes de sel.
texts.en:
Souleye D., age 34, is a mineral salt provider.  He buys salt produced for resale.  The revenues derived from commerce enable him to feed his family.  To cope with the demand, he's requesting a loan allowing him to buy larger quantities of salt.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad tiene 59 años D. edad, es separada y vive junto a la última D. sus siete hijos en el distrito D. La Victoria, ubicado a cinco minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Ella lleva 27 años viviendo en La Victoria y desD. hace 25 años empezó a alquilar algunas habitaciones D. su casa a estudiantes y trabajadores que provienen D. lugares alejados. Este negocio ha sido la fuente D. ingreso que ha mantenido a su familia durante todo este tiempo.
 
Sus hijos ya son mayores y trabajan en distintos lugares D. la región, ella continúa trabajando con la finalidad D. ayudar a todas las personas que, al igual que ella, vinieron a Chiclayo en busca D. un futuro mejor.
 
Debido a la antigüedad D. su casa, esta necesita D. algunas reparaciones, es por ello que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1200 nuevos soles los cuales piensa invertir en las reparaciones necesarias para que sus habitaciones puedan seguir acogiendo a sus inquilinos por más tiempo.
 
Su más granD. anhelo es construir otra casa para que alguno D. sus hijos se gane la vida en el mismo negocio y también ayuD. a las personas que vienen D. muy lejos a la ciudad. Ella es una mujer muy alegre, carismática y muy querida por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Natividad is 59 years old, separated from her husband, and lives with the youngest of her seven children in the district of La Victoria, located five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has been living in La Victoria for 27 years and, 25 years ago, started renting out some rooms in her home to students and workers who come from distant regions. This business has been the source of income that supported her family over all these years. Her children are now grown and work in different parts of the region. She continues to work with the goal of helping all the people who, like her, come to Chiclayo in search of a brighter future. She needs to make some repairs due to the age of her house. For this reason, she is approaching Edpyme Alternative for the first time to request a loan of 1,200 soles. She plans to invest the funds into making the necessary repairs so that her rooms will continue to attract long-term renters. Her greatest wish is to build another house so that one of her children can earn a living in the same way she has. Also, this would help the people who come from far away to the city looking for work. She is a happy, charismatic woman who is very dear to all her neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make improvements to her rental rooms.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: P. is 53 years old and lives in Phnom Penh. She owns a few rental rooms that she rents out to people who need to relax on their work. Most of her guests are employed in garment factor. P. also works preparing room for a hotel. P. has five children: one is a student and other four are married and live separately. Her husband who appears in the photo, who is the one management of her business. P. would like a loan to buy a motor to make easier family's commuting to anywhere. This will allow this family to cut a taxi cost.

loans.use: To buy a motor to make easier family's commuting to anywhere

loans.name: Kakh-E-Qadem Group

texts.en:
This is Kakh-e-Qadem Group and Khanam Gul is the group leader. This group is made up of three female members and each of them would like to expand their business and bring some new changes to it.

Khanam Gul would like to take a loan for her husband’s fruit shop. They both share the work of the business: Khanam Gul cleans and packages the fruit and the husband sells it in the shop.

Shuker Gul wants to take a loan for her tailoring business. She wants to buy a new sewing machine in order to sew good-quality clothes and have lots of new clients.

Nazifa wants to take a loan for her quilt-making business to purchase essential materials for it.

Together, they have requested a group loan of 30,000 Afghani. They all admire the process of Kiva loans.

loans.use: To use as business capital for her husband's shop

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
Mrs. Yun K. is a fish seller in the local market. She is 37 years old and the mother of three children: one is into sales while the others are attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Mel Krounh, is a cow middleman. They live in Russey Srouk village in Takeo province. Since the cattle business is doing well, they want to expand it. In order to improve this business, Mrs. Yun K. decided to request a loan to buy two more cows. She hopes to increase their income and provide a better life for her family. 
Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy two more cows for her husband’s business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy manure and pay for labor for growing peanuts

loans.name: Achayo

texts.en:
Achayo B. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local alcohol and is requesting a loan to purchase more brewing materials and make more alcohol to sell. Achayo is 22 years old and is married to a husband who is a soldier. She has 2 children. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar and restaurant.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more brewing materials and make more alcohol to sell

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhom K. is a villager in Sra Mor village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. On this plantation, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to buy farming supplies to support her rice field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and gasoline, and to pay for plowing. Her husband, Mr. Nak Sovan, is a duck breeder. Mrs. Sokhom K. is 40 years old and the mother of six children. One of her children stays at home to do housework, three are enrolled in the local school and the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides, & gasoline, and to pay for plowing.

loans.name: Nerida

texts.es: Nerida tiene 44 años y vive con su esposo Guillermo de 43 y su única hija Ángela de 11 años, en su casa que es propia.Con la ayuda de su hermano y su esposo, desde hace 20 años  se dedica a sembrar papa, arveja, habas, maíz y flores de gladiolos de diferentes colores, los que  después comercializa en el mercado de la ciudad, su actividad es rentable porque le permite costear los gastos de sus casa, brindarle una adecuada calidad de vida  a su hija y ahorrar para comprar más chacras; para el futuro ha planeado terminar de construir su casa,  sembrar en mayor cantidad, además de aperturar un negocio de venta de celulares y accesorios en la capital del Perú , también desea comprar un moto carro que brinde servicio público en la ciudad.Es el noveno préstamo que tiene con MFP y sabe que debe ser puntual en sus pagos para acceder a otros créditos, además esta satisfecha con el trabajo de su banco comunal porque los integrantes son muy unidos.El dinero del préstamo, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales de construcción para el techado de su vivienda, también comprará varios sacos de abono y fertilizantes para asegurar una buena producción y así obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Nerida is 44 years old and lives with her husband, Guillermo, 43, and their only daughter Ángela, 11 years old, in their own house. With the help of her brother and husband, she has been growing potatoes, beans, peas, corn and various colors of gladiola flowers for 20 years, which she sells in the city market. Her business is profitable, and she is able to cover her household costs, offer a suitable quality of life to her daughter and accumulate savings to buy more farmland. In the future, she would like to finish building her home, grow in larger quantities, and open a business selling cellular phones and accessories in the capital of Peru. She also would like to buy a motorcar with which to offer public service in the city. This is her ninth loan with MFP, and she knows that she must be punctual in her payments to access more loans. She is satisfied with her communal bank, because the members are unified. She will invest the loan in the purchase of construction materials for the roof of her home and to buy various bags of fertilizer to ensure a good crop and obtain better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bags of fertilizer and improve her home

loans.name: Dalim

texts.en:
Mrs. Dalim C., 38, and her husband, Mr. Tiny Pin, 45, live in a small village in the suburbs of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 2000 and have two children: one son and one daughter. One goes to school and the other one stays at home.  

Mrs. Dalim C. is a garment factory worker, while her husband is a motorbike taxi driver. He drives in Phnom Penh and is able to earn 25,000 riel (about $6.25) per day. The couple is in the process of building a new house, but it isn't finished yet. So, Dalim is asking for her first loan of $500 in order to finish the house.

loans.use: To finish building a new house.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
En Somotillo, municipio de Chinandega, el señor Emilio M. se dedica a la venta de ropa y mochilas vendidas por él mismo ambulantemente por las calles del municipio saliendo diario desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana con el fin de vender dichos productos para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Los productos los lleva en un saco y cuando va llegando a los lugares para mostrarlo los saca para su exhibición.
El crédito que está solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de ropa y de mochilas para continuar con sus ventas y así ganarse el pan de cada día dignamente en el municipio.
texts.en:
In Somotillo, in the municipality of Chinandega, Mr. Emilio M. sells clothes and backpacks door to door. Daily, he leaves home in the early morning in order to sell his products and bring home an income. He carries everything in a bag, and takes out one or two samples when he needs to. He will use the loan he is requesting to buy clothes and backpacks in order to continue selling them and making a living with dignity.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clothes and backpacks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying electronics

loans.name: Nelly Margarita

texts.es:
Nelly O. de 55 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, es viuda tiene 4 hijos de 39, 30, 34 y 24 años. 

Debido a la falta de ingresos en su familia cuando murió su esposo ella decidió vender cuadernos a las afueras de su casa pero solo en temporadas escolar tenia dinero decidió que mejor era invertir sus ahorros en un pequeño salón de belleza. 

Ahora ella tiene uno de los más grandes Salones de Belleza en su sector, trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 22h00 todos los días. Ella hace cortes de cabello, tinturados, planchados de cabellos etc. También tiene surtida su tienda con bebidas y snack. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar tintes, snack, bebidas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere especializarse en cursos de estilista y así enseñar en cursos.
texts.en:
Nelly O., 55, lives in an urban area in the outskirts of the city of Guayaquil. Her house is made of cement and has all of the basic services. She is a widow and has 4 children aged 39, 30, 34 and 24. Since her family lacked income after the death of her husband, she decided to sell notebooks in the area surrounding her house during the school year. Once she had some money she decided it would be better to invest her savings in a small beauty salon. Now she has one of the largest beauty salons in the neighborhood. She works from 7am until 10pm every day. She does haircuts, hair coloring, hair straightening, etc. In addition, she stocks her salon with drinks and snacks. With this loan she wants to buy hair dyes, snacks and drinks for her business. In the future she hopes to specialize by taking stylist classes and eventually teaching stylist classes.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy hair dyes, snacks and drinks

loans.name: Marivic's Group

texts.en:
Marivic P. is from the village of Cablong, Sta.Barbara, Pangasinan. She is 34 years old. Marivic is the leader of a 3-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Marivic is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Marivic owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income from the business comes from selling vegetables in the local community. Marivic has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month

In 2009, Marivic joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business activities.  Marivic has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from ASKI.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  Marivic is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and for working capital.  This loan will be the third loan taken out by Marivic from ASKI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 
-----------------------------------------------
About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory, working capital.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en el sector Las Mercedes, una zona urbano – marginal del distrito de Castilla, perteneciente a la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace un año a la venta ambulante de comida en una avenida bastante transitada y frecuentada por transportistas, el negocio goza de muy buena acogida debido a su buena sazón y al buen trato que ofrece a sus clientes, como la demanda está creciendo ella es ayudada por una prima, los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza en sus gastos personales y en ayudar al sostenimiento de su familia.

Nelly desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más utensilios con los cuales pueda ofrecer un mejor servicio, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo de modo que pueda percibir mas ganancias y seguir creciendo como empresaria.

Ella es una joven responsable y que gusta mucho del trabajo que realiza, su mayor anhelo es poder tener su propio restaurante. Las personas que la conocen la consideran una mujer dinámica y que siempre está dispuesta a ayudar cuando se le necesita.
texts.en:
Nelly is 27 years old and single. She lives in her parents’ house, which is located in the Las Mercedes sector. This is an urban zone on the border of the Castilla district, which belongs to the Piura province in the region of the same name. It is located three hours from the city of Chiclayo. For one year she has been selling food as a street vendor. She sells on a pretty busy street, which is frequented by lots of drivers. The business enjoys being well received due to its good seasoning and the good customer service. As demand is growing, a cousin helps her. The income she gets from this activity is used for her personal expenses and to help support her family. Nelly wants to expand her business by purchasing more utensils, which will allow her to offer better service. To do this she has seen the need to ask, for the first time, for a loan for 500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa. The loan will help her achieve her objective so that she can get more income and keep growing as a businesswoman. She is a responsible young woman, and she really likes the work she does. Her greatest desire is to be able to have her own restaurant. The people who know her consider her to be a dynamic woman who is always ready to help when needed.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy utensils to improve service and expand her business

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en:
Ruslan B. is a 36-year-old trader who sells seasonal vegetables in his small shop in Agsu city. He is married and his three children are the meaning for his life. Ruslan started his business in 1996 and step by step he earned enough to build his own shop. 

He is a very polite man and that is the reason for the success of his business. Ruslan applied for a loan of 900 AZN to increase the amount of merchandise he sells.

loans.use: To increase the amount of merchandise

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios C. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 52 years old. Remedios is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Remedios owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. She raises pigs for breeding. She also owns 2 hectares of rice field, which her husband mainly manages. Remedios has been engaged in her business for over 28 years.

In 2008, Remedios joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remedios has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Remedios is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She also plans to buy farm inputs for the rice farm. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Remedios from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Reth

texts.en: Mrs. Reth D. is a villager in Lekh Pram village in Kandal province. She is 58 years old. She owns a general store at her home. Since her business is going well she wants to expand. Mrs. Reth D. is seeking a loan to buy more groceries to resell. Her husband, Mr. Soeurn Sek, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow crops to sell to support his family. With the proceeds from these activities, they support four children, three of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the other is attending a local public school. Her husband is shown in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy more groceries.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita V., 42, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Margarita, a widow, has always been challenged to provide for the daily needs of her family. She makes sure that she earns well so that her family can have better lives. She has been managing her own general store for years and is now planning to expand to a new variety store.

Margarita has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her business.

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for an 11,000 Philippine peso loan. This amount will be used to buy more quantities of groceries, beverages and other items for the opening of her new variety store.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow and that she will be able to buy her own house and lot. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Buying additonal stock to be incorporated into her current product inventory

loans.name: Kulnara's Group

texts.en: Kulnara U. is the leader of this group. She is 45 years old and married. She has a daughter, who is 24 and works in a sewing workshop in Bishkek. Three years ago, Kulnara and her husband rented a store to sell auto parts. They started with an initial investment of 15000 soms. Kulnara has begun to sell motor oil in the store. Now she makes 25000 soms per month. With money received from this loan, Kulnara wants to purchase motor oil for trucks and auto parts to increase the turnover of her business. In the future she wants to save money to be able to pay for her grandchildren's study at university. Zoya B. is the treasurer of the group. She is 28 and divorced. A year ago, some relatives gave a cow as a present for her father’s anniversary. Zoya resold that cow after fattening it and made good money. After that, she began to breed cattle. She started with an initial investment of 8000 soms and now she makes 5000 soms per month. That profit made it possible for her to purchase household appliances and repair the house. Zoya applied for this loan because she needs money to purchase some farm animals for breeding. Kalysbek A., 30, is married. He has a son who is 7 and studies at school. Six years ago, Kalysbek’s brother suggested he rent a place and open a karaoke bar. Kalysbek started this business activity with an initial investment of 15000 soms and now he makes 30000 soms per month. This profit made it possible for him to open a pool and bathhouse near his place. With money received from the loan, Kalysbek wants to purchase a shower cubicle for the bathhouse. In the future, he wishes to open an entertainment center. B. K. Astra, 19, is married. Four years ago, with the initial investment of 25000 soms, Astra began to sell chicken grill and now she makes 20000 soms per month. With money received from this loan she wants to purchase chicken. Ainura K., 39, is divorced. She has raised two sons. The first son is 25; he works at a pasta factory. The second son is 20; he is a student. When the children have free time they try to help their mom. Ainura opened a kiosk four years ago. She sells convenience goods and makes 7000 soms per month. She applied for this loan because she needs money to purchase various goods in order to increase her turnover. In the future, Ainura plans to open a grocery store. ====================================== Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). Mol Bulak is the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase motor oil and auto parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy supplies like fungicides, nitrogenated manure, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials to improve her home, such as: cement, sand, stones, ect.

loans.name: Roun

texts.en:
Roun Y. is 47 years of age and a resident of Kompong Tom Province, where she earns a living as a local cultivator. To have extra proceeds, Roun Y. makes cakes to sell to nearby villagers. She has another financial earner in her husband who owns instruments to use to provide music for a profit. The couple are the good parents of nine children. Four of them are now married and live independently, while other five are single.

In the past, Roun Y. hired a neighbor’s pump to irrigate her crops because she didn’t have her own pump. She now hopes to buy one by using a Kiva loan.

loans.use: To buy a pump to irrigate her crops

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es: Teofilo, de 40 años de edad, convive con su pareja y fruto de ellos, tienen tres hijos en etapa escolar. El vive en la localidad de Santa Rosa, donde tiene su propia casa a base de adobe. Teofilo asegura que el producto de cacao se ha convertido en los últimos años en un gran negocio, desde luego que está sacando el máximo provecho a sus plantaciones hasta llegó al punto de comprar productos de cacao de otros productores, con la finalidad de que pueda cumplir con sus compromisos de entrega para sus clientes. Por tal motivo, sus clientes se sienten en confianza, por el buen servicio que les otorga, además percibe buenas ganancias económicas, por lo que siente gran satisfacción por el negocio que realiza. Cada año va tomando presencia en su localidad, de esta manera trata de mejorar en cuanto a la cantidad y calidad de su producto. Normalmente trabaja conjuntamente con su pareja, pero en temporada de sembrío y cosecha necesita la ayuda de sus peones, con la finalidad de que recolecten el producto final. Su punto de venta lo realiza en los centros de acopio de su misma localidad y su rutina diaria es a partir de las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde. Mas adelante piensa mejorar su casa a base de material noble, con el propósito de brindarle estabilidad a su familia. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además siente que llegará lo mas lejos posible con su banco comunal, ya que todos están conformen por el buen manejo de su grupo. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de insumos y abono, con la necesidad de prevenir futuras enfermedades a sus plantaciones de cacao, de esa manera no perjudique su productividad.
texts.en:
Teófilo, 40, lives with his life partner; they have three school age children. They live in Santa Rosa in their own adobe house. Teófilo assures us that cacao production has become a very profitable enterprise in the last few years. He is getting the most profit out of his crops and even had to buy from other producers in order to fill all his orders. His customers trust him thanks to the good service he provides and he makes good profits so he is very satisfied with his work. Every year he becomes better positioned in his community and he constantly strives to improve both the quality and quantity of his product. He usually works alongside his partner but during planting and harvesting he needs help from laborers in order to bring in the final harvest. His sales point is the local gathering centers. He works daily from 7am until 6pm. Later on he plans to rebuild his house using substantial materials to provide more stability for his family. This is his 5th loan with MFP and he pledges to continue to repay in a timely fashion. He feels that he will get as far as possible with his communal bank because everyone is very satisfied with the group’s performance. The requested funds will be used to buy manure and supplies to prevent future plant illnesses in his crops so that productivity won’t be adversely affected.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure for his cacao crops.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en: Mercedes O. is a married woman who lives in Phase I-C, Brgy. Canturay, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a general store and a rice-selling business. Her husband Vergillo O., who is 58 years old, works as a security guard to earn his living, and also helps with his wife's business activities. They have three children who range in age from 23 to 36 years old. Mercedes joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 19 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Mercedes has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 11,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 20th loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500, which she intends to use to buy more goods such as fertilizers, insecticides and groceries to resell in her sari-sari (general) store so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs. Mercedes O. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en: Cherry T. is from the village of Tinabalan, Gingoog City. She is 48 years old. Cherry is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Cherry runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products and also buying and selling bananas in the local community. Cherry has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Cherry joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cherry has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Cherry is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be the third loan taken out by Cherry from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela N. sells cassava flour and maize flour, and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of flour to sell. She is 24 years old and is married to a farmer. She has one child who goes to school. With the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to stock baking flour and start baking bread.

loans.use: Stock more bags of maize flour to sell

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.es:
La señora Rose Marie es separada ya hace varios años, tiene tres hijos que van a la universidad, vive en casa de sus padres, en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz.
La cliente trabaja realizando todo tipo de trámites legales y de trabajo social, para gente de escasos recursos, cuenta con una oficina en la ciudad de El Alto. Es así como obtiene sus ingresos para su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para la reparación de la computadora que tiene en su oficina y así realizar mejor su trabajo y  poder aumentar sus ingresos.
Es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Rose Marie has been separated for several years.  She has three children who attend the university.  She lives in her parents’ house in the Alto San Pedro area of the city of La Paz.

She works doing all types of legal paperwork and social work for people with scarce resources.  She has an office in the city of El Alto.  That is how she gets income for her household.

The requested loan is to repair the computer that she has in her office.  That way she will do her work better and be able to increase her income.

This is her first loan.  The completed socioeconomic evaluation qualifies her for a loan.

loans.use: Cost of repairing the computer in her office

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane M. lives in Masis town, Armenia.  She has been selling fruit and vegetables since 1995.  Gayane is a sole proprietor and has achieved success in business thanks to her tolerant nature, good business skills, and competitive prices. 

She is trading at the back of the Armenian Market, where the renting prices are lower and the fruit and vegetable prices are correspondingly lower.  In addition to having market clients, Gayane also supplies restaurants. Her son and husband help her by delivering the orders. Autumn is a high season for fruits and vegetables in Armenia. Gayane is planning to increase her working capital, and therefore she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To stock up fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Eutiquia

texts.en:
Eutiquia H. is married and has five children who are between 25 to 32 years old. She lives in Guiwang Barangay in the municipality of Alcoy on Cebu island in the western Visayas islands. Her husband, Modesto H., 65 years old, is a farmer and also helps his wife in her businesses. She has three businesses: a farm, a sari-sari store and a habal-habal (motorcycle) transport business.

Eutiquia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of 1200 PHP, lifting the family's standard of living.

For her sixth loan, she is borrowing 11,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell in her shop so that she can continue to save up to improve her house and for the education of her children. Eutiquia H. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They are on a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon—a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Elpedio

texts.en:
Elpedio O. is from the village of Barangay 24, Gingoog City. He is 60 years old, married, and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Elpedio owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating a welding shop in the local community. He is also engaging in buying and selling of coconuts in the local community. Elpedio has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elpedio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elpedio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Elpedio is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional coconuts. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Elpedio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional coconuts.

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.en: Ceferina belongs to the “Pro Desarrollo” cooperative bank, which is located in the Pisac district of the province of Calca. She is 38 years old and married with four children. She requested her loan for $500 to invest in her business selling handicrafts.  Each day, she will sell her handicrafts, clothes made from alpaca, and souvenirs in the Plaza de Pisac. She is very happy with the loan granted, and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: To Invest in a Handicrafts Business

loans.name: Anna Akuyuk

texts.en:
Anna Akuyuk E. is a woman of forty-eight years. She is married and the mother of four children. They live in Soweto in the outskirts of Lodwar Town, where her business is located. She operates a food stall where she sells cooked food, such as beans and rice. She has been in this business for two years and earns a monthly income of ten thousand shillings.

This will be Anna's first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to buy more food so that she can increase her inventory. With the income she will earn, she wants to expand the stall and have a bigger stall. In the future, she wants to be more financially stable .

loans.use: To buy more food for to sell

loans.name: Y's Group

texts.en:
In Preaek Chhmouh village, located in the Kandal province, a group of seven people is seeking a group loan. Mrs. Y S. is the group leader. She was selected to be the leader by the other members. She and her husband, Mr. Chann Sieb, are farmers who own a plot of land which they use to cultivate rice and lotus. To support the growth of their farming activities, Mrs. Y S. would like to ask for a loan to buy pesticide and to pay for laborers to grow her lotus. She also earns additional income by breeding pigs. 

Mrs. Y S. is 46 years old, and she is the mother of three children: two are seamstresses in a garment factory and the last one is attending a local school.

loans.use: To buy pesticide and to pay for laborers to grow lotus

loans.name: Ununio Group

texts.en:
Tabu M., who is in her late thirties, is married with two children. She has been selling food in a local place for three years now.  She works from 5:00am to mid-day, daily, and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Tabu's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to expand her food business and has paid back her loan successfully.  She hopes for a new loan to further increase her stock of foodstuffs. Her dreams is to improve her children's living conditions and her life.

Tabu will share this loan with her loan group "Ununio", which has a total of 15 members  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Tabu is just in front, first on the right.

loans.use: To increase her stock of food

loans.name: Las Reynas De Zirahuato Group

texts.es:
La señora Catalina Martínez M. pertenece al grupo llamado “LAS REYNAS DE ZIRAHUATO” es originaria de la localidad de Zirahuato ubicado en el estado de Michoacán, conocido porque ahí se encuentra la zona arqueológica y muy cerca de ese lugar está el santuario de la mariposa monarca. Doña Catalina tiene 35 años de edad, comenta que estudio hasta el sexto año de primaria y que ya no continúo con sus estudios porque sus papas eran personas de bajos recursos y no tenían dinero para comprarle las libretas. Doña Cata como es conocida por sus amigos y vecinos se dedica a la venta de dulces y frituras, comenta que ella pidió el préstamo a Fundación Realidad para invertir en la compra de dulces de diferentes sabores, chicharrones, sopas instantáneas, café, té, chicharrones preparados, refrescos, jugos etc., también tiene en su local unas maquinitas de juego de video donde los niños van a divertirse un rato. Tiene trabajando con su negocio hace aproximadamente 4 años, comenta que empezó a vender sus dulces para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de su casa y también porque se quería sentir útil. Ella surte en diferentes tiendas de la población de Zitacuaro. La meta que tiene la señora Catalina es invertir en una tienda de abarrotes pero sin descuidar su negocio de los dulces ya que el local que tiene en su casa es muy amplio y dice que quedaría muy bien una tienda de abarrotes ya que también cercas de su casa no hay tiendas. Doña Catalina está casada con el señor Juan el cual es chofer de transporte público, ellos no tienen hijos pero el sueño de doña Cata seria tener un bebe. Ella está contenta porque Fundación Realidad le hará el préstamo y porque se le hace poco lo que pagara de intereses en comparación de otras financieras con las cuales ella trabajo y no le gusto, está agradecida por la confianza que depositaron en ella.
La Señora Cristina L. Martínez, es parte del grupo “LAS REYNAS DE ZIRAHUATO” es originaria de la localidad de Zirahuato estado de Michoacán, esta localidad rica en cultura ya que muy cerca de ahí se encuentra localizada la zona arqueológica de Zirahuato un lugar mágico lleno de energía positiva, ella tiene 47 años de edad y estudio hasta el segundo año de primaria y ya no continuo con sus estudios porque le ayudaba a trabajar a sus papas y no le alcanzaba para sus útiles que ocupaba en la escuela, ya que su familia eran personas de bajos recursos y por eso se tuvo que dedicarse  a trabajar desde muy jovencita para aportar dinero a su casa. Doña Cristina está pidiendo un préstamo a Fundación Realidad para la compra de leña, maíz, gas, cal, etc., ella se dedica a vender tortillas hechas a mano y a la venta de masa en su casa desde hace dos años y comenta que empezó con este negocio para sacar adelante a sus pequeños hijos y para pagar los gastos de la casa. Doña Cristina es Viuda y tiene 3 hijos pero nada más dos viven con ella  de nombres Roberto y Luís ambos estudiantes de primaria. Comenta que el préstamo le beneficiara a su familia ya que gracias a las ganancias que obtenga doña Cristina podrá darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y poderles dar estudios que es lo que más le importa. La meta que tiene la señora es abrir una tienda de abarrotes porque el humo que sale del comal donde hace las tortillas con el tiempo hace mal para la salud. Las otras 2 integrantes se llaman María Guadalupe Martínez L. y Amanda M. N., ellas quieren los préstamos para invertir en la compra de maíz, leña, dulces etc., para su venta.
texts.en:
Catalina M. M. is a member of the group named "Las Reynas de Zirahuato", meaning The Queens of Zirahuato. She is originally from Zirahuato, located in the state of Michoacan. It is known for its archeological sites and very near by is the Monarch butterfly sanctuary. Catalina is 35 years old and she has a grade six education. She did not stay in school because her parents were of limited means and they did not have enough money to buy her notebooks. Cata, as she is known to her friends and family, sells sweets and fried foods. She says that the loan she requested from Fundacion Realidad will be used to purchase sweets of various flavors, pork rinds, instant soups, coffee, tea, soft drinks, juices etc. In her store she also has some video games that he children use to amuse themselves for a while. She has had her business for approximately 4 year and she started selling sweets to help her husband with the household expenses and because she wanted to feel employed. She makes her purchases in various stores in the community of Zitacuaro. Catalina's goal is to invest in setting up a convenience store but she doesn't want to let her other business run down. The store in her house is quite large and she said a convenience store would be very well suited there, especially because there are no other stores near by.  Catalina is married with Juan, a public transport driver. they don’t have children but Cata's dream is to have a baby.  She is happy that she will receive a loan from Fundacion Realidad because the interest rates are low in comparison to other financial institutions with which she has had experience. She is thankful for the trust they have imparted upon her. 

Cristina L. M. is a member of the group "Las Reynas de Zirahuato". she is originally from Zirahuato Michoacan, a region that is rich in culture.  Very near by there is an archeological site and it is a magical place filled with positive energy. she is 47 years old and she has a grade 2 education. She did not stay in school because she was helping her parents in their work and they didn't have enough money for the school supplies that she needed. Her family was of limited resources and she had to start working when she was little to bring a source of income for the home. Crisitina request a loan from Fundacion Realidad to purchase firewood, corn, propane gas, lime, etc. she has been selling hand made tortillas and corn dough from her house for two years and she said she started the business to support her small children and to cover the household expenses. Cristina is a widow and she has 3 children but only two live with her. They are Roberto and Luis and they are both in primary school. She says that the loan will help her family and it is thanks to the income that Cristina will earn she will be able to provide her children with a better quality of life. She will be able to send them to school which is the most important thing. Her goal is to set up a convenience store because the smoke that emanates from making tortillas can be hazardous to her health over time. 

The other two members are Maria Guadalupe M. L. and Amanda M. N.. They request a loan to invest in the purchase of corn, firewood, sweet, etc., for their sales.

loans.use: To purchase sweets, fried foods, juices, etc.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es: Jenny, de 36 años es una valerosa madre soltera, que espera la llegada de su pequeña hija a la que todavía no le puso un nombre, pero dentro de estos días nacerá y ya está preparando su cuarto en su casa alquilada; ubicada en la comunidad de Pampa Silva (selva central peruana). Su esfuerzo y constancias le permitieron obtener en todo estos 20 años, que se dedica a la agricultura, sus propios terrenos agrícolas. Donde acondicionó una pequeña casa, para poder así cuidar y velar del desarrollo de sus plantaciones de cítricos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo son las temporadas de cosecha pues brinda trabajo a las personas de su localidad, quienes le ayudan en la extracción de los frutos maduros; que vende 2 veces a la semana en el mercado de la ciudad de Santa Ana. Ahora sus proyectos son invertir en la compra de más injertos de naranja y tangelo, para poder sembrar en mayores cantidades, pues ahora tiene que pensar en los gastos del cuidado, alimentación y vestimenta de su hija. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los soñadores”, y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde se siente tranquila, pues la apoyan siempre en el logro de sus objetivos. Jenny, comenzará su cosecha de “tangelo” (fruta cítrica), en el mes de abril, por ello con el crédito está pensando comprar varios sacos de abono para esparcirlos en su cultivos y de está manera estén listos para la cosecha.
texts.en: Jenny is 36 years old. She is a brave single mother awaiting the arrival of her little gitl, whom she hasn't named yet. She will be born any day now and she is getting the room ready in her rented house in the community of Pampa Silva (central Peruvian jungle). Her hard work and reliability have allowed her to do all that she has done these past 20 years. She works in agriculture, on her own land where she fixed up a small house to be able to take care of and watch over her citrus plants. What she likes the most about her job are the harvest times because she offers work to the people in her community, who help her pick the ripe fruit. She sells it twice a week in the city market in Santa Ana. Now her projects are investing in buying more orange and tangelo grafts to be able to plant larger quantities, now that she has to think about the expenses of caring for, feeding and dressing her daughter. She belongs to the “Los Soñadores” [The Dreamers] community bank. This is her fourth loan with MFP, where she feels good, because they always support her attain her goals. Jenny will start harvesting the tangelo (a citrus fruit) in April. Because of this, she is planning on buying several bags of fertilizer to spread on her crops and in this way get them ready for harvest.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Pumamarca Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Pumamarca” tiene 9 ciclos D. funcionamiento (cada ciclo son 4 meses),  el banco comunal está conformado por 12  mujeres y 1 varón. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la capilla D. la comunidad D. Pumamarca (San Sebastián, Cusco, Perú). La mayoría D. los socios viven en la comunidad D. Pumamarca. (La comunidad D. Pumamarca está ubicado a 10 minutos D. la ciudad D. San Sebastián y a 30 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco). Pumamarca se caracteriza por tener paisajes hermosos, montañas y un clima templado. La mayoría D. los pobladores D. la comunidad D. Pumamarca se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.        

Los socios son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos.  Las actividades económicas D. algunos D. los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo; venta D. verduras y venta D. animales menores.  
 
La socia Rosario nació en la comunidad D. Ayarmaca – Pumamarca y tiene 42 años D. edad. Actualmente, Rosario vive junto con su esposo y sus tres hijos en la comunidad D. Ayarmaca - Pumamarca. Su actividad económica principal D. Rosario es la venta D. verduras, ella lleva sus productos a vender a diferentes mercados D. los distritos D. la ciudad del Cusco. También Rosario se dedica a la crianza D. animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas y chanchos. En esta oportunidad Rosario requiere el préstamo e igual que sus compañeras del banco comunal para incrementar capital del negocio pero ella desea comprar animales menores.
texts.en:
The “Pumamarca” communal bank has had nine financing cycles (each cycle lasts four months).  The bank’s members are 12 women and 1 man.  The bank’s meetings are monthly and take place in the Pumamarca community chapel (San Sebastián, Cusco, Perú).  Most of the members live in the community of Pumamarca.  (The community of Pumamarca is located 10 minutes from the city of San Sebastián and 30 minutes from the city of Cusco).  Pumamarca is noted for having beautiful scenery, mountains and a temperate climate.  Most of Pumamarca’s residents are farmers and raise livestock.

The members are hard working and enterprising; they  always seek ways to get ahead and through their daily efforts proviD. a better future for their children.  The economic activities some of the members are involved in are small farm animal sales and vegetables sales, for example.

Rosario, 42, was born in the community of Ayarmaca-Pumamarca.  She lives with her husband and three children in the community of Ayarmaca-Pumamarca.  Her main economic activity is vegetable sales.  She takes her products to sell in various markets in Cusco’s districts.  She also raises small farm animals like guinea pigs, chickens and pigs.  On this occasion Rosario wants the loan, as do her fellow communal bank members, to increase the business’s capital so she wants to buy small farm animals.

loans.use: to buy small farm animals.

loans.name: Poulyne Kwamboka

texts.en:
Poulyne Kwamboka N. is married to Peterson, and they have one child. She has a boutique in Lucky Summer estate in Nairobi. She has been in this business for two years and earns an income of 10,000 KES monthly.

Poulyne learned about KADET LTD through a friend. She is applying for her first loan with which she plans to purchase more stocks of cosmetics, bags and beauty products to sell. She plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her child.

Poulyne hopes to expand her business and deal in a variety of beauty products. She hopes to grow her business to give her children a better education.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics, bags and beauty products to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Gicheha

texts.en:
Gicheha has practiced farming in the town of Ndunyu Njeru for the past 30 years. He is 52 years old, married to Margaret and they have five children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds, fertilizer and pay for labour during this planting season.  

In the future, Gicheha hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer and to pay for labor

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo qui sont toutes des femmes mariées ont en moyenne 31 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Massoukou, sous préfecture de Fana; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments et de charbon de bois.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des condiments et du charbon.                                                                        
BADOUSSOU, qui est la présidente du groupe, compte acheter, 4 grands cartons de cubes Maggi avec les revendeurs du marché de Marka-Coungo. Elle effectue sa vente quotidiennement au village de Massoukou, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce de condiments.
texts.en:
The women of the Djekafo group are all married with an average age of 31 years old and three children; they all live in extended traditional families in the village of Massoukou, in the sub-prefecture of Fana, which lies in the Koulikoro region (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region). They got to know each other through relatives, neighbors and friends. They trade in condiments and charcoal.

The women in this group are on their first solidarity loan which will be used to buy condiments and charcoal.

Badoussou, who is the president of the group, is planning to buy four large cartons of "Maggi" stock cubes from retailers in the market at Marka-Coungo. She carries out her sales every day in the village of Massoukou, for cash and on credit, to a customer base made up of men and women. She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 15,000FCFA, which will be used to make her loan repayments, with the balance being reinvested in her condiment business.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Sous

texts.en:
Mr. Sous, age 46, is a domestic rice cultivator in the Baray district. He is married and the father of four, three of whom are single and work in a variety of jobs, while the last is a student who studies in a public school. 

Mr. Sous uses his farm to grow different kinds of crops and a few vegetables. His wife works alongside him in the field. Mr. Sous will be using his Kiva loA. to buy piglets and cows to raise. He will sell them when they are big enough.

loans.use: to buy piglets and cows to raise and sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 50 years old and married. She supports six people in her family. For the past three years, Margaret has been a farmer who cultivates her own piece of land. She is hardworking, and only needs resources to attain her goals.

Margaret learned about KADET through outreach by KADET staff in her area and this will be her second loan. She is planning to buy farm inputs such as seed and fertilizer. With the profits she hopes to make from her loan, she intends to plant wheat on a larger piece of land and educate her children.

Margaret’s future dream is to buy a bigger piece of land and become a commercial farmer.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seed and fertilzer

loans.name: Sharafat

texts.en:
Sharafat lives in Saatli. He is married and the father of three children.  He has been running a business of selling construction materials, such as cement and fuels, for more than three years.
