He makes his sales from his own house, which allows him to have many clients and customers while at the same time be engaged in a cattle-raising business together with his wife. Currently he is asking for a 1,100 AZN loan to purchase young cattle. He has five years of experience in cattle breeding. 

Being a very accurate person by nature, he is sure, and would like to ensure the lenders, that he is able to pay the loan on time without any violations.

loans.use: to purchase three baby calves.

loans.name: Ngugi

texts.en:
Ngugi is 29 years old and married with one child. He runs a barber shop so as to earn a living for his family. He has been operating his business for over five years. Besides this, he does dairy farming to earn extra income. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has grown his business and bought dairy cows.
Ngugi hopes to become financially stable in the future. He has requested 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a shaving machine.

loans.use: to buy a shaving machine.

loans.name: Margarita De Jesús

texts.es:
En municipio de Managua, la señora Margarita de Jesús se dedica arduamente  a laborar como analista de reclamo en una institución del estado, dedicándose a esta labor desde hace treinta un años. Es soltera y con dos personas a su cargo que le proporciona las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrollen.

La señora Margarita De Jesús ha acudido a ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para mejorar la condición de su vivienda en la compra de materiales de construcción tales como bloque, cemento, arena, por medio de esta obra brindarle mejor condición de vida a su familia, para poder hacer un anexo de un cuarto.
texts.en:
In the town of Managua, Margarita de Jesus is arduously dedicated to working as a claim analyst in a state institution. She has been dedicated to this work for thirty one years. She is single and with two people in her care to whom she gives the necessary conditions for development.

Margarita de Jesus has come to Ceprodel with the goal if requesting a loan to improve the condition of her house by purchasing construction materials such as blocks, cement, sand. Through this effort, she can provide a better living conditions to her family by making a room annex.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Muonga

texts.en:
Muyonga is a hardworking, 53-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with a 19-years-old child who is school-going. For the last three years, he has been rearing and selling poultry so as to provide for his family. He supplements this income from the earnings he makes from selling maize. In the next five years, he wants to have doubled his working capital so that he is able to expand his business. 

He is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy chickens. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he is now able to keep and maintain book records for his business.

loans.use: to buy chickens .

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es: La Sra. María es una mujer luchadora, trabajadora y  con muchos deseos de superación y éxito; ella vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos; la Sra. María se dedica a la venta de ropa para bebes y niños, ya lleva en el negocio más de 2 años laborando; por medio de los ingresos de su esposo puso el negocio y se dedico a ello ya que le encantan los bebes, gana aproximadamente S/. 180 nuevos soles semanales. El crédito otorgado lo va a invertir en la compra de mas mercadería (ropa para bebes y niños) ya que quiere tener bastante variedad de modelos.   Sus sueños de la Sra. María es poder aperturar una tienda reconocida y darles una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos para que no les falte nada. Ella está muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado ya que con ello va a tener mayor éxito en sus ventas.
texts.en:
María is a fighter and an industrious woman with many hopes for getting ahead and for her success. She lives with her husband and her three children. María sells baby and children's clothing. She has been working in the business for more than two years. 

She started the business with her husband’s income and she is committed to it because of her love for babies. She earns approximately 180 nuevos soles weekly. She is going to invest the loan in the purchase of more merchandise (baby and children's clothing) because she wants to have a wider selection of styles. 

María’s dream is to have well known store and to provide a good future for her children so they don’t need anything. She is very grateful for the loan because it will provide her with greater success in her sales.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (baby and children's clothing) to increase her sales.

loans.name: Rica

texts.en:
Rica is 35 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Rica has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for three years and also earns an additional income from ready-to-wear.

Rica aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy items to sell.

loans.name: Ednalyn

texts.en:
Ednalyn is 45 years old and has two children who attend school.  She is engaged in selling vegetables, candies, and biscuits in the school canteen. She also cooks vegetables and sells them to the students. Through this business, she can afford to send her children to school.  

Because she wants to improve her business, Ednalyn is requesting a loan for 20,000 PHP to buy soft drinks, breads, hot dogs, and Styrofoam boxes. She wants to earn an increased income for the continuous education of her children. She hopes that they will someday hold a degree.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, breads, hot dogs, and Styrofoam boxes

loans.name: Fabian

texts.es: Fabián tiene 33 años, convive con Mauricia 30 años, con quien tiene 03 hijos. Juntos habitan en la localidad de Natividad del distrito de Pichari. El trabajo al que se dedica es el cultivo de cacao, ajonjolí y Mani, productos que tiene mucha demanda en el mercado. Durante estos 7 años se ha dedicado a este trabajo, peus le gener ganancias, además que sabe como alternar la producción. Menciona, "Pues cada vez que uno logra sus objetivos  debe sentirse orgulloso  y aprender a valorarse". Este será su primer crédito con MFP,  por lo que se compromete en pagar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 3,000 soles que solicita, contratará peones para que lo ayuden a limpiar y fertilizar su parcela de cacao.
texts.en:
Fabián, 33, lives with Mauricia, 30; they have three children.  They live together in Natividad in Pichari District.  The work he does is farming cocoa beans, sesame and peanuts, products that have high market demand.  He’s been in this line of work for seven years for it produces profits.  Besides, he knows how to alternate production.  He mentions: “Every time one reaches one’s goals one should feel proud and learn how to value oneself.” 

This will be his first MFP loan so he commits to pay his installments punctually.  He will use the requested 3000 new soles to hire day workers to help him weed and fertilize his cocoa bean field.

loans.use: to hire day workers.

loans.name: Tsitsino

texts.en:
Tsitsino lives in the village of Sartichala, Gardabani District, East Georgia. She is 49 years old and lives with her three sons who are 20, 18 and 14 years old. Her youngest son goes to school and the elder ones work in the Ministry of Defense for the country. They get salaries, which are important sources of income for the family. 

Tsitsino has a milk cow. She produces cheese and sells on average 20 kg of it locally to dairy-product retailers. Now she requested credit to purchase a second milk cow. She will double the amount of produced and sold cheese and thus increase her income by 100%. She will use her increased income for purchasing new household goods to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Olga Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señorita Olga tiene 19 años de edad, es una joven muy emprendedora, estudiante, soltera y sin hijos. Cuenta con un pequeño comedor en el centro de la ciudad, muy acudido.
Según comenta Olga es muy concurrido su local por las exquisitas minutas y variedades de menú para almuerzos, como guisos, tallarines, estofados, asado a la olla, minutas como empanadas, milanesas y otros. Empezó gracias a la ayuda de un hermano y su madre, una de sus hermanas colabora con ella en las tareas de todo el día.
Solicita la ayuda de fundación paraguaya y kiva para la compra de una heladera ya que solo cuenta con un pequeño congelador, y desea surtir más la venta de bebidas.
texts.en:
Olga, 19, is a very enterprising young woman; she’s a student, single and has no children.  She has a very popular, small snack bar located downtown.  According to Olga, it’s very popular because of the exquisite snacks and the varied lunch menu like stir fried dishes, pasta, stews, pot roast and snacks like turnovers, breaded steaks and others.  She started thanks to a brother and to her mother and one of her sisters helps her out with the chores all day.

She is asking for help from Fundación Paraguaya and from Kiva to buy a cooler since she only has a small freezer and she’d like to stock more beverages to sell.

loans.use: to buy a cooler for the snack bar.

loans.name: Ireneo

texts.en:
Ireneo is 57 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom are in high school.  He lives in Silang Cavite, Philippines. Ireneo makes a living by farming, which he has been doing for 20 years. He plants seasonal fruits and vegetable to sell. He also drives a school service vehicle that gives him additional income.  He earns a minimum of 8,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every month.

Ireneo is requesting for a loan for 10 000 PHP, which he will use to buy items needed for planting such as fertilizer, pots, and seedlings. He expects a boost in his income as he expands his business. 

Ireneo hopes to send all his children to college to have a good future. Lke most Filipino parents, he believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can give to their children. As a CCT community partner, he faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where he can also draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and materials.

loans.name: Young Rising Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you the members of the “Young Rising” group. These women are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 500,000 SLL each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Isatu is the leader of this group. Isatu is forty years old and married with four children. Two of her children are in primary school, and two are not school-aged. Isatu has been a businesswoman for the past 20 years. She has requested this loan in order to buy one bag of flour and one bag of rice for sale.

loans.use: to buy one bag of flour and one bag of rice for sale.

loans.name: Chi Stephine

texts.en:
Chi Stephine was born in 1946, and is married. He lives with his five children, one of whom is under 15, in a six-room house in Ntambah, a quarter in Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. Chi Stephine has faced many challenges in life, including ill health, death and poverty.

Chi Stephine joined Kiva partner GHAPE on August 3rd 2005 and has successfully taken and repaid loans four times. The profit from his most recent loan was used to buy medication, education and the building of rooms in his compound. He strongly believes his business will succeed because of better management skills and the keeping of records to enable him to take decisions when necessary. His business will help people in his community who will not have to go far from home to purchase manure for their agricultural products.

The profit from this loan will enable Chi Stephine to buy medication in cases of ill health, build more rooms in his compound, and also expand his business by ploughing back some of the profit into the business. He prefers a loan from GHAPE because education is given before loan disbursement, interest rates are low compared to other financial institutions, and it offers a convenient time of payment.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, yam seedlings and feed.

loans.name: Jovia's Group

texts.en:
Jovia's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Jovia is 20 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past three years, Jovia has been working hard to manage her market stand, which sells fresh fruits. 

To help expand her business, Jovia has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fruit for resale, and will help Jovia to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Jovia hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a home. 

Jovia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Jovia's future prospects by helping her to learn how to succeed.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 50 years old and married with four children who are currently going to school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Tessie runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her sari-sari store. She has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, milk, sugar, soap, and canned goods.

In the future, Tessie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret, a 43-year-old married mother of four, has owned  a green grocery store selling vegetables, tomatoes and potatoes for the past seven years, and has one employee. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Margaret has been able to educate her children, and she hopes to expand her business in the future. She is now requesting a loan for 50,000 KES to buy more vegetables, tomatoes and potatoes.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, tomatoes and potatoes.

loans.name: Richard Sard's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is a group of teachers from the eastern city of Koidu/Kono. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, based in Makeni city in northern Sierra Leone, to apply for a loan of 6,600,000.00 SLL. With the help of this loan, they will be able to solve their immediate financial needs and then gradually repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. 

Richard is the leader of this group of teachers. He was born in Samamdu, in eastern Sierra Leone. Richard is sixty years old and he is married with six children – one in primary school, three in secondary school and two are no longer attending schools. A professional teacher for many years now, Richard has applied for this loan in order to buy house building materials – iron corrugated zincs, cements, etc. for the construction of a family dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy house building materials – iron corrugated zincs, cements, etc. for the construction of a family dwelling house

loans.name: Marriam

texts.en: Marriam is a 36 year old married woman who has 5 family members from Bani Kenanah Irbid Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for her home improvements, She will be repainting it and to do maintenance for the entrance of the home. In the future she is planning on adding another room.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en: Amelita Undagh is married and has two children. She is 48 years old and lives in Talairon Oroquieta City. Amelita is engaged in general store business to earn a living and has had this business for six years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this work. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase more stock such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, vinegar, salt and other consumable products for her general store business. In the future, Amelita hope to have more savings for her children education.

loans.use: to purchase more stock such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, vinegar, salt and other consumable products for her general store business.

loans.name: Tsiuri

texts.en:
Tsiuri is a 55-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband, son and daughter-in-law in the small village of Kobuleti district. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land where they grow fruits and vegetables. 

Tsiuri is a very hard working woman and does her best to ensure a good harvest. They sell the harvested products at local markets. Tsirui decided to build a greenhouse on part of their land to grow vegetables twice a year and generate more profit. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 3,000 GEL. With the loan, she will purchase building materials and build a greenhouse. Tsiuri awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: joyce is a married woman with 3 children; two of them attend school in Bundibugyo-Uganda. She is a cocoa trader who started her business in 2005 with an aim of taking care of her family needs and gets additional income from her cocoa gardens. Her family dream is educating her children to university and building a good house, as her business dream is expanding her cocoa business to new markets. She requests a loan to pay school fees for her children and secure their report cards which were confiscated because she had not cleared the fees balance to zero.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Fonima

texts.en:
Fonima is a widow with 2 children. Her husband was a captain for one of the interisland ferries. When her husband died in 2004 she started a small shop.
She joined SPBD in 2005 and used her first loan to make icy poles to sell in her shop. Since then she has used loans to renaovate and expand the shop. She also bought a second hand refridgerator. The shop is getting bigger. Sometimes she makes things to sell herself such as cakes or sandwiches. And icy poles.

Fonima is pictured here in the SPBD office.

loans.use: Renovate the shop

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.en:
María Eugenia is a responsible enterprising woman who has been making and selling piñatas for the past 20 years. She learned this trade from her father. She is married and in order to help with the family’s expenses, she installed a workshop in her house, starting her own business. The demand for her products is good and is on the rise. She needs to increase her production and for this, she needs a loan of $550 to buy the necessary materials. You can be an important part of the of this business. With your help, Maria will achieve great things! She has worked very hard to maker business succeed and she is thankful for your generosity and support.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

María Eugenia es una mujer responsable y emprendedora, que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de piñatas desde hace 20 años, oficio que aprendió de su padre. Ella es casada y para contribuir al gasto familiar instaló un taller en su propia casa, y así comenzó con este negocio. La demanda por sus productos es buena y va en aumento, razón por la que ella quiere incrementar la elaboración de sus productos, para esto ella necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 550 dólares, para conseguir los materiales que necesita.

Tú puedes ser parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio, con tu ayuda María puede hacer grandes cosas, ella ha trabajado mucho para sacar adelante su oficio y agradece sinceramente tu generosidad y apoyo.

loans.use: compra de insumos

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan will be invested in the maintenance and repair of one of his printing presses that is in poor condition.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria, mother of two, has lived and worked in Juliaca her entire life, where she has a clothing stand in the local market, Tupac Amaru. She has operated at the same stand for twenty years now. She travels every three months to Lima to purchase clothing for her stand. When she first started her clothing business she exclusively sold clothing for adults but has recently moved into undergarments. She primarily sells underwear, socks, swimsuits, towels, and other light garments.

According to Victoria, there is less competition and a larger profit margin in undergarments. She currently uses her loans for purchasing the products she needs for her stand. With a $500 loan, she would be able to continue to expand the variety and quality of the clothing she sells.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for undergarment stand.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Rita is a widow with three three children. When she became a widow, she found herself needing to bring up her children and keep her household, which is why she began her sewing business. She now has eighteen years of experience with the business; her first clients were her family and neighbors from her area, but then thanks to her fine sewing, she was recommended by friends to various clients, and she now sews school uniforms and elaborate dresses, as well as mending and repairing clothing. With her business, she has been able to help her children get ahead, and she wishes to continue with the business.

Rita is asking for a US $250 loan to buy quality material for her business, such as cloth, thread, and the upkeep of her sewing machine to make her products, and she is offering to pay off the loan in three months. She and her family thank you for the support that you give her to continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva Volunteer.

Rita es una mujer viuda y tiene tres hijos, al quedar viuda se vio en la necesidad de sacar adelante a sus hijos y mantener su hogar, por ello es que empezó con su negocio de costura, ella ya tiene 18 años con el negocio y sus primeros clientes fueron su familiares y vecinos de su colonia y luego por su buena costura la fueron recomendando con sus amistades y así se fue haciendo de varios clientes, cosiendo también en escuelas y vestidos laboriosos, además de composturas y arreglos, con su negocio a podido sacar adelante a sus hijos y desea continuar con su negocio.

Rita esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 250 para comprar materia prima para su negocio como telas, hilos y mantenimiento de la maquina de coser que tiene para elaborar sus productos, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses, ella y su familia te agradecen el apoyo que le das para continuar con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Pampanichi is a city splashed with the bright colors of Paulina C.'s handbags. Day after day, she pours her experience and creativity into making these bags, which she sends to Pampanichi weekly to be sold. Paulina also has great talent preparing flavorful, high-quality traditional dishes, a talent that brings her family lots of joy during times of celebration. She has thought of integrating traditional plates into the sales at her store, but the project demands a large investment in more materials, in addition to a small sewing machine to increase bag production and revenue. With her earnings, she will be able to realize her project goals to be able to continue providing for her grandson who lives with her. Since Paulina’s separation 7 years ago, her grandson has brought much joy to her free time. She is asking for your support so that she can keep making her beautiful bags.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer.

Pampanichi es una ciudad que ve dibujada su atmósfera D. vistosas bolsitas coloridas gracias a que Paulina C., día a día enfrascada en su taller D. textiles vierte toda su experiencia y creatividad para la generación D. estas bolsitas; las cuales envía a Pampanichi semanalmente para su venta.Paulina también posee una excelente sazón y calidad en la preparación D. platos típicos, que son infaltables durante las temporadas D. celebración para el deleite D. todos sus familiares. Ha pensado incursionar en la venta D. comida típica en su localidad, pero el proyecto le demanda una gran inversión por lo que desea comprar una mayor cantidad D. materiales, además D. una maquinita remalladora para una mayor producción D. bolsas y un mayor ingreso económico.Con el dinero que obtendrá D. este trabajo podrá empezar a concretar su anhelado proyecto para así seguir apoyando a su nieto, quién vive con ella y se ha convertido en una gran alegría en sus momentos libres, ya que es separada desD. hace 7 años.Solicita vuestro apoyo para poner en marcha la confección D. bellas bolsitas.

loans.use: Purchase of materials for making beautiful handbags.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: I am Naseem L. from Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. I was married eight years ago and I have two sons. My elder son is five years old and attends kindergarten whereas the younger one is two years old and will hopefully attend school in the future. My husband and I make and sell Rickshaw (three-wheeled taxi) indicator lights. We have been in this business for more than five years. He obtains orders from various rickshaw factories and supplies them with the required lights. However we do not have the necessary funds to fulfill large orders. Therefore, we require a loan of $575 to increase and expand our business.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: Isatu T. is 37 years old and married with 4 children. She runs her business in Makeni, Sierra Leone. With her previous loans she increased her stock of clothes and also increased her income. She would like to continue expanding her business and is requesting $350 to purchase 5 more bails of clothes.

loans.use: Increase her stock of clothing to sell to generate more income

loans.name: Marcelline

texts.fr:
Born in 1977 in Dangbo, located in the southeast of Benin in the Oueme Valley, the second richest valley in Africa, Marcelline H. is married and the mother of two.  She sells fruit retail and envisions selling fruit wholesale.   She is requesting a loan to develop her business and to satisfy a constantly growing customer demand. Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer


Née en 1977 à DANGBO dans la vallée de L’OUEME au sud-est du BENIN, deuxième vallée plus riche de L’AFRIQUE, dame H. Marcelline est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle vend des fruits  en détail et envisage la vente en gros. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour développer son activité et satisfaire la demande sans cesse croissante de sa clientèle.

loans.use: To buy fruit:  pineapples, oranges, bananas, papayas

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline P. is married with three children. She is 36 years old and hails from Edo State, Nigeria. She sells ice cream. She has been in this business since 2004. She needs a loan of $725 to buy a deep freezer and a bicycle for her business.

loans.use: To buy a deep freezer and bicycle for her business

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha started a small general store 3 years ago. Her husband was laid off and they set up the business with some of the money he received from his employer. She felt that it was necessary to do something for the family expenses when she knew that her husband would be out of work for a while. Thanks to her hard work, thing have gone very well but she'd like to have a larger business and she needs loans for that.

Martha is asking for a US$475 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, to buy merchandise and have more stock on hand so that she can attract more customers. With your help, Martha can meet her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Martha M. tiene una mercería, inicio hace 3 años porque a su esposo lo liquidaron y pusieron el negocio con algo de ese dinero, ya que la sentía la necesidad de hacer algo por el gasto familiar al saber que su esposo estaría sin trabajo una temporada. Gracias a su esfuerzo le ha ido bien pero a ella le gustaría tener mas grande su negocio por eso necesita un crédito.

Ella solicita US $475 que esta dispuesta a pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y tener mejor surtida la mercancía, y así atraer mas clientes. Con tu ayuda Martha lograra su meta.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana María is a diligent and loving mother who constantly watches out for her family’s well being and tranquility. That’s why she has worked countless jobs over the years to provide for her children while they finished their secondary studies. Now, thanks to all her persistent work at these jobs, she has the good luck to see her children professionally employed.

Five months ago, Ana decided to rent a space and open a small bodega (grocery store) in a strategic location in Juliaca city. Because of the great variety of merchandise she offers – as well as the great service she provides to her customers – her store is filled with customers.

In addition to this work, Ana makes beautiful curtains, bedspreads, tablecloths and decorations in her free time. She sells these items, which are often requested by her customers, in her small store.

Translated by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Ana María, es una diligente y amorosa madre que en todo momento vela por el bienestar y tranquilidad de su familia, es por esa razón que a lo largo de su vida se dedicó a innumerables actividades para tratar de mantener sin limitaciones económicas a sus queridos hijos mientras concluyan sus estudios superiores. Actualmente tiene la dicha de ver a sus hijos ya profesionales gracias a las actividades a las que se dedicó y a las que le puso mucho empeño.

Doña Anita hace 5 meses decidió alquilar un local y abrir una bodeguita en un lugar estratégico de la ciudad de Juliaca, gracias a la variedad de su mercadería y sobre todo a la buena atención que brinda en su pequeña bodeguita está siendo muy concurrida.

Adicionalmente a esta labor en sus hora libres doña Ana se dedica a confeccionar hermosas cortinas, cubrecamas, manteles de mesa y adornos decorativos que en muchos casos son solicitados por sus clientes y ofertados en su tiendita.

loans.use: Additional capital to increase supply of products in her small business

loans.name: Gani

texts.en: Gani K. was born in 1958 in the J.Ismoil region of Tajikistan. He is married and has four children. For the last 40 years, Mr. K. has made a living raising livestock. He also works on a collective farm, but this is not his main occupation. Mr. K., whose three brothers who also raise livestock, has a good herd made up of six rams and one cow. He dreams of having a larger flock, and has applied for a Kiva loan to buy a pedigreed bull to make this possible. He will repay the loan in six months.

loans.use: to buy a pedigreed bull

loans.name: Galamshah

texts.en: Galamshah was born in 1956. He is married and has 3 children. This family lives in Khachmaz town. Three years ago, he started selling agricultural produce. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy fruits and vegetables to improve his business,

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Izveta

texts.en:
Izveta is a young woman from the town of Tesanj in northern Bosnia and Herzegovina. She is not married and currently lives with her parents. Izveta has been looking for a job but, as in many places in Bosnia, unemployment rates are high in her town. Her grandmother has been sharing part of her pension with Izveta in order to help her get by for now.

While she keeps looking for a permanent job, Izveta wants to start selling cosmetics. She will use this loan to order an inventory of cosmetics from a wholesaler, and she will go on to sell the items to friends and around town. Izveta hopes from this business she can start earning and saving her own money.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Carloyne

texts.en: Carolyne is a 28-year-old married mother of 2 children. She lives in Likoni, Mombasa. She is the proprietor of a school and also has a dressmaking/tailoring shop. She started the school in 2007 and currently offers both kindergarten and primary levels. The school has 75 pupils. In her dressmaking shop she makes African clothes for men and ladies and also sells cosmetics. She has applied for US$600 to improve her dressmaking business.

loans.use: To improve her dressmaking business

loans.name: Jumoke

texts.en: Jumoke is 39 years old, married to Mr. O., and they have five children. Jumoke sells foodstuffs like gari, beans, and rice, both wholesale and retail. The demand for her foodstuffs is high. She needs the loan amount of US$ 925  to enable her to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra F. I. Fausta is a member of community bank, Renacer, which means “rebirth” in Spanish. She is married and has five children. She has a stand at the market where she works daily, selling cereals and grains. With her loan of 2500 soles, Alejandra will invest in her business by purchasing oatmeal, flaxseeds, and dried goods.

Alejandra hopes to continue working so she can save up for when she is older and can no longer work.

loans.use: With her loan of 2500 soles, Alejandra will invest in her business by purchasing oatmeal, flaxseeds, and dried goods

loans.name: Hanifan M.sharif Group

texts.en:
Hanifan Mai baji is a 53-year-old lady and resides in a city named Vehari, Pakistan. Her husband is M., who has a fertilizer-selling business. He provides fertilizer to land owners so that they are able to nourish their plants. Hanifan baji works in a rice mill where she packs the rice in sacks. She earns $10 per month. Hanifan baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan and a Kiva Field Partner). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more fertilizer for her husband.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Sugran baji wants a loan to buy wheat and rice to resell. Musarat baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine to sew clothes. Maryam baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to resell; rice and wheat to resell; a sewing machine; and groceries for a grocery shop

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en:
Mahdi is a 22-year-old man who lives in Bourj el Barajneh in the southern suburbs of Lebanon. For the past 1.5 years, he has been working as a barber.

Mahdi is now requesting a loan in the amount of $1,200 via Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools and new seats for his salon. This is the first time that he has sought a loan, but Mahdi hopes that the loan proceeds will help him improve his salon. He notes that his clients are primarily his friends and neighbors. In the future, he plans to expand his business and to open up a bigger salon.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by purchasing tools and new seats for his salon

loans.name: Nun

texts.en:
Mrs. Nun K. is a villager in Kdey Tnaut village in Takeo province. She is a grocer who owns a small grocery store. 

Her husband, Mr. Sorn Sim, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. He now faces a problem, because he does not have enough money to grow rice during the dry season. Thus, Mrs. Nun K. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed and fertilizer. 

She is 37 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school, while the youngest is too young to work or study. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 50-year-old Farida U. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with five children between the ages of 13 and 25. Farida has been running a poultry business since 1990. 

Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. First, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiply naturally! Second, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Third, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. 

She works at the business for six hours per day, seven days per week. Farida currently earns about US$300 from her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase chicks and feed. In the future, she plans to open another business. Farida thanks you for your support!
	
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and feed.

loans.name: Zulfira

texts.ru: Зульфира Абдуллаева  1976 года рождения , замужем имеет 6 детей.  С Микроинвест сотрудничает с 2004 года по настоящее время. Имеет хорошую кредитную историю. Торгует  мужским нижнем бельем.  Имеет хороший доход от продажи. Зульфира ездит за товаром сама с Уратюбе. Утром ездит вечером она уже  привозит , на следующий день выходит на рынок и продает. Планирует  расширяться и увеличивать ассортимент детской одежды.
texts.en:
Zulfira A. was born in 1976. She is married with six children. She has been a Microinvest client since 2004 and has a good credit history. Zulfira sells men's underwear which she brings from Uratube. She travels to Uratube in the mornings and sells the goods on the market next day. The business is profitable, and Zulfira plans to expand it and increase the assortment of children's clothing.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Marilu Norma

texts.es:
Marilu es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio.
Marilu es soltera, tiene 27 años y es enfermera de profesión, Marilu tiene una botica llamada FARMASOL, en un local alquilado que se ubica al frente de un centro de salud, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de 2 personales.
Marilu necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de analgésicos.
Marilu sueña con tener otra sucursal.
texts.en:
Marilu is a member of the Communal Bank Lirio. Marilu is single, 27 years old, and is a nurse by profession. Marilu has a pharmacy called FARMASOL in a rented locale that is located in front of the health center; she runs this business with the help of 2 employees. Marilu needs a loan of 1400 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of analgesics. Marilu dreams of having another pharmacy branch.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase analgesics.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es: Isidro vive con sus 3 hijos en su domicilio que es propio y que se encuentra ubicado en Villa Candelaria. La casa de Isidro cuenta con el respectivo registro en DDRR. La construcción es de material, tiene 3 cuartos y una pequeña cocina. Isidro se dedica a prestar servicios de pasajeros (con chofer) con una movilidad propia. También se dedica a prestar servicios de albañilería. Cuenta con experiencia en ambos ramos lo que le permite asegurar los ingresos. La competencia en el transporte es alta, debido a la gran cantidad de competidores que presenta, pero el trabaja con una línea, lo que de alguna manera mitiga esta situación. El destino del crédito es realizar mejoras en la vivienda, desea construir un cuarto o remodelar uno de los que tiene. El anterior crédito se cancelo con total normalidad.
texts.en:
Isidro lives with his 3 children in a house he owns, located in Villa Candelaria. The home has the respective registration of DDRR, and has 3 rooms and a small kitchen. Isidro dedicates himself to providing passenger transportation services (with a driver) using his own vehicle. He also dedicates himself to providing construction services. He counts on experience in both areas, which allows him to secure his means of income. Competition within the transportation business is high, given the large amount of rival enterprises. He, however, works with one line and this helps mitigate this situation. The loan funds would be designated for making improvements to his home, as he wants to build an additional room and remodel an existing one. His previous loan was canceled in a timely manner and without any issues.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To remodel and make improvements to his home.

loans.name: Adiza

texts.en: Adiza M. is divorced with 2 children and received an education through Junior High School . Since 1989 she has worked as a petty trader selling provisions at Essaman Junction in Elmina.  Adiza uses her income to pay for school fees and light and water bills. Adiza will use the loan to purchase provisions such as milk, sugar, rice, soap, and canned foods. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adiza plans to continue working on the building she has started.

loans.use: purchase provisions such as milk, sugar, rice, soap, and canned foods

loans.name: Akram

texts.en:
M. Akram is 27 years old and married. He is an expert in computer services and has run his own business for the last two years providing services such as internet, printing, scanning, lamination and so on. Akram tries to use up-to-date technologies in his work in order to satisfy his customer's demands and requirements. For example, he is now planning to purchase a new modern computer to improve the quality of his work and to expand the business. For this purpose Akram is requesting a loan of $2500 USD for the term of 12 months. This is Akram's first loan; he thanks Kiva lenders for their support and promises to pay the loan on time.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase a new modern computer

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses M. is a Tanzanian businessman and entrepreneur. He runs a food shop business in the Yombo Vituka ward in Dar es Salaam. He sells different types of food crop products, particularly cereal crop products including wheat flour, maize flour, beans, cooking oil, sugar, and ground nuts. He purchases his business goods direct from the producers in wholesale, and purchases others from Kariakoo Market city shopping center.

He is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to buy more business goods for sale in his food shop.

loans.use: To buy more business goods for sale in his food shop

loans.name: Chheoung

texts.en:
Chheoung S., 34, has been involved in a business selling meat, bread and grill eggs since 2007. He sells by motorbike in nearby villages and makes a daily income of $8 US. Together, he and his wife, Leb Pheap, have three school-age children. S.’s wife always travels with him to help with the business.

S. plans to use a loan of $600 US to expand his business. He thinks that when his children are old enough to get more education, he will be able to support them easily with the increased savings and income from investment of his loan.

loans.use: To expand a food business

loans.name: Guaracal Group

texts.es: Las  socias “Guaracal” esta representada por la señora Lina Constancia y conformada por 12 miembros que se conocen entre si y que van cursando juntos ya su cuarto ciclo demostrando puntualidad, honestidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos. Todas las socias realizan actividades comerciales D. venta D. productos como comida, ropa, refrescos, cosméticos, frutas, servicio D. transporte y  técnicos. Como en todo rubro D. comercio existe la competencia en sus diversas actividades pero lo que hace la diferencia es las ganas D. salir adelante para el sustento D. sus familias. El destino del financiamiento e para la ampliación D. sus negocios así como para la adquisición D. materiales e insumos que ayuden a mejorar la calida D. sus productos para hacerlos mas competitivos en el mercado y poder generar mayores ingresos que les den la posibilidad D. mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The Guaracal Group, represented by Ms. Lina Constancia, is comprised of 12 members who are all acquainted. They are currently in their fourth loan cycle, having demonstrated their punctuality, honesty, and responsibility in making their payments. Some members sell food, clothing, beverages, cosmetics, or fruit, while other members proviD. transportation or technical services. As in all business spheres, there exists certain competition, but the main difference is their desire to get ahead and support their families. The loan will be used to expand their businesses, as well as to obtain materials and supplies that will help them improve the quality of their products. This will make them more competivite, which will in turn generate more income, giving them the chance to improve their family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Chuluuntsetseg

texts.en: Chuluuntsetseg B. is 27 years old. She is married with two children, a 7 year old son and a 4 year old daughter. Her husband drives his own car as a taxi for a living. Chuluuntsetseg used to run a hardware/building material stand at the outdoor market but three years ago started a grocery stand. She started out with 1,000,000 Tugrugs (about $715) as capital and with the profits from the business she and her family were able to buy their own land and build a shack on it.  Obviously, she works very hard.  She wants to be able to buy all groceries in bulk (things like flour, rice, bread etc.).  With the extra money from a loan she wants to expand her stand until she can achieve her real dream, to own her own grocery store. She is very diligent and works tirelessly for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy all groceries in bulk (things like flour, rice, bread etc.).

loans.name: Grace Wairimu

texts.en:
Grace is 35 years old, and married with three children and she lives at Kirigu area in Kikuyu Town. Kirigu is a fast-growing center with many businesses and a relatively high population.

Grace got to know about KADET through her friend who was also a member. She has never borrowed from other sources, apart from KADET. When she took her first loan, she paid it off well and on time. This is her second loan and she plans to use this finances to buy a dairy cow.

Grace has been in dairy farming for a number of years now, and besides she also has 10 rental houses. Her customers for the milk are largely retailers in nearby kiosks while her tenants are the employed people working in the nearby towns. She hopes to own her own farm and add to the number of cows for more milk production up to about 10. This will enable her to get at least 80 litres of milk per day.

She also desires to add more rental houses to about 30. This will increase her monthly income, hence improve the standard of living of her family.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: Buying  a dairy cow

loans.name: Binta

texts.fr: Binta D. est une femme de 28 ans, elle est mariée et a 3 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de MEDINA DIAMBERE depuis juillet 2006 et a bénéficié de 5 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés régulièrement. Avec ce prêt elle développe une activité de broderie. Elle confectionne des draps de lit qu'elle vend dans d'autres localités. Les profits générés par son commerce lui permettent de subvenir à ses besoins et à soutenir son mari pour la prise en charge de la nourriture et la santé de la famille.
texts.en:
Binta D. is a 28-year-old woman. She is married and has three children in her care.  She has been a member of the Banc Villageois de MEDINA DIAMBERE since July 2006 and has benefited from five loans, which she always repaid regularly.   With this loan, she's developing an embroidery business.  She makes bed sheets that she sells in other towns.  The profits generated from her commerce allows her to provide for herself and to support her husband, who is responsible for the family's food and health.  

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her capital

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a member of the Mgodi borrower group in Kihesa, Iringa. She is 33 year old woman, she is married and a mother fo3 children. Her children are 14,8, and 3 years old.

Anna has owned a food business for 5 years, She works 15 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Anna`s  first loan from BRAC-Tanzania, she requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more food commodities for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Anna hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more food commodities for sale

loans.name: Mavlyuda

texts.en:
Mavlyuda is divorced with two children. She sells women’s clothing in the market. She originally started as a small market vendor. Today Mavlyuda offers a wide variety of prices and merchandise. She has been in business for 14 years. Mavlyuda would like to increase assorted merchandise in her vending facility. She is hoping to continue working in this sphere and generate additional income. That is why she is requesting a loan of 2400 USD.

Mavlyuda’s business is the only source of income for her family. She is trying hard to earn enough to pay for her children’s education and finish the reconstruction of her private house. We believe timely financial assistance will keep Mavlyuda’s business stable and her family well provided for.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing working capital

loans.name: Houssein

texts.en:
Houssein is a 30 year old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. Houssein has been working as a car mechanic since 2000. He owns a garage, repairs cars, and sells cars spare parts. His clients are his friends and neighbors. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase tools and spare parts for his garage. This is his second loan and he has always repaid on time. His previous loan helped him to improve his garage by buying new tools.

When Houssein first started his business, he didn’t face any difficulties. He decided to start this business because he had been employed in a garage, but decided that he'd rather work independently. In the future, he plans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools and spare parts for his garage.

loans.name: Mrs. Phalla Sok Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phalla S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the eight member group. They all live in Prey Lieb village in Takeo province. 

She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. She is also a fish seller because of her husband, Mr. Loem Thun, who is a fisherman. Additionally, he is a laborer and earns a small salary.  Mrs. Phalla S. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers for the rice field which will make the crops more productive. 

She is 28 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is attending the local school and the other three are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to make her rice crops more productive.

loans.name: Lamia

texts.en: Lamia is a married woman who has five children. In 2001, to help her husband, she started working as a home-based tailor after 15 years of experience in this field. Over the years, she became well known by the clients and today, Lamia is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a new sewing machine and additional textiles.

loans.use: Purchase a new sewing machine and additional textiles

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Savoeun S., 46, and his wife Mrs. Nary Phum, 45, (pictured here together) live along National Road No. 1 about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1990 and have two children: one daughter is a garment factory worker and one son attends a local school.

Savoeun has been driving a motor taxi for 22 years. His wife stays at home and does housework. She hopes to launch a business selling mangoes, so Savoeun is asking for his first loan of $500 to help his wife buy mangoes to sell and to repair his motorbike.

loans.use: To help his wife buy mangoes to sell and to repair his motor taxi

loans.name: Larry

texts.en:
Mr. Larry J. is a rice farmer. He is 37 years old, married and has four children. He keeps himself strong so he can do good work at the farm. He wants to have an abundant harvest to improve his income. Difficulties are not absent from his life, but he is eager to face them and move on.

Larry is now preparing his land for the next planting. He lacks finances so he sought the help of CEVI, an MFI in the Philippines and a KIVA partner. He applied for a loan of 9,000 PHP. He will use this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies. He will also buy crude oil for the tractor. This loan will surely help Larry in his goal of having an abundant harvest.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sorn N. lives in Srae Vong village in Takeo province. She is a grocer in the local village. Her husband, Mr. Sarar Sann (shown at left), owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from farming, he is a chicken seller, an activity by which he can earn a little extra money to help provide for his family. They have three children, two of whom are employed in garment factories; the third is a student.

Mrs. Sorn N. wants to expand her business. She has decided to ask for a loan to buy grocery goods to sell, and she would like to use the rest of the money to buy a motorbike for her husband so that he can sell chickens door to door.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods for sale and to buy a motorbike for her husband to sell chickens door to door

loans.name: Chim

texts.en:
Chim L. is a 43-year-old and a resident of Phnom Penh city, where she earns a living by cultivating rice and vegetable crops on her plot of land next to her house. 

To help meet with the family’s food needs, her husband operates an animal trade, selling cows. Chim L. has three school-aged children, a married child, and another three who are employed, working in the factory. 

Currently Chim L. faces a problem with irrigating her crops due to the fact that her farm is far from a watering system. To overcome the obstacle, Chim L. has requested a loan to purchase a machine and a pump for watering her crops.

loans.use: To purchase a machine and a pump.

loans.name: Allin Warmikuna Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Allin Warmikuna que significa Buenas Mujeres en quechua, inician su tercer ciclo con 21 socias. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. cereales, medicina natural, verduras, pan, joyas, ropa, comida, cosméticos, artículos D. ferretería y servicio D. transporte.

Como es el caso D. la señora Leila es casada, tiene 46 años y 4 hijos, Reynilda junto a su esposo tienen un recreo llamado Natali, el cual cuenta con una piscina, Reynilda también venD. golosinas y comida. Leila necesita un préstamo D. 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, carne y golosinas.

Mientras que Reynilda es casada, tiene 40 años y 2 hijos, Reynilda tiene una vidrieria en un local alquilado, además venD. artículos D. ferretería en las ferias D. la región, Reynilda necesita un préstamo D. 450 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. chapas.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600soles, 750 soles, 1000 soles  haciendo un total D. 13,200 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, carne, chapas, cereales, animales menores, verduras y cosméticos.

Los sueños D. las socias son ampliar sus negocios, sus hijos sean profesionales y tener casa propia.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Allin Warmikuna” (which means “Good Women” in Quecha) is starting its third loan cycle with 21 members. They are engaged in different businesses selling grain, natural medicines, vegetables, bread, jewelry, clothing, food, cosmetics, hardware, and transportation services.

Such is the case with Sra. Leila, who is 46 years old, married, and has four children. She and her husband operate a recreation center called “Natali” that has a swimming pool. Leila also sells sweets and prepared foods. She needs a loan of 900 soles in order to buy rice, meat, and candy.

Reynilda is 40 years old and has two children. She operates a glassware shop from a rented location and also sells hardware at the regional fairs. Reynilda needs a loan of 450 soles in order to buy metal sheeting.

The members need different loan amounts ranging from 300 soles, 600 soles, 750 soles, up to 1000 soles, for grand total of 13,200 soles to the entire Communal Bank. They will use the money to buy rice, sugar, meat, metal sheeting, grain, small animals, vegetables, and cosmetics. The members dream of expanding their businesses, helping their children become professionals, and acquiring their own homes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara hails from Esan in Edo State but resides with her family in Benin City, Nigeria. She is 61 years old, is married and has eight children. Some of her children are married while some are still in school.

Clara sells tailoring materials and sarongs to make a living after her retirement as a civil servant. With the busy nature of her business she is happy seeing herself still useful to her family and able to contribute her share to the home as a wife and a mother. She does this to support her husband who is also a retired officer who has little or no income to support the family.

Clara hopes to expand her business in future. She is requesting for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more tailoring materials and sarongs to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials and sarongs to sell

loans.name: Lorenza Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Lorenza L. se dedica a la venta de refresco, gaseosas en el mercado la terminal. Elabora su refresco en su casa de 8 a 9 Am. Luego se traslada al mercado a su puesto de venta para ofertar su producto concluye su Trabajo a las 6:00pm.

 Este crédito que solicito es  para  comprar por mayor cantidad los  productos que vende  tales como: gaseosas, jugos, agua botella, y cacao, payana, azúcar, canela, frutas para elaboración de refrescos. Y  así tener mayor ganancia.

Cabe mencionar que la Señora L. esta agradecida por que sus créditos con ceprodel ya que le ha ayudado a crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Lorenza L. sells refreshments and sodas at the terminal market. She prepares the refreshments at home from 8-9am and later goes to her vending post at the market to sell her products until she is done working at 6pm.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy products in bulk that she will sell such as sodas, juices, and bottled water. She will also purchase cacao, soybeans, sugar, cinnamon, and fruit for preparing refreshments so that she can generate more revenue. It should be mentioned that Sra. L. is grateful for the loans from CEPRODEL which have helped her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sodas, juices, bottled water, and ingredients for making refreshments

loans.name: C6205 Twitezimbere Group

texts.en:
Rea is 50 years old and is married with three children who are 6, 10 and 24 years old. She is the president of a group called Twitezimbere. This group is commonly known in the business of selling foodstuffs such as bananas, beans, potatoes, etc. The group has been in this business for two years and the hours of the business are from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day except Saturday.

Rea and her team are requesting a Kiva loan which will be used to expand their business through purchasing a large quantity of foodstuffs so that they can even start wholesaling. Once they start wholesaling, they hope that their revenue will increase to the extent that they will be able to share the dividends and create a reserve for the financial stability of their business.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of foodstuffs

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace M. is from the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old and the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by GDMPC. With a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Grace is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Grace owns a fishing business where she sells primarily squid in the local community. Grace has been in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.  Grace has just joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first GDMPC loan, for 5,000 PHP, to purchase additional fish to sell.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda, a 44-year-old married woman from South Cotabato, Philippines, has three children, the eldest aged 21. In 2008, she started her hog-raising business and is also an Avon dealer. Erlinda says that she works hard because she wants her family to be happy. She wants to be able to provide for all the needs in her household, especially her children’s education. Erlinda is requesting a loan of Php15,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to buy feed for her pigs and hopefully an additional piglet to raise.

loans.use: Additional piglet and feed

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en: Oksana is divorced and has one child. For the last seven years, she has made a living selling women's tights at a small local market. Low prices and a large assortment of goods have made her business a success. Oksana would like to increase her sales by buying additional items to sell to her customers in the summer season, and has applied for a loan to make this possible. Her long-term goal is to open a second location at which she will be able to sell her goods.

loans.use: to buy more tights to sell to her customers

loans.name: Thol's Group

texts.en: Four people who are villagers in Ta Loek village in Kandal province make up a group loan. Mrs. Thol O. is a group leader, selected by the other members who will use a portiO. of the loan for different purposes. She is 52 years old. She and her husband, Mr, Chhen Soy, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice to support their family. Now they have a problem because their field is infertile. So to improve productiO., Mrs. Thol O. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed. According to this activity, they support two children, one of whom is a seamstress in garment factory, while the other is attending a local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for plowing and to purchase seeds

loans.name: Dionysius

texts.en:
Dionysius is a farmer from the town of Kisii in western Kenya. He has been farming for the past ten years and employs two people from his community. His main products are tea, milk, eggs, chicken, maize and beans which he sells locally. Apart from farming, he also operates a retail shop and a hotel (restaurant) in the same area.

Dionysius is 32 years old. He is married and blessed with two children aged 2 and 5.

Dionysius’s biggest challenges in farming have been the lack of a defined market for his products, a poor road transport network and debtors who are not creditworthy, thus affecting the growth of his business.

Dionysius recently completed his previous loan of KES 45,000 from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested this loan of KES 70,000 to purchase a dairy cow. The profits from this loan will enable him to pay school fees for his children and pay rent for his business premises.

In future, Dionysius plans to venture into a transportation business and, if possible, purchase a Canter (a Mitsubishi light-duty  commercial vehicle) to assist him in transporting cereals to the market. He is asking Juhudi for more funding in the future and asking Jehudi to diversify its loan products to include loans for school fees and top-up loans.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Julio Antonio

texts.es: El Joven Julio M., tiene  21 años de edad, es Soltero de oficios , Artesano “Elaboración de Cortes típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 2 Telares, habita junto a sus Papás, El sus papas se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados  para la misma actividad, lleva 8 años de Elaborar delantales en su residencia que se encuentra en Caserío la Libertad, actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar material para la tejeduria y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, para obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Julio M., 21, is single. He’s a craftsman. He manufactures women’s traditional clothing in a two-loom shop. He lives with his parents who are in the same occupation. They have two employees. He has been making aprons for 8 years in his home which is located in La Libertad. Demand has risen but the economic condition he finds himself in prevents him from increasing his capital. For this reason, he has called upon Asociación ASDIR to request a loan with the intention of buying weaving supplies so that he can increase sales thus obtaining higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy weaving supplies.

loans.name: Filomina

texts.en: Filomina T. owns and operates a store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in her community. She is 62 years old, married and has six grown-up children. They are from the village of Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. Filomina has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Filomina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Filomina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy T. T. H. was born in 1971. She has two children who go to school. She has a store in the market and has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 VND. She wants to earn more money to raise her children. 

Thuy has participated in SEDA since 2006. She borrowed a loan and repaid it punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8.502.000 VND to invest in her store.

loans.use: to invest in her store

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
Maria luz es casada y tiene 2 hijos que estudian en la universidad, Maria luz tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en  general, verduras, negocio que inicio hace 3 años y realiza con la ayuda de su hija. Además Maria luz trabaja en un hotel haciendo limpieza por las mañanas.
Maria luz es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Ayllu que significa Familia de Oro en quechua y lo que mas le agrada son las charlas sobre familia. Maria luz solicita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Maria luz sueña con tener una tienda grande en el centro de la ciudad y construir su casa de material noble porque actualmente su casa es de material rustico.
texts.en:
María Luz is married and has two children who are university students. She has a grocery store in her home where she sells assorted groceries and vegetables. She started the business three years ago and her daughter helps her tend to it. In addition, she is employed at a hotel as a cleaning lady during the mornings. María Luz is a member of the Ccori Ayllu, which means Golden Family in Quechua. What she enjoys most are the chats on the family. María Luz is asking for a 1000 sol loan to buy rice and sugar. She dreams with having a large store downtown and with building her house out of substantial materials because it’s currently made of flimsy materials.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar.

loans.name: Or

texts.en: Mrs. Or H. is a local farmer who owns a plot of farmland where she plants various crops to earn a living. This normally generates a formal income to manage her family's daily expenses. To help her with the hard labor required, Or H. also receives help in growing crops from her husband. Or H. has five children, two are married and the others are single. Three of her children are employed and provide a small income for the family. As Or H.’s crops are not growing well due to lack of fertilizer, she is taking out a loan to purchase fertilizers to improve her crop yields.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to improve her crop yields

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline S. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 38 years old, separated from her spouse, with five school-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline owns a sari-sari (variety) shop selling both food and daily-use products. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Evangeline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the first loan taken out by Evangeline from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: C5284 Imirasire Group

texts.en:
Felix is 45 years old and married with three children: the first one is 12 years old, the next one is 7 and the last one is 6 years old. Felix is a businessman who works for his family. Felix has 3 years of business experience and he employs one person as a helper. In addition, Felix is the leader of a group of six people who have different businesses. Most of them are women, except Felix, who is the group representative.

Felix and his group are requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand their businesses. He will purchase additional products such as beans, salt and rice for the store. With this loan, group members will be able to earn more profit to use for their families and in their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more products for their store

loans.name: Yelybeth

texts.es:
Yelybeth pertenece al banco comunal “Mosoc Killa” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad. Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos Incas. Construida en la base de la antigua ciudad Inca. 

Yelybeth tiene 23 años, es soltera y estudia la carrera profesional de Contabilidad, ella tiene un pequeño negocio de fotocopias, impresiones y tipeos en computadora en frente de la Universidad Nacional San Antonio Abad del Cusco. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ana María desprende una imagen de una joven trabajadora y responsable. Con su próximo préstamo, Yelybeth que espera recibir S/. 1500 nuevos soles. Por el momento,  desea incrementar el negocio y va comprar más productos de belleza. 

Yelybeth se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Yelybeth belongs to Asociación Arariwa's “Mosoc Killa” community bank in the city of Cusco.  She lives in the same city.  Cusco is a charming city which dates back to Inca times.  It was built on the site of the ancient Inca city.

Yelybeth is 23 years old.  She is single and is studying accountancy.  She has a small photocopying, printing and computer typing business opposite the Universidad Nacional San Antonio Abad del Cusco.  She has been in this business for several years and it is doing really well thanks to the great effort which she puts into her work.  Ana María is the very image of a hard-working and responsible young woman.  With her loan for 1,500 nuevos soles Yelybeth would like to increase her business and buy more products.

Yelybeth is grateful for the opportunity which she is being given with this loan and therefore pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To increase her business and buy more products

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 37 years old and is a single mother of two. For a living, she operates a general store where she stocks cereals and other food stuffs as well as household goods. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kes to buy cereals, sugar, flour, rice, soap, among other products. 

Her business is located in a busy and densely populated area, and the residents are her customers. She hopes to start a mini-supermarket in the future. Since joining Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to keep business records through training offered by the company.

loans.use: To buy cereals, sugar, flour, rice, soap, etc. for resale
